Moreover the movie failed to live up to the seriousness of the plot due to weak dialog, mediocre acting and the inclusion of characters that didn't bring anything to the movie and instead just padded the running time(Spiderman, vision, scarlet witch). This movie is overstuffed with characters like the black panther, ant man, vision, Hawk-eye etc.Hell i really don't understand why they couldn't add Thor and Hulk and just name it avengers 3.There is a Spiderman cameo in this where he shows his admiration for the avengers, cracks lame jokes and does his share in the battle at the airport and all of it just doesn't work at least for me.It angered how they reduced Spiderman to a mere fan of the avengers assemble when he is a more iconic character than them.Spideman was basically thrown into the movie for the sake of pleasing the fans. The new suit just looked digitally tailored and ridiculous and the cracking of jokes during n important battle just swept any tension for that event.Despite having hurdles of materials and weapons thrown against them, not a single member lost their life.The acting is pretty mediocre.Robert Downy Junior plays the same character he played in the previous films, only more restraint and with less depth.Scarlett Johnson is alright, though i never felt anything for her character.T supporting cast didn't add much to the movie. Chris Evans was just bland and had the same face throughout the entire movie.I never for once believed in his character and his performance didn't help the situation.The questions regarding the safety and security of people by their watchful guardians and how much of that authority is accountable is reduced to a simple answer of team iron man or captain America by the entire company with it's promotional trailers.In the end it didn't feel like best of friends cashing in rage due to indifference's during the final battle but instead felt like two emotionless robots fighting for the sake of building a battle.So While not a bad film in any ways civil war much like all marvel movies suffer from the overstuffed characters,bland performances as well as uninspiring film making techniques.The safe and generic approach of film making opted by the creators pretty much disqualified any artistic merit involved in the movie and at the end of the day it's basically a product meant to e consumed by the masses without any hesitation or effort, discounting everything that makes cinema grant.

Review title: Simply One Of THE BEST Marvel Movies
Review_body: 1)New Characters - Black Panther was truly amazing. Even though we didn't get his Comic-book powers in the movie, his close-hand combat was spot on. Spiderman was also very good. Been looking for the Spidey without all the drama and intense moments but rather the one (like in the comics) with the clichéd jokes and puns. Wade Wilson and Tony Stark move over, a new joker is in town! Can't wait for SPIDERMAN: HOMECOMING (July 28, 2017) & BLACK PANTHER (Feb 18, 2018).2)Story-line - Even though people are crying about the ending, I feel Marvel did a solid one on the whole story-line. They completely showed us how every thing turned to the civil war without jumping over important info unlike in some marvel Movies. The ending was a perfect set up for the Movie Black Panther. People wanted the other "WiNTER SOLDIERS" to fight the avengers but are you forgetting, there were only 4 people (Iron Man, Cap, Bucky & Black Panther) against the 5 Guys who beat Bucky easily. Also, Falcon and the others were in SUPER-SUPER-SUPER-MAX Prison so no Backup. I mean really?? Did y'all really think they had a chance?? The ending was good, NOTHING MORE! Moving ON,The past Marvel movies we've seen Black Widow & Captain America on one side and I feel it was a good thing for them to break up (even though it was for only half of the movie). It would have also been nice to see Falcon break up with Captain but what can we say, there must always be an ass- licker in the movie.3)Action - The action in this movie was totally impressive. This was seriously the first time I think Natasha Romanoff kicked ass that hard since the first Avengers. It is a good thing Vision and Wanda Maximoff didn't too get much action because their kinetic powers pretty much make them the most powerful and we would not want to watch people simply defeating each other by the waves of their hands. NOPE, we needed close combat and THANK YOU MARVEL for finally giving it to us. Even Tony was using his hand-to-hand (with the help of Friday) to fight. It was really interesting to see! It was disappointing than no one died but I don't think Rody will be back anytime soon. It's really gonna be interesting to see how Marvel will bring most of the Superheroes back into the movie Infinity Wars 1 & 2.Don't Leave Early, There Are Two Post Credit Scenes In This Movie Which Have Given Us A Glimpse Of The Upcoming Movies Black Panther and Spiderman: Homecoming.I nearly forgot the Stan Lee cameo. Can't be a good Marvel movie without one!! "Delivery for Tony Stank!"8.3/10

Review title: 8.2out of 10 And Watch out for spoilers
Review_body: Now after about 3000 arguments with random Instagram people and hours watching reviews and watching the movie I've decided to take my rating of 9 out of 10 To a 8.2. Captain America is a great movie it's has some fun parts but as a whole movie it doesn't really work but the fun parts are really fun. It's all makes sense why they do this and why they do that in airport scene no one is trying to kill because team iron mans plan is to just arrest them and team cap was to go beat up assassins. And how visions missing for half of fight scene because he's kind of in the middle and only got involved when he beloved he needed to. Zemo is developed enough and man driven by vengeance what else do you need to know like really the one thing I don't agree with is people calling him a weak villain his plan to turn them against each other would have probz been better if Tony killed Bucky but I didn't want anyone to die because thanos will be a massive threat and they need everyone . There's a lot going on in the movie and introduction to two knew characters which were amazing but this was kind of a test for the russos and every flaw they have in this will be perfected in infinity war first they only had to deal with cap widow fury and Sam but now they had all superheroes except 2 but for a first try they did great and I know infinity war is in good hands after seeing what they have done with this movie where they got to bring all avengers together.

Let me just start by saying I love Superheroes but have never been a big fan of Captain America - He is too much of a clean cut, charisma devoid, goody too shoes IMO. That said, I enjoyed the first Cap Film and both Avengers movies. I even praised the second Captain America film because, despite a couple of things it was a good film with lots of action and some awesome visual sequences.What spoiled it for me is exactly what spoiled Civil War too. The Winter Soldier himself. I accept the second movie was centered around him (hence The title) But, Captain America's unwavering efforts to rescue and re-establish his friendship with his psychotic, murderous ex-friend (despite the many deaths caused by him) was sickeningly repetitive and boring.Fast forward to Civil War, which I was really looking forward to (new characters joining the fray - wahoo) only to suffer the same fate again; seeing an otherwise great movie spoiled because it revolves around the winter soldier....again. Urrggghh! I mean: the Winter Soldier has even less personality than Captain America and that is truly an underwhelming experience to endure.After watching a superhero movie, I am usually excited, happy and hyped. After Captain America: Civil War I was quite angry, simply because I knew it could have been so much better!

I will keep this short and sweet - as a good fan of the marvel films this had to be one of the worst. As other reviewers have said there was too much to pack into 1 film and hence it was disjointed, dumbed down and frankly quite boring. I re watched the winter soldier the night before to refresh my memory and that was a great film likely from a great plot and simplicity of the low number of characters etc.This 3rd instalment was a bit of an pseudo avenger 3 mess with such a weak flimsy plot and an enemy you couldn't care less about.A few jokes wouldn't have gone amiss.Shame on the scriptwriter and directors.Normally not so aggrieved but had to quite literally apologise to the non marvel fans I went to the cinema with at it was that poor.

I like this movie so much because it makes the Avengers movies look bad. I wish it had less people but it makes it work because it's so well written. This is not the type of movie I want to smash. It's too good. So I like it a lot. I want Chris Evans to be mine and I want to keep his safe. He gets so much crap this movie. His friend does too. But he's not as cute. I want to see Civil War 2. Not Avengers 3. Does that make any sense because it might not. I really hope this kind of movie is what Marvel wants now because it is so much better than the old Marvel movies. I want to see this more.

This is a boy's superhero dream movie! I found a new admiration for Captain America as I have always been primarily a Spiderman fan. The action scenes were even better than expected, which is saying a lot. The only part I didn't care for was who they had cast for Spiderman and how they introduced Spiderman. Would have been incredible to have Tobey Macguire show up without introduction, but that's just me, so you lost two stars for that. And Marissa Tomei as Aunt May? Otherwise incredible fight scenes and good easy to follow plot. The fight scene at the end was one of the best fight scenes I can remember.

I was quite disappointed after watching the movie, it was not that satisfying or entertaining. Well, I can say it's a pretty good movie to watch, but it is not the movie I am going to watch it for second time. The actors, the scenes, the shots are definitely professional, but I am just bored by this kind plot. Multiple repetition of battle scene, really boring visual effects.It is a big let downs that the movie can't develop every character in it, there are way too much character to be in one movie. Some character just left out from the scene, barely making any appearance. There will be even more character in the upcoming sequel, and that is going to be difficult for them to develop each one of them. I really suggest the movie develop more on every each character, it is really weird when you just put a superhero there but then just left them out.

Civil War is truly one of a kind. 5/5 Stars. 100% flawless in my books. Need to see more classics like these. It's full of action, adventure humor, superb story-line and has an awesome twist. The best part of this movie is seeing the majority of the Marvel Crime Fighting Heroes kicking ass and "DUKING IT OUT" against each other. Reminds me of Super Smash Brothers for Nintendo. SWEEEEEETT!!!!

Firstly, you need to know that I'm a fan of Marvel, because they have unique characters and what I like the most is, that all meet each other in the end. Some earlier, some later. So they created a whole new universe which is incredible. Although they started mixing heroes together with the Avengers movies, they continued here with putting for example Ant-Man, Spiderman and the new hero Black Panther in. But now to the movie itself: I'm also a fan of dramatically scenes and obviously the movie had a lot in it and I'm #TeamIronMan, because Stark's kinda right about the whole situation and tried to get the best for the team and Cap shouldn't have that over reacted, but that's just my opinion. I also loved Starks Suit, it was really well done by the special effects team. I wished, he'd had this suit in Spiderman Homecoming or Infinity War, but unfortunately it got destroyed by Cap. Also the story line is really good in my opinion and it makes it even more interesting to see Infinity War, because they need to re-unite first before they can defeat Thanos.
The worse Avengers movie, the stupidiest script ever.

Review title: Worst 'Villan' sentiment of all the franchise- really killed the whole theme
Review_body: Okay. So the movie generally was good and action great- BUT the villain motives and sentiment ?!? Come on marvel what was that?!.. you got some guy, very undeveloped and unparticular back story: upset about an Avengers accident that resulted in the death of his family, and so then for 10 years he plots for a deep way to tear them apart intrinsically causing this whole civil war?!?!!!? OMG. Really?! Come on Mavel you could do better than that. Find a bad guy who spends so much effort in tearing them apart because he is genuinely BAD not over a petty, impersonal accident that happened to him (and thousands of other segovians!). Like Blah. This could have been a 10/10 if not for that lame, sucky, out of place sentiment & motives that just doesn't amount to the Captain America story or Marvel Characters.

Review title: One of the best MCU films ever
Review_body: This movie has both the intense comic-book action expected of a Marvel movie and complex character conflict. (MILD SPOILERS) It is centered around the Sokovia Accords, which gives complete control over the Avengers to the UN, and how it splits them into two teams, Team Cap and Team Iron Man. Iron Man, who helped create the Accords, believes that, as he puts it, they "need to be put in check," while Captain America believes that a) the UN, and the government, are "run by people with agendas," and that b) - when it comes to safety, "the safest hands are still their own." Basically that the UN might use the Avengers for their own doing, and that the UN isn't going to know about every threat. I can see both sides to this argument, and don't 100% agree with either, although I'd probably say I lean towards Iron Man. The film also acts like your traditional sequel, as it continues the Winter Soldier's and Captain America's character arcs from Winter Soldier (which is also excellent) by having Cap go after him and try to help him be Bucky again. Overall, great action, great plot, great characters, great film.

Review title: Very good movie on flawed premise.
Review_body: The only spoiler here is what you've seen in the trailers. The world doesn't want rogue Avengers having freedom to go anywhere, do anything. However, the whole issue is collateral damage done when the examples the political leaders show are minute in regards to the possible outcome. A huge space worm going to destroy a major city? Aliens coming to enslave and kill? Well, you ended up killing scores of people or even hundreds against possible extermination. The other examples weren't even caused by Avengers but only stopped by them at much less loss of life. So the reasoning behind controlling them is weak. But if you put it in the view of political leaders wanting control over them for political power, then you have a better motive.Aside from that the movie does a great job of weaving the stories of all the heroes and their entrances into the film. Action is as you would expect along with humorous lines (though much more subdued in this version). I also didn't like the bad guy as others have stated. I don't know if it's because he reminds me of Tobey Maguire on valium or his acting but I found him irritating.But overall a good entry in the library and as much character interaction as battle action.

I have to say i do enjoy these pop corn flick's but some characters really bore the pants of me! captain america for starters! all i can say is thank god for ANT-MAN loved the part he had in this film!
This movie is one of the best marvel movies made because of the badass action scenes

Civil War is a masterpiece. And in my opinion the best marvel movie. Just like get out I watched this movie when it came out in theaters and I still love it. Captain America and iron man had been in a good amount of films and had dealt with their hardships. So when this movie came along there decisions have a purpose. This movie has some qualities that I wish more movies had. It has really good dialogue. Characters sit down and talk and it just feels organic than usual. It's mostly because of the energy the Captain America movies have. This movie makes these characters feel real and that's awesome because it gives the universe a nice change of pace. There are other great stuff. Great acting. Great script. Has some of the best action. If I could think of any issues I would say the music. I don't like how marvel changes the score of the films, people made videos of that. I also really don't like the shaky cam it's a headache. The villains plan is also pretty dumb and complicated. But these problems aren't too bad so I can let go of them. This is the movie that made me a marvel fan so I have a huge attachment for it.

Russo's Winter Soldier was a successful attempt in blending a superhero blockbuster into a political action film that is relevant in today's politics with privacy vs security. They took another crack at it again by blending registration vs freedom. Iron Man and Captain America are on polar opposites fo the issue with Bucky in the middle. The other characters involved in the movie made it feel like an Avengers movie but there is no doubt that it centers on Captain's point of view. It is amazing that Russo has maintain this tether while including the many characters and not feel oversaturated. They are the right directors for the Avengers film.

Marvel has done some movies which are good, like Ironman series, but this just gets out of any scale of how trash can movie be. I got it, superheroes are superheroes, but this movie is absolute terrible to watch. It's all about fighting in a superhero style which for me as an adult gives anything, not even amusement, just pathetic shameful use of Digital effects. Just putting on a costume transforms human to a rubberized muppet which can take anything. Stopped watching after 45 minutes.

Review title: Great for MCU, off topic for comic books
Review_body: This movie and story line fit into the MCU well. I enjoyed it when it first came out, and I enjoy it now, really appreciating the character and relationship developments several years later.
A super heroes movie that show us the other side of being a hero.

Review title: War breaks out but is it at all civil (possible spoilers)
Review_body: I will start this off by saying the last two comic book movies that have come out B v. S and Deadpool have disappointed me.Now with that being said lets move onto this one. I have always liked the Captain America movies I think they are the true crown jewel to the MCU (Marvel Comic or character Universe). Chris Evans does a great job playing the patriotic yet humble Steve "Captain America" Rogers. While we get Robert Downey Jr. back as the egotist Tony Stark.I do not feel that Tony Stark added to much to this film it seems like his snide and ego just get bigger and bigger. He never learns anything about being the douche he is. But, some of the best things that happen in this film are the introduction of T'Challa a.k.a Black Panther I was very excited to see him on the screen this being a character that goes back to my youth.I thought he was treated respect and how wrote and treated the character.I really do not want to say to much about this movie because I want you to discover it for yourself

Best comic book movie ever? Yeah, right.Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice was a far better film than Captain America: Civil War.Zemo was completely underused in this film. In the comics, he was a very manipulative man, like in the film, but is a very skilled fighter and can go toe-to-toe and hold his own against Captain America. In this, he was basically a terrorist, who was out for revenge. Very original. With Lex Luthor in BvS, he wanted to destroy Superman, both physically and mentally, and he wanted absolute power with it as well. They wasted the potential for Zemo in this film.The story overall was very well done, like it's predecessor, The Winter Soldier, but it could've been so much better. It didn't feel like Civil War, it felt more like a school yard brawl. The action sequences were great though. I loved them, but action doesn't make a film great. They barely touched on the original storyline, and just took the title, "Civil War", and slapped it under Captain America. Like Marcel Tim said, "Should have called this Winter Soldier 2 to be honest." In BvS, Lex made Superman look more like a threat to Batman. That was better executed than Zemo in this film.It seems Marvel/Disney is coughing up money to the critics and give this film acclaim. What every critic is saying about Civil War are complete exaggerations. I think MCU films are losing steam.

Review title: The Russo brothers did it again!
Review_body: Wow, "Captain America: Civil War" is amazing. It lives up to the hype (91% Rotten Tomatoes, 8.5 IMDb). I loves that it takes time to develop the characters. Even though there are like 50 super heroes, each one is given a scene to give them a place. More drama than super hero movie. Very smart dialogue, cinematography, action scenes. There are stakes on both sides of the fight. I was geeking out over some of the character interactions we got to see. It's almost like one of those great season 3 or 4 episodes of GoT (with the number of characters). Really, the Russo brothers directed "You, Me, and Dupree?." How.9/10 or 10/10. I'll have to see it again to confirm. My ranking of the 13 MCU movies right now: 1. Captain America: Civil War Perhaps I'll cool down on my love for this movie... or I just love the Russo brothers' direction style. 2. Captain America: The Winter Soldier 3. The Avengers. So much fun. 4. Guardians of the Galaxy. Forget about the great fun of action scenes and characters, but the dialogue alone is perfect. Feels like I'm watching an episode of "Archer" or "Arrested Development." 5. Thor. Very underrated. The cinematography is great by Kenneth Branagh (director). Best part is of course the Loki story. By far the best developing of a MCU villain. 6. Iron Man This is where it gets hard for me. Downey Jr has so much swag in this movie. Great introduction, but I feel like it stole so much from "Batman Begins." Jeff Bridges is also a very poor villain IMO. 7. The Avengers: Age of Ultron A fun, good movie. I expected more, but it was still good. 8. Captain America: The First Avenger. Good introduction to Cap, but it has the overall Joe Johnston (director) middling director feel to it. 9. Ant Man. The "Ok, it was good. Not great, not bad... just good." 10. Iron Man 3. The Mandarin twist still pisses me off. Also, the Iron Man suits are all of a sudden plastic junk? 11. The Incredible Hulk. I remember REALLY liking the first 1/3 of the movie + Norton is good. 12. Thor 2. The Loki drama is fun, but Malekith is the most flat villain you'll ever see. Typical/ boring plot. 13. Iron Man 2. Downey Jr is great, but poor plot and villain (Ivan Vanko).

I pretty much like or love all the Marvel Studios movies, starting with Iron Man through last year's Ant-Man. So there was virtually no chance I wouldn't enjoy Civil War. But this might be my favorite Marvel movie yet. So many characters are in it, yet I felt like every one of them got at least one memorable moment, even lame ol' Hawkeye! At the end of Act 2, there's a 20-minute battle scene that involves a dozen super-heroes, and it's amazing, probably the best of this genre. I went in rooting 100% for Cap, but by the end, I was feeling really badly for Iron Man and kinda wanted to see him kick Steve Rogers' butt. We get a couple of new heroes – Spider-Man and the Black Panther – and they are both just about perfect translations from comic book to film. This Brit they have playing Peter Parker is probably my favorite Spidey yet, even though he's only on screen for maybe 15 minutes. He's exactly as Spidey should be: a nervous kid who handles his anxiety by being a nonstop motormouth during his battles. And the Panther is just so cool. Ant-Man plays a big part in that huge battle I mentioned, getting some of the best moments during the fight. But really, this movie is Cap's, Bucky's, and Tony's story. What helps make it so great is how Marvel has built up their saga over multiple movies – we're already familiar with and invested in these characters. And the filmmakers use that to great advantage here. It's sad to see them pitted against each other, but completely understandable in the context of the film. Bottom line: if you've enjoyed some or all of the Marvel movies, you'll have a great time with Civil War. It's a blast! And it might even draw a tear or two

Review title: Visually appealing action, but lacks in everything else.
Review_body: Captain America : The Civil War is the most awaited superhero movie for all Marvel and superhero's movies fans, but sadly for me, it failed as what it was supposed to be.The movie is about the separation of the Avengers, where Captain America and Iron Man are fighting about an idea, the one where the government wants them to hide and wait for orders before acting. Though it is a serious subject and the two team leaders tries to prove their points, the movie never really goes far enough about this idea. Captain America : The Civil War is a 2 hours and 30 minutes of nothing much happening and where the story will be forgotten.It is mostly about Iron Man more than Captain America the the point where it doesn't feel like a Captain America movie like the 2 first ones.Most of the credits of the movie goes towards the few actions scenes there are in the movies, they were well cut and explosives, though they don't feel like there are anything threatening to both teams. I appreciate the use of most of all the Avengers members and most of them shows good use of they're powers, props to Ant-Man and Spider-Man, they had good surprises. Overall, each actions scenes doesn't feels like a menace or anything, you don't fear for any characters and there are not a lots of emotions. There are evens some characters that are joking in the battlefield while fighting they're friends, it just doesn't feel serious and break the image of the "war" that is implied.In the end, Captain America : Civil War feels like a useless entry to the MCU, there is not much things happening in between the action scenes and it feels like a 2h30 introduction to the next MCU movie, probably the next Avengers. Fans will love seeing they're favourites heroes fighting, but there is not any depths at all and was felt unsatisfactory when the credits started rolling. The movie felt long, but I was still surprised when the credits appeared because nothing was felt accomplished in the end. It is probably one of the weakest Marvel movie after the first Avengers. Lets hope The Black Panther can do better.

Review title: Great movie but without game of throne balls
Review_body: Great movie with awesome action, spot on humor and a great cast. The only problem I have is that I feel absolutely nothing. I already know that no one is going to die even if they have 20 heroes fighting at the same time. Its entertaining but it lack real tension.I would love if they at some point grow a pair and lets say goo-die tush Capatain A kill Iron man in the end. That I would have felt and it would create great ripples in future movies.However, its still a great ride and I got what I paid for. Maybe next time they will surprise me and make me feel something, but probably not.Sorry for my crap English but I think you got it!

Review title: Cheesy, Below mediocre, Over-hyped by young marvel fan-boys and total waste of Money
Review_body: So i managed to grab the ticket for advance screening of CA:CW yesterday and now i decided to write a review to save people from it. Listen, don't pay attention to the delusional paid critics and Marvel young fans giving this i-don't-know-if-i-should-even-call-this-a-CBM ratings higher than the Godfather and TDK. I say again those are shallow and deluded fan boys. The movie was below mediocre at best like most of the Marvel movies out there. Batman v Superman was for sure a better film with more in depth character development, something to connect to and the movie actually made me care for the characters and the entire story line towards the JL scenario. Well i went to see Civil war with high expectations after the hype Russo brothers created for it. I was expecting more than cheesy fight scenes but all in all as they promised it would be 'darker' than the other movies by Marvel, but guess what, everything bad is still there and way too much cheesy dialogue that takes away the intensity of the action. If you're a casual movie goer, this movie may be somewhat enjoyable, but comic book fans beware, they butchered one of the most iconic story arcs by marvel even praised by the DC fans around the world. Batman v Superman was a couple steps up in many areas but civil war had absolutely no moment that made you use your brain or to think about. It's mainly just mindless action with dialogue as filler the first half is just boring dialog and some flashbacks to make it look interesting, the other half is the main characters taking on each other more emotionally like whiny school boys "i don't wanna fight you but you made me do it" which is an extreme disappointment it will no doubt do well because as everyone can see how Disney paid the critics to give it a rating of 100% and 8+ score even before the actual worldwide release. Chris Evans surely improved as CA but my favorite was Crossbones, Black Panther had the minimum screen time as compared to other characters, Spidey was somewhat interesting but the animated + poor cgi was such a let down and towards the end it felt like RDj was trying his best to carry on with this miserable plot but unfortunately one A list actor isn't always able to push the bad plot and writing towards the success. My thoughts after i walked out of the screening: Totally forgettable like DP, Terrible, overrated and plain boring. It's obvious the critics were paid shills this movie was just awful. Because all the characters. Like all Disney made marvel movies the characters lack any kind of development. Also to make audience feels more connected towards the 'Darkness' of the plot, there's a funeral in there attended by Steve Rogers but they miserably failed due to the cheesy dialog afterward. Not that there seems to be much danger of that happening. Whatever is going on there never seems to be any jeopardy for the characters among all the CGI. In the end instead of the CA's sequel it felt more like unfinished Avengers 2.5 minus the Thor and uh never mind.

I'm literally writing this 30 minutes after I walked out of my local cinema, and I'm still shocked.After Dawn of Justice was... less than well received, it gave Marvel an amazing chance to leap even further ahead of DC in the "superhero war" and boy did they take that chance.I'm gonna jump straight in with a bold statement. Captain America: Civil War is in the Top 3 Superhero Movies of all time. Probably the best from the MCU, and given the likes of Winter Soldier and Guardians, that's quite a feat.So what was so great about it? The plot was extremely well structured, which should be a given but after the mess that was Dawn of Justice, it's refreshing to see such a well tied together story in a major superhero movie.The characters are all amazing, and there's a few surprises along the way too. As expected, Spider-Man hit it out of the park, as did Black Panther, but the star of the show (in my opinion, anyways) was Falcon. Every line he said was absolute gold, the stunts from him were all amazing, and while he was less than spectacular in Ant-Man, Age of Ultron and Winter Soldier, we're finally starting to see some great potential in a minor superhero, and if Steve Rogers is killed off in Infinity War, I can think of no-one better to carry on his legacy. Also, honourable mentions to Bucky Barnes, Hawkeye and Ant-Man, for also putting on a great show.Any negatives? The editing seemed a tad sloppy in places and in action scenes the camera shook a lot, but why even bother caring about minor details like that, when the movie all-around is exceptional.I can't see anything beating Civil War for film of the year in 2016, though I hope I'm wrong because I have high hopes for Suicide Squad.The future of Marvel movies looks to be in good hands!

I'm extremely disappointed in this film.Marvel's films have always been bordering on the silly, what I like to think of as "impossibly plausible". But so much of this film frankly falls into the categories of "ridiculous" and "seriously??"The film has a paper-thin plot, and is just an excuse for two cinematic icons to go head to head in a penis-measuring contest. The dialogue is hammy and I have no emotional attachment to any of the new heroes. Black Panther is a total bore, Spiderman is an attention seeking hyperactive tool and Vision has nothing to add to the film. But it is our old favourite Captain America who takes the cake with his reasons for not signing the Accord.Long story short, Iron Man vs Captain America. Iron Man is part of what I think of as the Superhero Police. Captain America doesn't want to be held accountable for his actions, so does not sign the treaty. Cap recruits people to his cause, because he himself does not agree with 117 countries. Cap thinks he is above the law and is branded a criminal alongside his accomplices. His accomplices (bar Winter Soldier) get arrested and held in a super-duper superhero prison for their crimes. Iron Man finds out Winter Soldier murdered his parents. Iron Man gets upset. Cap tells Iron Man he knew. Iron Man flies into a rage (fairly understandable, I think). Iron Man takes on Winter Soldier and Cap. Iron Man disables Winter Soldier, Cap disables Iron Man's electromagnet. Cap and Winter Soldier walk off into the sunset and break their superhero friends out of prison.At the end of the day, Captain America is a terrorist. Make no mistake. The dictionary definition of terrorism:1. the use of violence and threats to intimidate or coerce, especially for political purposes. 2. the state of fear and submission produced by terrorism or terrorization. 3. a terroristic method of governing or of resisting a government.1. Cap uses his relationship with his friends to coerce them to fight for him, because his political agenda does not agree with 117 countries. 2. Cap uses his friends to start mass panic in various countries across the globe. 3. Cap and his friends use their powers to fight Iron Man's superhero police, resisting the Accords.I've never much liked Captain America, but this film makes him, by definition, a terrorist.Captain America: the Terrorist.

Review title: Comic reliefs perhaps is good for third graders...
Review_body: Comic reliefs perhaps is good for third graders. Give us more movies like watchmen or dark knight that treat hero plots like grown ups and don't cut the drama with cheap laugh ...the potential drama is intriguing, but falls short due to cheap laughs inserted at any give time.what movies like watchmen and nolans dark knight got right in terms of drama and deadpool got right in terms of humor for mature audiences are both shortcomings of this otherwise entertaining flick. but because of this it fails falls short of innovation and excelling in any other way that than CG

Review title: Expected so much more from the movie (spoiler)
Review_body: couldn't really give it more than 6 .. since I'm a big fan of Marvel and i waited so much from this movie.. watched Hulk all movies .. iron man 1,2 & 3, Thor, avengers 1 & 2 .. all in my opinion had a great story. great build up .. but for this movie are u for real.. the big fight scene could have been evaded if just captain America and winter soldier simply take the freaking plane without letting any1 notice ... also iron man was so out of his mind ... i mean what the freaking what .. anyhow .. the film was much much that what i expected .. i was with 3 friends .. 1 friend found it OK .. one friend found it boring .. one friend found it sucks .. i found it was an OK movie ... nothing like BvS .. i couldn't blink in that movie .. not knowing what would happen ... here everything was pretty predictable ...

Review title: Its Captain America 3, Not Civil War
Review_body: So I finally saw Captain America: Civil War. I liked it. And thanks everyone for not spoiling anything. I'll only say this. From here on out, it's Captain America 3. Not Civil War. Great movie, just not the right subtitle. ***SPOILER*** So basically, I'm not even going to talk about what was in the film that WAS NEVER in the 7-Part Civil War series and you'll see why. I'm going to talk about what was in the film that was in the comic. A mother of a boy who died in a superhuman event gives Tony Stark a guilt trip. And...done. There it is. And they even got that wrong. I like the movie, it just should have just been titled something else. Oh, and the frame at the end of the Cap/Iron Man battle where he deflects the repulsor beams with his shield. That was taken from the 7th and final comic of the series. It was the cover. Literally every single other angle, plot, villain, character reveal, and scene was created original for the film. Its Captain America 3. Its not Civil War. Its like making a movie about Exodus from the Bible and calling it Revelations.

Review title: One of the best super heroes movies of all time...
Review_body: Captain America trilogy must be one of the best trilogies ever made. I am not a big fan of sequels, and usually the sequels do not outperform their predecessors, in my humble opinion. There are a few rare exceptions of course, like Captain America: Civil War for instance. After the disastrous Batman vs Superman that left a bitter aftertaste, time had come for something more refreshing and engaging, and I must say that Captain America Civil War delivers the goods. It has everything one would expect from a movie...dynamic superheroes with awesome abilities, story, momentum, and the question we ask as to what happens next, which keeps our attention on the big screen. I watched this in the theater and not a soul stirred during the 2.5 hour duration of the movie. All the characters in this movie played out their roles with precision and realism. The fight scenes are excellent (at times funny) as each superhero is matched up against someone else but the seriousness of the fight scenes builds to a crescendo which leaves us with a very satisfying climax to the movie. I have seen most of the Marvel movies in recent years but this by far is one of the best superhero movies ever. You might want to watch Captain America: The Winter Soldier again as this is somewhat of a continuation of where that movie left us off. Overall, I give this movie a deserved 10/10 as this is of the best super hero movies.

To all you 1 rating people out thereI haven't seen this film yet but saw the rating of 8 and it certainly looks like it will very likely be a good movie......the critic reviewsare also very good....so therefore the likelihood that this movie is a "1" is very far from likely.I rarely ever write reviews but am compelled to say this as all you 1 rating people are very stupid because people will generally ignore you as it's clearly not a 1 movie!!SO PLEASE STOP RUINING THE SCORE AVERAGE!Derr

This is without a doubt, the best film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe at the moment. Usually, I require a re-watch to decide on how great the film truly is, however, with Civil War, the initial screening was more than enough.Everything from the story to the action sequences were executed brilliantly. The Russo's did a fantastic job fitting all these characters into a powerful and entertaining film. Not a single character felt unnecessary or out of place, with each one adding to the overall point of the plot. Speaking of characters, I won't spoil too much but Black Panther was unbelievably awesome. Chadwick Boseman nailed the African accent and his reasons/morals for being involved in the story were very compelling. Then of course, there is the much anticipated Spider Man. The characters introduction to the MCU was always going to be a tricky one but unveiling Peter Parker in this film were both well-timed and incredibly refreshing. If there was one type of character arc the MCU needed, it was a young, out of place individual. Tom Holland executed his role to perfection. It is clear from his (surprisingly non-brief appearance) that Peter is still unclear on what it really means to be an enhanced "superhero", while still maintaining the character's smart, comedic nature.Many similarities can be drawn from the Russo's previous Cap film especially with the fighting style and preference to less CGI usage. Seriously, if there is one thing that can spoil a good story, it is the over-usage of CGI. There are some standout hand-to-hand combat scenes that will blow you away, very similar to Cap and Winter Soldiers fight scenes in the previous film. Just be prepared to see much MUCH more of them in this film.Overall, this is an absolutely fantastic film and gives a lot more to think about regarding the future of the franchise. It is safe to say that with the Russo's on board, Infinity War will be spectacular and less hurried and overcrowded which was the case with Age of Ultron.Captain America Civil War will highly satisfy Marvel fans and most definitely entertain the casual movie-goer. I will definitely be seeing it again and pre-ordering the Blu-ray version. Oh, and please stick around for the post-credit scenes (notice how I said SCENES!), they are very important to the story line and quite awesome as well.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! 10/10

Review title: Well done. If only selling was not more important than respecting the audience.
Review_body: The movie is great, it's at same level as an Avengers movie, really cool. I was enjoying it fully, until guess what... WORST SPIDER-MAN EVERRR! Andy Garfield, we miss you. This Spider-Man has no appeal as Peter Parker, the costume is ugly, and adds ZERO elements to the plot. They could have included any other Marvel's character, instead, like Wasp or Spider-Woman. But no, they had to trash a previous saga that was going great to insert Spider-Man to the Avengers (another bad move, by SONY). With all and all, the movie is neat and full of action. I want to see it again, it's worth it. Kudos for Black Panther, Vision, Scarlett Witch and Falcon.

A little disappointed that the theater I went to see this in 3D was not working. Still enjoyed the story line and the action. I'm on Team Iron man. It was great to see the new Avengers and the surprise visit from another one of my favorites. I haven't missed a Marvel movie since they started, this was another good one. It lived up to the hype. My two guests and I enjoyed it. Will go again to see it in 3D. The Black Panther appears to be a great addition to the Avengers Squad. The Disney/Marvel collaboration is working out real well. When will we see or will we see Black Widow in her own movie? And we now have another Spider Man? Will the Hulk ever return?

I have to admit that my expectations weren't very high on this movie. Although the interesting trailer, I always thought it will be the same like with the Age of Ultron, few good moments in kind of boring movie. I have never been so wrong in my life.In my opinion, this movie has good action moments, with the pinch of humor in right moments (I'll never forget car scene with Cap, Bucky and Falcon). And, once again, Marvel hit the spot with the choice of actors. Chadwick, Tom and Daniel rightfully took place side to side with the rest of the excellent standard crew. Also, Paul Rudd as Ant Man fitted like a puzzle in Team Cap.Not to lie, there were some moments which were a little bit too long and made you think Oh, come on already". Exactly for this reason I gave 9/10, because I couldn't wait the second after credits because I had to go to the bathroom. But, overall impression is positive and I would watch it again soon. Team Cap FTW!

This movie is hands down the best in the MCU, the fight sequences are even better than Winter Soldier. Although leaving the cinema leaves you empty feeling with its rushed ending.After seeing what critics gave BvS and Civil War, THEY ARE NOT TO BE TRUSTED. They hated the flashbacks of Batman's parents, two (very) short ones but have no trouble seeing flashbacks and clips from Iron Man's parents around 4 times. They don't like the death of Superman or his funeral, but Peggy Carter (a useless side character) deserves an entire funeral scene. Tony Stark is completely neutered, after Pepper and him are having some trouble and a woman blames him for her sons death, he then believes the Avengers need to be locked down... although Batman fighting crime for 20+ years and seeing those close to him die isn't enough for a man to give up his no killing rule? Critics hate Snyder for the destruction in MoS and BvS even though it's justified but the destruction in Civil War is justified somehow when just friends are trying to K.O. each other. Baron Zemo/Lex Luthor push the heroes towards fighting. Lex believing Superman is too powerful and should be killed, after the countless dead in MoS isn't as good as Baron wanting the Avengers dead after his family is killed in Age of Ultron. I'll admit there is much more humor in Civil War but that's mostly Spider-Man, but is that really enough to give it a +65% higher rating on RT? I honestly loved both films, but the fights in Civil War are just entertaining, in BvS they are intense - you fear for your heroes. After Civil War you have nothing to talk about, except how critics are biases. After BvS there is so much left to debate, how Superman will come back, the usual how Superman went easy on Batman etc. BvS>Civil War

Review title: This may be the worst addition to the MCU yet
Review_body: So Disneys: Marvels: Avengers: Captain America: Civil War was basically a pile of garbage. The fight scene with Spidey and Ant Man and the introduction of Black Panther were the only real redeeming factors.It failed as a movie and it failed as an adaptation of the comic series. One thing that really made me think that it failed as an adaptation is that while I sided with Stark in the comics, I can't help but to side with Captain America in the movie. If the adaptation was even vaguely faithful or decent my opinion should have stayed unchanged.But ignoring the original work, because the movie has to be judged on its own merits as well, it was pretty darn bad. The funeral scene was so cheesy, out of place and just bad that I actually briefly considered walking out. I couldn't believe I'd spent so much money to see this movie at the theatre.My opinion of this movie would probably be quite a bit better if they actually had the guts to kill off a single character in Civil War. When nobody is going to die and we all know it, all the drama and suspense are just instantly gone. It immediately goes from watching a tense battle sequence that could change the whole cinematic universe to a pretty light show.And the big climactic battle between Iron Man, Captain America and Bucky in Civil War was so dark you can't tell what's going on for half of the scene. That is a cardinal sin in film making. If you can't tell what the heck is happening, the scene is pointless and uninteresting.I obviously have a lot more gripes with this 250 million dollar mistake but I don't feel like writing an essay and nobody would read a review that long and detailed anyway. It would probably take longer for me to explain all of the issues I had with the film than it would for you to just watch it and decide for yourself, but I can't say I'd recommend doing that.This is perhaps the worst entry into the MCU, barring only The Incredible Hulk. This movie was so bad I'd even rank it under Thor 2 and Captain America: The First Avenger in the ever-growing list of Marvel missteps.

Review title: Exactly what you expect it to be **spoilers**
Review_body: Civil War did what Disney MCU do well to their usual standard. I took my daughter to see it as she's a big fan of the franchise and I'll go and watch anything comic book related. She loved it, I thought it was alright.As an MCU film it gives you some cool new characters, a conflict between the two main heroes and 1 exceptional action set piece. There's tons of humor and the action is bombastic so it's exactly what you expect from these films. If that's what you are into, you won't be disappointed. Spidey's cool, Black Panther's cool and Aunt May is hot.Now if I remove it from its franchise and view it as a film in itself it falls completely on its arse. The opening scene is shot with so much shaky cam and speeding up of frames that it looked like a benny hill sketch. Honestly, I wouldn't have been surprised if the Benny Hill theme started playing it was that silly. I also hated how badly they screwed over Cross Bones here. There was absolutely no need for that character to become Cross Bones and killing him off has wasted a potentially great villain for the punisher series. Maybe it's a merchandising thing, I don't know, but it seemed really stupid.The whole film was full of forced relationships. Considering they've had numerous films to get us to this point you'd think there would be some gravity to how these characters interact with each other, but it's nothing but smart arse comments and supposed emotional responses that make little sense; such as Steve smooching the Shield agent or the Wanda / Vision interactions which felt even more forced than the laughable scarjo / hulk relationship in AOU. They throw in war machine for no other reason than I guess to up the diversity quota and give us what is I imagine is supposed to be an emotional moment when the super intelligent android shoots him out of the sky. Seriously, why not kill him? Hes pointless in the MCU and it would have at least given us more of a reason for Stark to become psychotic at the end.Now, the airport fight – it looks amazing and all of the heroes get their time to shine, each having a little set piece to show them off. It's exactly what you expect to see in a comic book movie and they do it well, but ruin it with consistent "banter". It's like the character fighting don't actually care about the violence they're inflicting on their supposed friends and colleagues and neither do the audience because there are no stakes here. That for me is a major issue with the MCU, and something that is massively highlighted in Civil War – they approach this mega violence with such a glib attitude and an over concern about doing "cool stuff" that what is supposed to be a heart wrenching tense battle is instead turned into barrage of jokes as if none of the characters actually care that they're killing their friends. That, for me, is something the DCEU has gotten spot on so far – the violence is abhorred in the franchise, always questioned and never glorified. Now I'm no vegan, but if you're going to try and make one of the main themes of your film the effect that superhero violence has on the world it is happening in, you should maybe not have your heroes joking about while gleefully destroying an international airport. The whole issue of collateral damage seemed incredibly forced here and was instantly forgotten in the third act and left completely unresolved.The final fight between Tony, Bucky and Cap felt unnecessary, and after the highs of the airport fight was sluggish and underwhelming. Tony acted like a moron, but I was impressed by how he was all of a sudden capable of fighting off two super soldiers at the same time. Power level consistency has always been an issue with the MCU and nothing has changed here. I might have missed something here too, but it seemed odd that it was just Tony going after Cap – why didn't Vision go after him? Where did Spidey go? Did Tony just ditch a 15 year old kid in Germany? Anyway, had they not just dropped the whole "sign the accord" plot then maybe Tony might have had some company on his mission. And Cap ditching his shield – so what? Tony blew up all of his suits at the end of IM3 and was seen there dicking about in a brand new one in the first scene of AoU. I fully expect the next cap film to start with him windmilling a new shield around with his dick. There are no stakes here, and therefore no tensions, and that makes it really boring unless you're just caught up in the visual spectacle of it all.I won't talk about the villain because there's not really anything to talk about. Boring, inexplicably funded and cast aside in favour of a final showdown between our two heroes.They gave pretty much the whole film away in the trailers too, so if you're expecting some cool action scenes that you haven't seen yet, don't.Finally, as a fan of the Civil War story in the comics, this is a massive let down. Its so far off that story that calling it civil war seems like a really cheap marketing move and it upsets me that we'll never see that story on film because they rushed to it here.Anyway – TL;Dr – it's a good MCU film. If you go in expecting something more, then it's your fault for being disappointed.

Captain America Civil War is a great movie. There was a lot of things to love about this Film. The action was awesome, Story was well done and the new characters introduced were great...but it seemed like this film was a big advertisement for the newly introduced characters and their next films. Spiderman was awesome, but when you think about why he is even involved, you kind of draw a blank. And yes this film does suffer from having to many characters in it. Although it's a Cap sequel, it does feel like an avengers film. Once again the Villain in the film was weak, this film would've been fine without the villain being in it to be honest. The stakes were high through out the film, but i felt like one of the big named avengers had to die in order for those stakes to pay off, and i feel like that is what holds Marvel films back at the moment, is that they are not willing to make those sort of big calls. All in all a qood film to take the family along.

I love this movie, This was freaking awesome spider-man was amazing Tom Holland as was prefect casting he make me laugh and was bad ass. Chadwick Boseman was prefect casting Black Panther he was serious and bad ass. Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. best duo of movie ever history. Review title: Predictable (Don't read unless you want to know what happened)
Review_body: Captain America: Civil War is very well done movie especially with action scenes. I mean who doesn't love Chris Evans showing off his muscles? My only issue was that awful white fonts that appears every time we go to a new place or used for flashback. It's distracting and there is far better option for that font to display the location or time. Otherwise, it is good with some annoying aspect of the story plot. It's predictable. Like hey, Iron man and Captain America disagree on political issue of how the Avengers should proceeds. Then Captain America goes off and becomes wanted man because of what he believes in. Tony Stark is stubborn to see his side of thing so he goes become conceited. Boom, there's a huge fight. Yikes, Stark is humbled now because he found out the truth. He goes help out Bucky and Captain America. Crap, he just found out that his parent was killed by Captain America's best friend, Bucky that wasn't even himself. So thus, end in dramatic fight. They are forever divided into two different group- The Avengers on tight rein by Government and The Rebel Avengers who can do whatever they want. Oh wait, there is going to be another movie about the Avengers. That must means Tony Stark will calm down about whole parent thing and calls Captain America for help to fight the huge villain that is about to come. Predictable, I say. If that doesn't happens, HAHA. Oh well, that would be embarrassing for me.

This film was fun. Now, I know that doesn't sound amazing. And it's not. It's not amazing. There are flaws. Plenty of flaws. But you know what else there is? Fighting. A lot of fighting. Way too much maybe, I mean damn. You got... you got Spiderman, right? Spiderman's hanging off War Machine and... and then Ant-Man goes giant or whatever and... like... um... Black Panther, y'know? He stabs people and jumps from car to car... and the Winter Soldier, like, gets on a motorcycle while it's going... and Captain America holds a helicopter... and... and... yeah. God, this film was fun. Of course, the fun factor can only get you thus far. I mean, sure, it was well written (dialogue wise), well choreographed and it had Spiderman flying around Giant Man like-- sorry, sorry, got a bit excited there. Alright, so... what does this film do wrong? Well, it has a lot to juggle. You got way too many characters, way too many plot points and it gets weird. It does the best it can with the 56+ characters it has, introduces a new villain, and has a big manly testosterone man fight. And the intro sequence is very fun, too. But some of the characters feel off, considering the dark tone of the film, which, by the way, was WAAAAY better than Batman V. Superman (Aaaaand there's the obligatory jab at Batman V. Superman), characters like Ant-Man. Why in the hell does Ant-Man join Cap's team? Why does Iron-Man need Spidey for? He's got Vision in his team. Goddamn Vision, dude, the guy can fly, shoot lasers and go through walls. And maybe read minds, I'm not sure. And there's the villain, which comic readers will immediately recognize, but they seem underdeveloped to any casual moviegoer. Because they are. There really wasn't much time devoted to them with all the stuff going on. Hell, there wasn't even a big bad fight scene. Besides Loki (who wasn't that great in the first place) the Marvel movie villains haven't been that great. Most of them were guys in a business suit (Iron Man 1, 2, 3, Winter Soldier, Ant Man) and Ultron, who was pretty stupid as well. The big point of this film, the reason behind the "Civil War" (odd way of saying it, they kick each other in the face for fifteen minutes. Kinda like how the Age Of Ultron lasted like, what, a week? A couple of days?) is this discussion. Or at least, that's what they lead you to believe in the trailers. No, the reason why they fight is much different, the Hero Registration Act or whatever it's called kinda stays in the background. And there is a lot to discuss there. Stark says the Avengers need to be put in check. And they do. They can't just run around like they own the world. However, had the Avengers not been there the last three times, way more people would've died. It's an annoying discussion. The characters fighting feels rushed, too. Maybe if they sat down and talked it out they'd fix it in 20 minutes. Without broken bones. Especially in the final fight. Also, is the Winter Soldier really compelling enough to make two movies focusing on him? Overall, the good outweighed the bad. There was still bad in there, don't get me wrong, but I'm not grouchy enough to let that get in the way of Black Widow kicking people in the balls. Black Panther for life, by the way.

Review title: Marvel show DC how it's done
Review_body: I was expecting big things from this film. Especially with the mild disappointment of Batman vs Superman. I had a lot of faith in the Russo brothers to deliver, especially after what they did with The Winter Soldier. And, boy they delivered. Again, they've delivered the perfect blend of action, humour and seriousness we've seen in other Marvel hits, but this time they had about 10 superheroes to fit in. And they did it. They actually gave each character a chance to shine in their own respect. Which I thought was outstanding. The action was expertly done, with minimal CGI and lots of hand-to-hand combat, which is how it should be done. In summary, this film has made me very excited for Infinity War. P.S: Spiderman is f***ing awesome!

Review title: A fun ride, DCEU really need to step up their game
Review_body: I'll just point out every good things in this movie by listing them 1. How Chris Evans brings Cap to life always just blows me away, he gets better and better with every movie 2. The chase scene which involves Bucky, Cap and Black Panther is definitely better than the trailer. 3. Chadwick Boseman is T'Challa; strong, tough, resilient and a king material and also a man with a few words 4. Spider-Man.....what can I say Marvel Studios, you just created the best and most entertaining Spider-Man, good job. I didn't hate the 2 former modern Spider-Man, but really just none of them has ever gotten the Spider-Man feel as Tom Holland did. 5. The airport fighting scenes were absurdly unbelievable....in a good way. It is not the epic fight as it was in the comics, no....and if you're expecting that then I guess you just don't know how to appreciate these people in bringing these characters to life. 6. I can see the spark between the distracted Vision and Scarlet Witch portrayed very well. What's amazing though is how this movie can picture the beginning of their love between in all this mess. 7. Daniel Bruhl as Baron Zemo; he just seriously exceeded my expectations. A typical Cap villain, well done. There are reasons why I gave this a 8/10 1. Iron Man's team is too OP, I mean you have Vision, Spider-Man, Black Panther and Iron Man himself. Maybe it was for plot reasons, but I can't even imagine Iron Man and his team losing 2. What is supposed to be Crossbones role here? I mean sure, Wanda killed him with dozen other innocents killed in collateral damage...there are thousand others killed in Sokovia, and the one in Lagos is the one that broke the camel's back? I'm sorry I just don't see it 3. Vision is way too weak here, I mean this is the first Vision right? Not the Young Avengers Vision. 4. The end was surprisingly weak, I was probably expecting Cap to die for some reason or maybe heavily injured that he cannot fight anymore, I thought Crossbones would be the one to do him in. 5. Lastly, Cap almost signed the SHRA!!! WTF Marvel?!!! What's more absurd is what's coming after, he then rejected the offer because Wanda is locked up....in Stark's luxurious apartment!!! Okay, I'm not expecting a straight off-comic movie....but I just can't see the reason to call this a Civil War because what makes a Civil War is the difference in principles between two sides which is: what is right, and what is legal, and guess what....Cap and Stark did make up for a while before his parents problem kicked in again.

I enjoyed most of it, I thought Captain America and Bucky were good, the action scenes were well directed(although sometimes the camera was too shaky) and enjoyable. It had a few nice laughs, and Spiderman was good. However, it felt extremely formulated, and took absolutely no risks with the story. The score was beyond generic, and it was filled with annoying conveniences that were only there so characters won't die. Also it had an incredible overuse of humor, the humor was used in many of the wrong moments, and it was completely distracting and unnecessary. And to top it all off the jokes were were very unoriginal and cringe inducing. And if you were wondering which "side" I'm on, I'm definitely team Captain America. Before I saw the movie i was team Cap, and after the movie I was sure i was team Cap. Ironman, even though I thought he had some decent scenes, didn't have many good reasons on his side to actually agree with or understand. And what his character does in the 3rd act of the film was stupid as f*ck. And only convinced me more he was a hypocrite, and very unlikable. The ending was also terrible, it felt like the ending of every other Marvel movie. Especially the previous Captain America movie, The Winter Soldier. Which I personally prefer to this clichéd and predictable mess.

Review title: A well balanced blend of action, humor and emotional depth!
Review_body: So write of the bat, this is great movie. Not just in terms of being a comic book movie but just a movie. It is a well balanced combination of action and humor all the while hitting all the right emotional beats. It manages to introduce two new amazing characters in a very short amount of time but neither feels rushed or forced. This movie seems to be getting a lot of flake for the 'near obsession level of devotion',as one reviewer put it, that Steve rogers shows for bucky. And I couldn't disagree more, Steve and bucky are like brothers so as anyone with siblings knows just how deep that emotional bond runs. Steve might not agree with everything bucky does or how he does it but at the end of the day YOU are allowed to be mad at your siblings or disagree with them but if someone else does it then you have their backs. It is the basic code of sibling hood, aside from 'don't tell mom the stupid stuff I did'. Besides since the Avengers we have seen how out-place Cap really feels in this world ( the I understand that moments or the little book of look stuff up or pretty much any conversation he has with black widow in the first half of Winter soldier). So it makes perfect sense for him to latch on the last remaining link he has of his previous life especially since (SPOILERS) Peggy Carter is now dead. Definitely watch this movie, even if your not a comic book fan, it will still leave you immensely entertained.

Review title: Age of ultron had to happen for civil war..
Review_body: I was a bit disappointed by age of ultron..but I think it laid a good foundation for the Civil war.. The movie is one of the best movies I have seen.. The action was brilliant. The emotional scenes had depth and overall we can see each character getting developed. It had some really funny scenes as well which balanced out the pace well. There are some really cool stuffs which made me and close to 200 other audience members scream and we all stood up and clapped at the end.. Even though there were lot of superheroes it never felt a crowd. Each had there own stories and every single character had some interaction with captain America. brace yourselves Spider man is coming....

I love Captain America films, I really do. I loved The First Avenger, even though many people don't. Plus, Winter Soldier was a masterpiece, it was a movie which combined the excitement of a superhero movie with the thrill of movies like those of the James Bond franchise, encompassing themes of government espionage, parasitism. Civil War acting as a sequel, is a follow up to more than one MCU film and seems like a discount Avengers films along its entire run-time rather than being one of Cap's. Besides this, the movie is great. It is packed with all the action one casual-moviegoer would expect from a summer blockbuster such as this, and references and easter-eggs enough to please one hardcore Marvel fanboy (I am not one). The thing which separates Civil War from Batman v Superman is the different tone of narration and story-telling they undertake. BvS remains dark throughout, and that what makes it a DC film, it shouldn't be criticized for being too dark, STOP IT. On the other hand, Civil War plays balance between gritty, melancholic and laugh-arousing tones, consisting of cheesy one-liners from RDJ and Tom Holland ("Hey Cap, Big Fan, I am Spider-Man) plus heart-melting duels between the heroes we love and cherish. The movie, aside from playing follow-up, sets up a platform for future standalone films, introducing Black Panther, which I think is cool, and Spiderman, who I really want to see give a run to Tobey Maguire for his money. Overall Verdict? You should see it, it is a great flick and please don't compare it to BvS, DCEU is just starting, I could do this all day.

Review title: Not as amazing that everyone makes it out to be, but good!
Review_body: OK first off, I am no hater but I feel like I have to point out that this isn't as perfect as people are saying. I'm not saying it's bad, but there are some weak points here.They should have fleshed out reason why Ironman and Capt'n was fighting. And like they would go so overboard, especially Ironman. In my opinion that does not suit the character as I know him.They should also had fleshed out more what the governments are trying to do with "supers".Oh and why change Ant-Man's helmet?!Other than that the film was great! Best Spider-Man to date, made me laugh very hard several times. This is the Spider-Man I know from the comics! Black Panther looks bad ass and looks bad ass.Great fight scenes of course. The pacing was good, time went fast ;)Reason I had to write this is because all this talk about it being the best MCU film, I do not agree. And I read some review before I saw it and it kinda made me expect more.

The movie is boring, the storyline is very slow and the action scenes in general were not wow, it was great how each character was used in the main fight never the less, put the main fight aside, the rest is about Captain America and his best Bro! I was hoping to see more about the other characters and less about Bucky.and honestly.. the reason why all this happened... is really really really stupid .. they tried to link it with other movies, but they failed badly.on the other hand, one positive thing they did is that they kept Iron Man image and they managed to show both views equally without affecting viewers views. Spoiler: the movie is different that the comics.. a lotI was really hoping to see a better movie.

It was entertaining and very watchable, but left me wanting more and not in a good way. I'm not usually one for wanting Hollywood to make more movies so they make more money, (ticked about the multi-Hobbits and things like that) but I feel this one should have been cut in two, given us a movie with a longer period to cause the break and a longer period to deal with it. It would have been really great if they could have had all their titles to work with, F4 and such. They should've split the two between Stark and Capt. and given us better perspectives of both.... and for crying out loud, the why... I mean don't get me wrong, they had better reasons than BvS, but there needed to be more meat to the cause of the divide. It seemed shallow and forced, too easy to make happen, like no one was trying not to make it happen. If I were losing my best friends/long time teammates, I would've fought harder to keep them together. While I do want more, I think with what they had, Spider-man and how they added him, could have been left out. It made the time with him cheesy and the suspension of disbelief more difficult to achieve. In a nutshell, holes.... it left you with and added holes and more... Okay, so I've ragged on it, but in truth, if you go in expecting another MCU movie with its comedy and action mix, you'll get it, and for that it gets a 6. However, if you go in wanting the depth of story that was in the books, you'll leave as disappointed as I was. 'nuff said.

Review title: One of the Best MCU Movies So Far
Review_body: I was lucky enough to see an early screening of this movie. From the opening scene till the final battle, I was completely blown away. First off I'm gonna start by talking about the performances.This is the best acting we've seen in the MCU hands down. To highlight a few, Robert Downey Junior gives a Tony Stark a more personal side that we have yet to completely see if him. Chadwick Boseman and Tom Holland are both perfectly casted as Black Panther and Spider-Man respectively. The action was great. The relationships that these characters have built over the course of several movies creates a new level of complexity that makes these fight sequences more emotional and powerful. The Airport Battle is the best action scene in the MCU and is rivaled only by the Quicksilver scene from DOFP. The final thing I have to say about what made this movie so damn good, was the fact that all of the events in this movie are permanent and will have a long lasting impact. The only complaint I've had with the MCU is the fact that most of the events in their movies are resolved by the climax and there is no lasting impact on future films. While no future films have come out at the time I've written this review, it still seems safe to say that the events in this movie will have a permanent effect on the rest of the MCU. It is rare that I go into a movie with this high of expectations and i leave the theater completely blown away. 10/10 Great Movie

Let me start by saying that this movie is extremely overrated. It is funny how they got scared after Marvel Fanboys steamrolled Man of Steel for killing all those people, and in this movie, they had to make stupid comments and messages to each other that the location is empty/being evacuated before the fight takes place.Also, basically Bucky can murder every person on the planet but Captain America (with his sky high moral values), thinks it is OK, because it is Bucky. It is to a point where it gets ridiculous how funny their bromance is. Captain is OK to fight with everyone for Bucky despite his mass genocide.Spiderman was OK, but his constant talking was annoying (specially since he wasn't saying much at home and all of a sudden, during a fight, he wants to say everything). What I don't understand is how these characters are talking/making cheesy jokes, while fighting for their lives.And finally, after all the fiasco of a movie, not a single Avenger died! Not one! If you look at the amount of fighting this movie had, someone should've died.Overall, the movie sucked. I slept twice in the theatre and didn't feel like I was missing much.

Review title: When action and story become one
Review_body: First of I've got to say that this is a masterpiece in combining a story with action. Yeah explosions, fighting and stuff - but you actually care about it all.Secondly, here is my good/bad summary:+ A damn good story! The conflict is built up believably and there is a reason for every choice a character make. It's a dramatic good vs good fight and you are conflicted in who to root for. There are several parallel stories, like the introduction of the new character Black Panther. Such parallel stories risk to mix badly with the main story but here that isn't the case. 10/10+ Action (duh). Not only it's fantastic visuals, but it also help telling the story. If you love explosions and fist fighting: you'll love it. If you love fleshed out fights where you really feel something: you'll love it. 10/10+ Cinemaography. What to say? The visuals perfectly set the tone of every moment 10/10+ Acting. Very good. Every character feel true and relatable, you can feel their inner conflicts. 8/10+ Spiderman, Black Panther and Ant-man. Do I have to say more? They are all seamlessly introduced and even Black Panther who has a pretty strong story arc are perfectly built-up without taking any focus from the main story. And by the way: this Peter Parker is my favourite up to date! :D+ The blending of each element stated above is done so good. Great action scenes and a lot of storytelling tend to be difficult to blend, resulting in pointless action sequences and a lot of "character development" that feels out of place. This clearly isn't the case here. 10/10Now my biggest (and only BTW) complaint about the movie is - ironically - about the story: it could have been even stronger. You do have a big conflict between good and good, but I think it's to much to call it a "civil war". So there were multiple things that split the Avengers up which I feel could have been built up even more, and possibly intertwined to make a greater impact, making the split more final than it were now.So all in all: very well-made, very enjoyable with great action and story. Highly recommended! :)

Review title: One of the best Marvel movies
Review_body: This movie helps set up phase 3 of the Marvel Cinematic Universe and shapes the relationships between the main heroes. The fight scenes in Civil War are amazing. The airport scene was greatly choreographed and performed (although 1-2 shots were really bad - Ironman and War Machine clearly standing in front of a green screen)The use of Antman, Spiderman and Black Panther helped the movie quite a lot. Without them, the movie would be average.One thing I did not like was the use of the villains in the movie. Although Daniel Bruhl portrays Zemo good enough, his character plan and the final section of the movie are solely based on luck. How could he know what would happen during the fight between team Ironman and team Cap, and that later on Tony, Steve and Bucky would all turn up where he was (In Russia). Crossbones was underwhelming during his short appearance. Overall it is a really good Marvel movie, but it should have had a different title since the Civil War comic is on a different level.

Review title: It was nice . very nice better than BvS
Review_body: 2016 Is a very promising year. this movie this great everything about it. the special effects, the heroes got enough screen time each respectively. ANTMAN was awesome as usual, spider man kicked ass( captain America ass) hawk eye did something new with his bow and well vision.....remains vision, just watch it Fm. it is amazing. it is true all the captain America movies keep getting better. seriously i need to write more lines in this review so... i love Black panther. black widow is still hot, Wanda Wanda Nigeria Nigeria. I'm sad there are no more iron man movies because Robert Downy is so funny. I'm starting to like war machine too.

Review title: The most human Marvel movie to date
Review_body: The marketing hype asked us to choose "Team Cap" or "Team Iron Man", presumably to set the stage up for a confrontation between these 2 friends. The cynic in all of us would be justified to think that no studio would be brave enough to make a movie that pits their 2 main tent-pole protagonists in a no-holds barred confrontation (unless they were tricked into doing so like another superhero film recently featuring a flying alien and a billionaire with a Halloween costume fetish).But I was wrong.With Civil War, Marvel did a very mature take on the whole superhero genre with genuine explorations on the themes of friendship, loyalty and duty. With this, it is one of the best film that they had produced so far and also the one with the furthest implication on MCU Phase 3.Whether you are rooting for Captain America or Iron Man, the film fleshes out the motivation for the divergent paths that each character chooses to take. For me, the action of this film (and there are tons of it) are not as interesting as the human drama that the directors have cleverly and patiently unfold for its audiences. And the ensemble cast delivered the drama perfectly and effortlessly.Highly recommended.

Review title: Very entertaining, but far from an actually great film.
Review_body: I'm not a Marvel fan and I don't really care for blockbusters, but I saw Civil War to see if it would maybe change my mind. It didn't. To say Civil War is a bad movie, though, is false. It's not a bad movie at all, it's a good movie, and that's about it, really. Just like most Marvel films - with the exception of Guardians of The Galaxy, their best - directing throughout most of the film is bland, generic, like the camera is there to show what's going on and that's it.
