Review title: It's all about the bad guy - But Killmonger he aint!
Review_body: Upon my first viewing of this movie I loved it. Frenetic action, great comedy, and a good plot to keep you engaged. 10/10 on my first view.However, on second viewing realised the film was not just a vacuous super hero romp. The film does have a message. And like Black Panther, where the character Eric Killmonger stole the show, the hidden depth of this film is presented by the villain, Zemo. Also, like Panther, I found myself siding with the villain.So, Zemo sets events in motion to ensure the Avengers set upon themselves. His aim is to make the Avengers implode. But what is interesting is his motivation for doing this. Sokovia, a fictional European nation, is all but destroyed after the events of Age of Ultron movie. And our villain Zemo, loses his entire family due to the actions of American Avengers in that movie. So, Zemo life is destroyed his entire family killed. Collateral damage due to the actions of well intentioned Americans trying to 'make the world a better place'. Sound familiar! I think it is refreshing that Marvel/Disney are taking this approach to story telling. The Last Jedi also impressed me with the introduction of Benicio Del Toro character, DJ, who questions rebels involvement arms trading.Zemo is not as good as a character as Killmonger. He not as engaging and we do not spend enough time to fully feel his rage. But much like Killmonger, he has a point!

It's not politics that got between the Captain and Iron Man - it's the fact that because of his old buddy Captain America chose to antagonise everyone. Oh, and also the fact that he always knows best. It's so exhausting with these movies how they always promote going rogue cuz when you're powerful you always know best and laws don't matter. The only thing I don't get is why everyone labels Tony as arrogant when usually they are both are equally arrogant and think they know best; it's actually the first movie where Tony shows such regard for others and humility to accept that over 100 world leaders might be righteously concerned that 5 people do whatever they please.
I gave it a high rating though, cause for the first time in quite a while a Marvel movie will make viewers think a bit further than the standard black and white reality of the MCU. And because the special effects are great as always :)
#teamironman

The action sequences alone is worth the money - particularly airport scene was just pure joy and jaw dropping.With so many characters and superheroes, everyone still got a chance to shine.I was particularly happy with the appearance of Spiderman, Black Panther and Antman! Can't wait for their solo movies in the future, definitely checking them out.This is a MUST watch! Will probably watch it again a couple more times!

Review title: Captain America V Iron Man: it's extremely well realized and proves to be entertainment at it's best.
Review_body: Captain America Civil WarMarvel knows how to please audiences and after seeing how Warner Bros. largely failed to please the general public with Batman and Superman's first big-screen debut together, audiences are going to question if with Civil War, (which is essentially "Captain America v Iron Man") will it really be worth investing time and money into another hero-on-hero mega-budget superhero flick. Well, this is Marvel's answer to DC's failed attempt, and they know these characters, we've seen most of them around in a few movies now over the past 8 years or so, (some of them more recent and some of them for the first time in this film's cinematic universe). And I truly believe the film is a triumph. Unlike the last Avengers film, there are not really any subplots that don't serve as an important piece to the overall story, directors Joe and Anthony Russo did a great job weaving action scene and character-driven scene together to drive the story forward in 2014's Captain America the Winter Soldier, and they do the same here. What makes this even more impressive is that they are handling roughly twice the amount of characters than what Winter Soldier had, but they do it as near-perfect as you could expect from a big-budget, studio-produced blockbuster these days. Though it had it's strong aspects, Star Wars the Force Awakens was a big money maker for Disney, but as a film, it left much to be desired. This film surprised and impressed me, more than any big budget film in the past 12 months save for Mad Max. It was better than Ant-man. Better than Age of Ultron. It was better than Furious 7, Jurassic World, Force Awakens, Batman v Superman and even Jungle Book which I also was impressed with. The film doesn't take any huge risks and does play it fairly safe to being what we've come to expect from Marvel, but it knows what the formula for success at Marvel is and it works with it. It knows how to still be impressive and wholly satisfying while still playing things fairly safe. Marvel, they takes risks with certain movies, and being that this is called "Civil War" which is based on a Marvel comic where major characters DO die, the movie doesn't quite follow that and is really more like a "Civil Dispute". And then there are moments where Tony is acting like he and Steve used to be friends even though earlier in the film he explains to Cap how his father always talked highly about him to Tony and that he just wanted to punch him in his perfect teeth. There are moments where this built-up rage shines through Downey Jr's performance as Stark, after he finds out a truth regarding his parents, that shows Robert actually put a lot of care into this character, more than we've ever seen from him since Iron Man 1. Lately it has felt like he's been phoning in his performances, but not here. Here he really acts the hell out of what the script asks of him, and counter's Chris Evans' strongest performance of Captain America to date, too. Lots of other big players here, Jeremy Renner, Scarlett Johansson, Paul Bettany, Elizabeth Olsen, Sebastian Stan, Paul Rudd, Anthony Mackie, and Daniel Bruhl gives a strong performance as a villain character who isn't given the most fleshing out or devotion to, but he serves the story well enough and it will be interesting to see if he gets any future roles down the line.If you're a fan of Spiderman, well the studio finally worked a deal out with Sony that allows them to use Spiderman in their shared cinematic universe and he is a very well introduced character played by young actor Tom Holland who probably does the best job as this character we have seen on screen yet, he fits in very well and plays off the other actors very well and proves to be quite a visual spectacle in the film's second act. He gets his own film next year and I look forward to seeing how it turns out, as this film introduced the character properly, and you could tell the directors had a full understanding of what makes this character so great. Overall, if you're looking for a superhero universe to stay committed to and always have faith in, I'd say just stick with Marvel because they know what they're doing and everything are building up to is unlikely to disappoint given the rate they are going now, but I guess we shall see you until then I would definitely recommend this film 9/10

As a big comic, superhero and film fan I was really excited for this film.Oh dear.It's a mess.The first 30 minutes is boring, nearly left at that point. Baron Zemo is a terrible villain, is less than one dimensional with the on screen presence of a bag of rice.So Tony and Steve has a political disagreement... no problem thinks Tony, I can sort this out by blasting my best friend in the face with high powered explosives! Why exactly were Ant Man and Spider-Man joining the fight? Fun as a Spider-Man's scene was it was a lame introduction and nothing more than Marvel screaming "LOOK! WE HAVE SPIDER-MAN!" And if the Avengers are having this debate surely Jenny, a.k.a She-Hulk, would be there being as she is a lawyer. Oh yes, can't have too many female characters unbalancing the precious testosterone driven MCU.I don't know about this being Captain America 3, it was more like Winter Soldier 2, a character I'm not keen of to begin with, so it was annoying to have this character take up yet another film.The final fight between Cap & Tony also made no sense. Tony knows Bucky was under mind control and not a murderer yet he still goes off on one, rounding off a truly badly written story.And now the Avengers are no more. Oh great, now the next film will have to spend half an hour bringing them all together again.Overall it was a huge let down. So much so it really has tainted the whole Marvel universe for me. Oh well I guess I could read the comics... wait... Thor is a woman, Iron Man is a girl and Bruce Banner is dead... Marvel have lost the plot in a BIG way.

The fact of having a power or not is totally irrelevant. Anyone can beat anyone if the film requires so. That nonsense and the poor argument's line make the title absolute rubbish.If I rate it with a three is due to the Tony Stark, Peter Parker and May scene; a good comedy portion with three charismatic characters.
The movie is directed by the Russo Brothers they have done a great adaptation of the comic book with powerful sequences of action, the movie is on pair of Winter Soldier.

Review title: Great film that does what Marvel do best, However...
Review_body: Spoilers ahead....Great movie, with a huge ensemble cast, but Marvel clearly knows how to approach that kind of film by now, great pace. Great characters as well, loved Black Panther and Spidey, and RDJ showed a lot of emotional range.My one single complaint, which is one that REALLY bothers me by now is that fact that NO MAJOR CHARACTER, OR ANYONE EVER DIES IN THESE FILMS!!! kill someone already, otherwise it kinda feels like the stakes are never high :/ Still though 9/10 would have been a 10/10 had Rhodey or Bucky actually bit the dust.

Downside: I wanted to leave the cinema after 1 hr to go study in the lobby (at 00:00) Upside: I've learnt a great deal from this movie and it hasn't even ended yet( since i am writing this from the theater and the film is still on, they're fighting-what a surprise). I've learnt that culture isn't always positive. American culture with all its heroes, all its need to save innocent lives is just a hypocrisy trying to mask the atrocities US has committed through history. At least I thought it is going to be enjoyable, you can never really hate every single part of the movie. I learnt the contrary too. Idiotic screen writing, I could guess what they were about to say. Not even the actors could save this piece of excrement. I tried to sleep through it at some point thinking the pain will go away. My boyfriend is a fan and though I could hear his unsatisfied, thirsty, clenched anger, he wanted to see what happens so I had to stay. The reason I couldn't sleep is the fact that my anger started kicking in more and more every time I heard someone talk. People actually laughed once for like 3 seconds at this very idiotic joke. Now i might have some anger issues but this movie made me go full animal. Also very long. I wish IMDb had the "attach photo" option so i could immortalize my face's disgusted look and share it with the world.

As brief background I am an avid comic book fan (both Marvel and DC, but I read Batman the most). I loved the Dark Knight Trilogy and have been generally pleased with most MCU output. I thought Man of Steel was OK but that Batman v Superman was actually quite poor film- making.Civil War has simply made me think even less of BvS. I know some people don't like comparisons but I cannot help it when Civil War does what BvS tried to do but actually accomplishes it. The good:The action scenes are great - it really felt like a comic book had come aliveI was very engrossed with the story - I felt it flowed well and I really bought both sides of the argument. I could see where Cap was coming from and where Iron Man was. The fights were all justified - it never felt like the movie was trying to force a fight on the characters with tenuous justification like it did with BvS. On the contrary, the characters do not want to fight and are merely forced to by circumstances. This gives it more of an emotional kick. The conclusions feel satisfactory as well.Black Panther has translated to screen well - he is the guy from the comics, good parts and bad. He is also extremely formidable. His very last scene promises great things about his solo movieSpider-Man again seems like the most faithful to the comics we've seen yet. He talks a lot during fights - to everyone's annoyance - and has a great sense of humour.Some reviews have been a bit lukewarm on the bad guy, Zemo, but I disagree. I thought he was given a very human motivation (again, unlike Lex from BvS). By the end you almost feel sorry for himThe bad:It was a bit slow in parts but I was so excited I didn't mind. I question how these parts will hold up to repeat viewing

Review title: I don't think it's actually a Civil War Story. "Captain America v Iron Man" might be a more suitable title.
Review_body: Just saw Captain America: Civil War. Just a heads up it's not about the superhero registration act (like the comics). It's a continuation of CA: Winter Soldier and Age of UltronReview: -Loved the Newbies (Spider-Man and especially Black Panther). It's fun to see Ant-Man with the other guys too. -Not enough Black Widow tho :( but might just be me -Loved Wanda and Clint's friendship -I don't think it's actually a Civil War Story. "Captain America v Iron Man" might be a more suitable title... or "Captain America fighting for his b̶o̶y̶f̶r̶i̶e̶n̶d̶ bestfriend against Iron Man. -It's great. WATCH ITMight be a minor spoiler... I guess. IDK: -This movie could be a great prologue for a Real Civil War movie. not an Avengers: Civil War movie but a MARVEL CIVIL WAR movie. In the comics Cap, along with some super powed pips, are against the Superhero registration act. They then formed a team and started helping people in secret (like Daredevil who is a part of Cap's team in the comics). Then the fighting and the civil war started. -THEY CAN STILL DO THIS. -They have @Daredevil and The Punisher on TV. They'll have Dagger and Cloak soon. Plus the inhumans in Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. -They could strike a deal with Fox to get the rights for F4 and some X-men characters. -THEY HAVE TO DO IT.

Review title: A decent superhero film that angered DC fanboys.
Review_body: Don't mind the recent low ratings.If you're into bad-ass action and reckless fighting for no cause, you'll love it. Most of the haters are DC fanboys anyway and they are jealous just because their movies are brutally terrible. Don't get me wrong, I don't hate DC and I think "The Dark Knight" was the best superhero film ever made but DC just plain "sucks" now. And the DC butt-hurts must accept the truth.

Review title: Really Good Film I Enjoyed It (No Spoilers)
Review_body: being a marvel fan for me this is one the best marvel movies it has fantastic character arcs, great action and really good acting. and my god SPIDER-MAN!!!!!. just seeing peter parker interacting with the other avengers made my day and also he does awesome stuff with his web shooters. i think to say tom Holland is the best spider-man is to soon but i think he will be after we see is standalone film next year. and also Chadwick Bozeman nails it as black panther he has a personal goal in this film and you fully understand his motivation and his action is the best in the film. the performances from Downey and Evans were great and it was such a emotional film because you've seen these characters grow and you have history with them. Anthony Mackie stays awesome as falcon and has a couple standout moments. Sebastian Stan as Bucky Barnes/winter solider is fantastic a great and strong performance from him. and i also want to point out that Elizabeth Olsen was much improved as scarlet witch i thought she was a bit underdeveloped in age of Ultron but she had a fantastic arc in this film. the airport battle is phenomenal one of the best superhero action set pieces seriously it's crazy i couldn't believe what is was watching. there is only one thing that was bad about it which has become very familiar in marvel movies the villains. once again marvel makes a another generic and disposable villain in Baron Zemo its a shame because Daniel Bruhl is a really good actor. but i look at it that he wasn't really a villain this film didn't need a villain it was a family dispute between the avengers. but other than that overall it was a very good and entertaining movie which makes sure the marvel train keeps on rolling 10/10

Unlike the DC films I have seen that are full of foreboding and angst and self reflection and are dark and broody, such as "Batman v. Superman", I find Marvel to be warm, inviting, cheerful and fun, even when they are being broody.The story picks up from the last Marvel films Ant-man and Avengers:Age of Ultron. It does not incorporate any of the "Agents of Shield" television series, as happened last year. The Avengers, as they stand, are Captain America, Iron Man, Black Widow, Falcon (from Captain America: Winter Soldier and Ant-Man) and Scarlet Witch (from Age of Ultron). At the home base is Vision (from Age of Ultron), who makes some pivotal decisions later in the film. Saving the world many times comes at a great cost of human lives, and rather than be grateful only 10,000 died instead of a million, the UN has now created a protocol to put a rhetorical political leash on the Avengers. Not all agree. Tony says the Avengers need oversight (since there is no more official S.H.I.E.L.D), whereas Captain America believes the hero force must be independent to fight evil where they find it. If they were all of the same mind, there would be no movie. This is because *spoiler alert* the bad guy, named Zemo, is counting on this division. Zemo is grieving for his lost family killed in Sokovia by the villain Ultron lifting the city and then dropping it. Of course, he blames the Avengers. So he has hatched a long, convoluted scheme.This is my only problem with the Marvel universe. Blame the bad guy, not the heroes who saved us from the bad guys. But then we wouldn't put ourselves into the position of trying to control them politically. And Zemo is counting on this schism to seek revenge by making hero battle hero. And it works. There is a sub- plot about a group of "super-soldiers" formulated at the same time as Winter-Soldier (who also is a possible future ally.) It leads to some of the best fight scenes ever (not). No, it actually leads to nowhere, as they were only used as a ruse to get to a video. A video taken from some mysterious camera, that happened to be just where it needed to be.But enough with that. These are super-hero's, after all, so if I can suspend disbelief about that, surely I can suspend disbelief about conveniently placed cameras.As a wrap, I can say that when the credits rolled, and I put down my empty soda cup and empty popcorn bag, I had a smile on my face and a warm feeling in my soul, for I had just seen a very important chapter in the Marvel Universe's history and am anxious to see more.

People says: an Avengers movie with 'emotional depth' and 'moral  complexity', and now I have to question what planet they're living on.  Seriously, WTF people!! if this is 'emotional depth' and 'moral  complexity' then Marsellus Wallace is a bitch!   When their operation to stop the theft of a biological weapon in Lagos  goes explosively wrong leaving dozens of civilian casualties and  themselves under scrutiny. It may be that I'm misremembering, but were  there any civilian casualties in the past???   Didn't whole cities go up without anyone even wandering around dazed  with a nosebleed? But the plot needs what the plot needs so now the  Avengers have always blown up innocent people, which leads to 100  nations gathering together and saying: this must stop. And: you must  all be brought under the control of the UN.  While Iron Man is for it, Captain America, who is more Brexit, quickly  goes rogue and becomes a fugitive. This could have then set the scene  for, perhaps, saying something almost interesting about government  control, military might and divided loyalties, but instead it results  in all the superheroes choosing #TeamCap or #TeamIronMan there are no  takers for #TeamNeither, which would have been the sensible option   WHY WHY they fight!! Come on!!!   Captain America a rebel soldier???

Review title: The most cinematic Marvel film yet!
Review_body: Captain America isn't just one of the best superhero films, it is an outstanding film outside of the genre. There is so much going on in Civil War that you'd think the film would never be able to keep with all of it. New characters, huge set pieces and multiple plot lines coming to a head. However the direction and writing handles everything with a resounding respect and pace that makes this film spectacular.Old characters like Iron Man, Captain America and Black Widow are given new nuances and interactions that keep there characters from becoming stale with Robert Downey Jr. delivering his best performance as Iron Man yet. Newer characters like Winter Solider, Ant-Man and Vision are also given great moments that don't distract from what's important and Spider-Man and Black Panther are excellent new additions to the formula.What is most effective about Civil War is that it combines the political intrigue and believability with the fun and large scale of The Avengers together seamlessly making this the most realistic and enjoyable looks into the MCU (Marvel Cinematic Universe) yet. If I had one criticism of the film, it would be about the villain who seems very pointless and confusing until his motivations are revealed at the end of the film. Once this happens your perspective on the character changes into something quite unexpected that fits perfectly into the films tone and messaging.Good - Fantastic Action Sequences - Multi-layered characters and storytelling - Well paced comedy and realism - A film with suspense and consequencesBad - Villains motivations are unclear and jarring to begin with.10/10

I'm a fan of the Marvel movies, looking forward to the climax. This is a good movie, I highly recommend you watch it, but it felt like a filler. All the other movies had a great united sense about them(the movie), the characters and story was coherent if cut a bit short for theaters. This movie was jumping all over from one character to another as the story needed. Felt like poor planing the whole time, like they just had to get it out fast so they can move on. If your a fan of the Avengers you have to see this movie, like all Marvel movies it is part of a massive story that is not yet done. I just wanted more, more of this, more of that, why are we leaving, no go back, oh come on are all things I was saying to myself. Also the ability to predict what will happen was high in this one, even if you're not up to date with other media of the franchise. Whenever you can predict what will happen, you know that's a bad sign. If this was a 6+ hour movie it would be a epic tale, as is, it's just good. I watched this with high hopes, like all Marvel movies, I was disappointed but not enough to stop me from watching it again.

With the best introduction to the Spider Man character on the screen, this movie is well written and with great production. Stark and Rogers's contender makes you believe in a civil war within the heroes, because the two are greatly portrayed, as never before in any movie on the MCU. A lot of fun also, with all the avengers bonding very well in the two teams, along with a great Black Panther character.This film proves how far from Marvel Studios is DC/Warner, in terms of fun, and the whole universe created.Just waiting for more of these Black Panther and Spider Man.And this Steve Rogers is how Clark Kent should be in the movies.

Review title: Civil war beats Deadpool!!!!!×o×o👌🏻 nuf said!
Review_body: I didn't really had hopes from Spider man, This Movie just hyped me for whatever next is coming From Marvel. And i was super hyped to see how Black panther was gonna fit in, it was just more than expected. My Favorite Superhero is Batman, but this movie just beats everything I've seen in last 2-3 Years. Review title: The One thing that was wrong
Review_body: The is no way that Captain America beats Spiderman, it's ridicules. You would understand the irritation if you are true Marvel and Spiderman Comic book reader. Spiderman is stronger and faster than Captain America, not to mention the fact that Spiderman is intellectually gifted and bright in the likes of genius kids in league with the likes of Tony Stark. The main reason why Spiderman beats Captain America though is because Spiderman can dodge bullets. He can also see and sense blows miles away before they touch his body, not to mention that he senses danger even before the attack happens. The only way to hurt Spiderman is to distract him in the havoc and chaos created, with innocent bystanders or what not, while Cap has to hide behind his shield. Captain America had difficulties fighting the Winter Soldier while Spiderman defeated the Winter Soldier and Falcon at the same time? it all speaks volume of favoritism for branding and marketing purposes rather than staying true to the Marvel Characters integrity. Spiderman is also tactical and he always subdues all his opponents by using his wits and intelligence rather than hurting them, always finding it more preferable although he is more than capable of going rounds blow for blow with some Powerful Beings. Captain Americas strength, endurance and stamina is mediocre in comparison with Spiderman too. It is a shame that the fight scene didn't do the fight between Cap and Spiderman justice although I understand the necessity for branding for more blockbusters.The great things about the Movie was all due to Black Panther, Antman, Spiderman and the childish quarrels between Falcon and Winter Soldier. They put life, personality and charm into the blockbuster.

captain America civil war is the best superhero movie ever made, period. that means better than both avengers and better than Nolan's batman movies. its even better then the last cap movie. there was so much going on in this movie that it could have used 5 or 10 more mins of footage to slow it down in the first act, but then it would have been over 2.5 hours long and we know how decision makers frown on that. the first 15 seconds of tony meeting peter felt a little stiff but thats small.there is one big problem i had but its not a cap problem is more of a spider man problem, aunt may is to darn young.the movie had really good organic humor that made you laugh. no cheesy one liners like in Age of Ultron. the airport battle is the best ever put on any live action superhero movie, ever. less destruction but better than man of steel, even better then winter soldier. to have better action then both of those is really saying something.the motivations of both cap and iron man was well thought out. iron man sees and feels all the damage thats done trying to save people. at some point he even feels betrayed by cap. on the other side of the coin cap knows there are casualties even when you do your best to stop it, its unavoidable ( he probably learned that from WW2), cap believes in Bucky, especially after cross bones said he remembers you, and there is no way cap is going to let the only real childhood friend he ever had die. not to mention a fellow soldier from the war. loved this movie from start to finish.

Review title: Superb story and best climax fight between heroes
Review_body: Its a movie where you can see heroes as villains. Its always obvious that you go to the theater and saw a hero and a villain. And in the end villain either dies or captured. But this epic movie is not one of those boring movies. It mixes in the various complications of the real world, where superheroes should work according to governments. But captain knew these governments very well and this started all the action and drama. Action , I mean just action with a very little history or reasons behind doesn't gives much. You always asks yourself ,this much fight just for gold or some superpowers. But here ,there is a whole lot of reasons due to which heroes turned against heroes.All in all, this is a great superhero movie in which you will not find anything stupid, but if you find it stupid , then you are negligent to drama which creates action. And you should go and watch transformers.

Review title: Fun but not recommended for smart movie watcher and comic geek
Review_body: I'm never wrote any review before, but I think I should make a clarification for this one.First of all I love the action, the casting, and of course Robert Downey Jr. Shows us how talented he is . But I think the biggest hole in this movie is the story. imagine you're passenger and you watch them fighting at the airport, they're over powered people, flying robots, public figures , and a giant, isn't it funny ? Will you see it as a serious incident or thinking that this is a high school theater ?, Fighting in a wide empty space when you're only about 6vs6 is so stupid, those silly people who likes this movie doesn't know anything about civil war comic. And so shame marvel doesn't kill capt just like in the comic. This is why I think civil war is such a kid movie because the story isn't deep and complicated enough. I think every marvel geek would be unsatisfied with this version of civil war, the civil war comic issue is so deep and have so many of character, it makes the civil war looks more "civil" war , not the "few of grown up people" war. But imagine if they had a secret identity and the government makes a rule where the superheroes have to take off their mask, isn't it more complicated because everyone has a family and none of us wanted if family get involved into our problem. The government and people in this movie also looks like stupid people, they think the superhero is the reason to all of the incident, then it means that they're not respecting a hero and would rather die because of the villain than getting their houses damaged . I wish marvel could make another great movie like the first avengers movie in the future. Thanks

Great film forgetting that spider-man Was making an appearance went in my favor.He stole the show, by leaps and bounds. Toby was great, let's forget the other guy, but Tom Holland is amazing great persona and best costume. Aside from that while it may not follow the comic and some characters are missing it is still an amazing movie. A great addition the the Marvel Universe that we all love.Like some I'd call it Avengers 2.5 due to the rather full cast but it's a great was to begin the next phase.

Captain America: Civil War was is a mediocre action flick which can not decide whether it should take a dark and gritty tone, or continue with the silly popcorn style. from the outset it starts to build up some seriousness with a death scene and asking questions about consequences about previous movies. but fails to build on this soon enough when the action starts. The destruction of previous movies are something which didn't go unnoticed and warranted the signing of the sokovia accords. This tries to establish the MCU as an universe where actions have consequences. at the same time no one seems to care that scarlet witch aided and abetted Ultron in the last film. Iron Man did not have to face any grave consequences from the government or the public for creating Ultron in the first place. These issues fly in the face of the realism that was tried to be created here.things that were good: Nicely choreographed action sequences and set pieces. good portrayal of new heroes such as spider-man and Black Panther.things that were not so good: Soundtracks were forgettable.for a lot of cases, No reasons were offered to explain why the supporting heroes joined the teams they joined. Antman and Hawkeye randomly joins cap team while Spidy and Romanov randomly joins Iron Man. This felt like football team selection for the school yard. The main fight scene between the superheroes felt unnecessary and forced. While they are fighting in the airport, which is very conveniently empty, the joking took away the seriousness. The hitting felt fake and inconsequential. It felt like a WWE wrestling match more than a life and death situation.There are few inconsistencies in the plot as well:Iron man is given a tough deadline to catch cap but he still has enough time to design a spider-man suit.Main villain Zemo has enough resources to bomb UN but not enough resources to kill avengers while they are offgaurd? his plan depended completely on luck. What if cap failed to save Bucky? What if the agent carter hadn't died at that exact moment and cap never met her niece? What if she never helped cap to get his shield back? these things couldn't have been planned by zemo but cap getting his shield back and meeting him in that hydra site was critical to his plan. this is not explained properlyHow did a single CCTV camera record Bucky killing the stark parents and cover so many angles in such details? enough details to see stark moms facial expressions? With a cctv camera in the 90s? why did hydra even have a camera at that exact spot? Bucky catching up the the Stark car could be 2 minutes before or 2 minutes after. in such case there would be no recordings.What if Iron man team won the airfield match and arrested Cap and killed Bucky? overall, It was good to watch for the fight scenes but lacked in immersive qualities.

Review title: Awesome visuals, acting, and script yet, no good villain (NO SPOILERS)
Review_body: Characters: The movie shines with really great acting and decent character development considering having many of them. The greatest and most exciting characters are definitely the new comers, Black Panther and Spider-Man. You can see the effort done for portraying both of these characters.Visuals and fight scenes: GREATEST FIGHT SCENES EVER. It definitely beats those in The Winter Soldier and those were PLAIN AWESOMENESS. Every fight scene with Black Panther is especially captivating.Humor: So easy and funny and was very helpful to lighten up the tone of the movie. Spider-Man and Ant-Man are the funniest and you'd expect that. Ant-Man probably had the least scenes in the movie but managed to get many laughs out of me with every line.Plot: Now that's the reason I deducted a point. Civil war is a powerful comic book in terms of story and the movie version didn't live up to that in my opinion. Also, The villain is so poorly written and his scheme is so lame. I couldn't help to think that Cap is more of a villain than him actually :DMusic: Simply not as nearly epic as the movie.Finally: This is definitely the best Marvel Movie ever and I think if they had paid more attention to the story and villain it would have beaten The Dark Knight in becoming the best comic book movie ever.

Enjoyed the film, although it wasn't particularly a stand-out. Action was decent though pacing erred in places; storyline was mediocre, overstuffed and all over the place; Evans was rather plastic. Downey Jr's acting was fantastic despite the poor choice made for the direction of his character. Hawkeye and Spider-Man had no place in the film; felt like the Russos were shoehorned into having Spider-Man in the film for marketing purposes. Chadwick Boseman was interesting on debut and was a good pick for Black Panther. Good to see Vision and Scarlett Witch finally get some much-needed character development, even if it was minor. Once again, we see a MCU edition with no real consequences. The story seemed way too forced. Bruhl was another missed opportunity by Marvel for a great villain, though that is the story's fault, not his acting. Hoping that the Russos ramp it up for the Infinity War movies.

Review title: The Russo Brothers have done it again
Review_body: One of the better marvel movies! They balance the characters so well and you really see development of everyone considering the sheer amount of main characters there are. The Russo brothers are truly unmatched!

It is overstuffed(in order to be very good) and repetitive like other avenger movies and has a serious identity crisis. Apart from cinematography and action everything else is pathetic, It is more suited to children, people with fully evolved minds would find it absolutely boring and this is the trend now with all the superhero movies which have everything stuffed in them except a story(forget about being a decent one),The main problem with captain America is stuffing every superhero on earth, i think a superhero movie should be about one super human being who realizes that he has powers and uses them to do good for the mankind,but here u have a no. of superheroes (who sometimes fight among themselves) and only a poor solitary villain which makes the movie that much less interesting due to lack of power balance between the villain and hero.Any normal guy would have a perception from the start that "there's no way this villain can save his ass from these many SUPERheroes".

Review title: They did well, but i'm not feeling excited anymore
Review_body: I still remember my first Marvel movie, the iron man I released in 2008 when I'm still in high school.(Spiderman doesn't count) I've never heard iron man before neither marvel universe, I went because I happened to have to one coupon and it was the only action movie at that time. My big-boy personality was brought up by all the cool armor stuff. And since then I watched every marvel superhero movies in the cinema. 8 years after it. I'm still sitting in the cinema watching Captain America III. The whole scene is even better than the avengers, gathering new team members and enhance the old. Even Spiderman get re-made. The scene at the airport is awesome and clearly they have way more budgets than dead pool. But I'm not getting excited any more; all they do are just hunting villains saving the world and people are still stupid enough to live in the super crowded cities waiting something bad happens. Maybe the only one who changes is Tony; he used to be a typical playboy and gradually grown up into someone thinks of the society. 8 years later, Tony's boyhood is over and so do I.

I am kind of new to superheroes and comics, and has many times though that they are reusing the epic moments from Avengers when the Hulk smashes the big whale-snake-floating ship, and I thought that the Thor movie was pretty B and 3D- infested mess. But this movie is pretty awesome! Using all characters and making them feel like you know them, when watching their single movies to the big civil war fighting is awesome! But I got to say awesomeTHAT SPIDERMAN!! I never really thought much about the actors they used in the portraying of Spiderman through the other Single-movies. You can never really relate to them, and they feel a bit like, they put a 30 year old man to play a high schooler. A high schooler who is really good- looking, not awkward at all and feel, in Garfields case like a douchebag, more then that weird "science-geek" he is suppose to portray. "I am a high-schooler". But really they are not! They don't have that awkward set up like you do when you are that age. In the way that they break in their voice or in the way they act. But this Spiderman does!! First when I saw Peter Parker i Civil War, I was confused thinking he was someone else. But when he started to act his part!! PERFECTON! This is the BEST Spiderman I have ever seen, with or without the costume! Well now I am just blabbing about the spiderman-moment... But just giving me a sneak-peak of these characters awesome setup and the big fight! Gave me all the Epic-Movie moments I could ask for this summer! Thank you Marvel for bringing Spiderman back to his Teenage self!

first of all, I'm sorry for my bad English. oke, here's the things. this movie plays with extremely sequence from the past into the present day, in my opinion only "The sixth-sense" can role the sequences perfectly in time. Clint, Vision as the most figure of changing their views, well we can say Vision as the most-wise character in this movie. but then, Clint is coming and bringing new figure which is "Gi-ant-man". well, the most interest point of this movie is the role of Winter Soldier itself and Zemo. Winter Soldier was coming into his home, his pal. and his role is connecting to the whole climax. how about Zemo? because of his role, the epic superheroes against each other appears. so then I could give 9 even 9.5 but I can't because I will miss captain until Infinity war and for me that's too long.. good movie, best in sequences, every character appear without oppressing to other, and for Zemo, your plan is succeeded? DID IT?

Review title: This is why I love Marvel Cinematic Universe!
Review_body: This movie is awesome!I watched this movie last week. And everything is PERFECT! The story, humor, characters, conflict, script, everything <3 EVERYTHING IS PERFECTI love how they portrayed Spiderman in this film Finally they got Peter Parker/Spiderman right! And the Black Panther was introduced nicely too!I won't spoil anything because it's too good to be spoiled.Oh, I suggest you to search WHIH Newsfront channel on Youtube and watch their recent videos before watch this movie.P.S. Do not expect the villain will do much. Because this story is about Capt. America vs Iron Man, people!

I walked into Civil War with high hopes and dreams that almost all were reached of my high standards. There were some idiots in my cinema who complained they didn't know who Crossbones or The Winter Soldier were (they had not wanted to see CAWS and only came for the avengers) so If i sound angry it is because of those idiots who demanded marvel should have explained the characters for people that didn't see the others. Okay so this isn't an adaptation of the comics AT ALL. The one thing that upset me was that Crossbones was killed in the first few minutes of the film (unlike comic civil war were he kills Cap with Agent 13). Now Tachaka is in the film but is killed off early on to motivate Black Panther witch is good. The main antagonist of the film is Baron Zemmo (or just Zemmo as instead of being a Hydra agent and all that stuff, his family died in Sakovia as he is sakovian) he tries to take down the Avengers by making them fight each other. He is mysterious and overall a good bad guy for Marvel's standards and could possibly come back one day with the purple mask as for once he is not killed off. The best parts of this film were Spiderman and the fight scene. Spiderman is young and a bit of a beginner but never the less he is interesting. And he jokes around a lot and also fan girls over Buckeys arm. The middle battle was awesome with great characters and great stories, especially Spiderman and Black Panther. Another BIG part of this was Giant man and the AT-AT reference I did not think they were going to make but they did it.I was upset Black Widow betrayed Team Iron Man. Even though the 3rd act is emotional it has lost a lot of steam from the action pact events of the 2nd act but is emotional non the less. I like Chris Evans as Cap any day but the most emotional thing I think they could have done for Starks character was for him to kill Bucky or Cap in the end. The movie ends with Cap going into hiding, featuring two end credit scenes including Cap putting Bucky into chryosleep in Wakanda and a Spiderman set up. Over all this was a good film and probably the best movie in The MCU to date with amazing Directors and writers.

Review title: Sometimes a roller-coaster, sometimes a really boring boat ride
Review_body: If you, like me, didn't watch Agents of Shield, read the recent comics or watch and read all the other extended content Marvel throws at you, the first hour of this movie is going to be boring and confusing. It doesn't really pull you into the story (if any) either. We get a movie with a boring political premise, after that, characters and heroes we've come to love over a couple of movies suddenly go haywire. Characters we've seen bonding over several movies, been through almost 326 apocalypses and were ready to die for each other 47 times suddenly hate each other. Why? Because politicians divide them. Or something, I'm still not quite sure. Then popcorn time starts. Special effects splatter the screen in a fantastic manner, the colors in this movie are simply awesome. We gaze at superheroes clashing it out and it simply looks extremely good. Black Panther does some awesome stuff, some talking, more fighting. Fighting. Fighting. And eventually it ends. The movie is 3,5 hours, but feels a solid 5. If you forget the story (which is easily done) this is a visually stunning movie. Too bad that's all it is.

The Captain America movie franchise has come a long way. Ever since Winter Soldier, when you first notice a change in the delivery pattern. It was now Cap 2.0. The actions were how you would imagine a superhuman would fight. With Civil War, it maintained that same tone and vigor. It was a fun ride to get hyped together with the internet with those memes speculating on how the war would broke out between Cap and Iron Man and when you finally get to hear the real reason on screen, I was like "Ohh, okay... I am feeling this". You understand what those characters were defending, it was not just out of greed, pride or for their personal gain but from what they, as their own experience and sense of honour and justice feel and they hold on to that and thus the dispute. Black Panther was so good. While watching the movie with my brother, I keep telling him "Oh man, can you believe this, that's Black Panther, that's him, they nailed it". He was my absolutely favourite. Chadwick Boseman was phenomenally perfect in that role, marvelous casting there. And coming to Spiderman, I know a lot of people out there said this before and I will say it as well, 'BEST SPIDERMAN EVER!'. He was great. The humour was there, the spider-man persona was well captured and executed. Well yeah, in the end. It's a Russo brother movie, it's great. It's amazing!

This movie is definition of comic-book movie...It doesn't matter which side you are on you will question your side at the end of the movie,Speaking briefly of the movie, it is an emotional roller coaster with an absolutely beautiful end. Spidey had a satisfying screen time. As for the acting, by the time the movie ended, I was a happy man. Russos are handling Infinity War, and after watching this movie, how they did justice to characters, I'll not worry. A movie we wanted as well as deserve. The cast is perfect and everyone is used exceptionally well. This IS the best sequel the genre has ever seen and I know tat's saying a lot. It could be Marvel's best effort ever.

i am a huge fan of captain America, it was played very well and the airport scene wow just flawless, and spiderman really looking forward to see your solo movies, really its worth it to see this in big screen awesome it really is f*cking awesome.well evans did a great job his martial arts really perfect and yeah it was a good ride for fighting scene, romantic scene, everything you should watch it, i can't say anything more i just write this because he well really my superherowatch it will dolby atmos technology and imax screenwhy this review has to be soooooooooo long

This film is a masterpiece in super hero genre. Almost every character there was well constructed. The film is well paced, the action scenes were great, the story was simple yet well presented. Even when Spider Man was introduced it didn't ruin the film's pacing or made his insertion seem forced. Black Panther may be a bit of a disappointment in the beginning but as the character develops he gets much better and matures more than Tony Stark. The villain? He wasn't even necessary, and yet did what he had to do. Some of the characters question the whole new law thing and start thinking about their actions in recent events. It's not like the comics, but for me it seems that the director and the script writer did everything they could with the resources they had. I know that giving it a 10 may be a bit of an exaggeration for some people because there are better films than this one, but for me in the super hero genre this one is the best so far.

This is one of the Marvel's good movies. But it lacks in some points. As usual we are expecting a huge action and a deadliest villain entry, but this time seems Marvel has failed to bring a great villain. Just like Loki & Altron this character seems like not that great. If you thing of joining a side of the two team I mean team Cap or team Tony Stark then you must be amazed by your decision but after watching the movie. Every character has played their specialty in this movie. Sometimes except starting felt little boring but some immediate action makes thrill & shout you loudly. The new entry of Spidy & Black Panther definitely played their specialty. Falcon has seriously well equipped. I loved the drones used by Falcon. But the action in the Airport & last few minutes make you say waoo.

The King T' Chaka is speaking Zulu to his son. If you want to make up a fake country and use any African dialect or a made up one sure, go ahead, but we love Marvel also and you owe it to African viewers to be authentic. If you hire a South African actor, good for you but he has to speak a Nigerian dialect or then change the name of the country he is representing. You have producers you pay for that reason! But the Hollywood idea of thinking only of American viewers who see "other languages" as gibberish is offensive to us who understand and pay money only to see have our cultures misrepresented. Hollywood has produced quite a few movies with African actors speaking different languages and pretending to be having a conversation. Yes, its acting! I know someone is going to say that!

Review title: It was disappointing, because it is much of talking than action ! and There is no hulk !
Review_body: I hate this last movie, I mean what they thought when they did the movie ? like lets fight ! they could come up with something even nicer like fighting with aliens something like that ! but instead they went and fought with each other ! come on ! really ?!One more disappointing thing is that there is no Hulk or Thor in the movie ! I mean why ? what happen ! obviously because they hated the plot so they said no way we will join this sh*t !0/10 to this movie ! I hope they fix it !Thy are talking and talking and talking and the voice is so low unless the action starts then it is boom ! you need your remote now ! because it is freaking loud ! and then they speak again ruin the moment kill the joy destroy the movie

i loved every bit of it..it was the best of all the marvel movies..i have watched it already two times..and i am still planning of watching it again.. lol i never wrote a review before for any movie..but this..and Chris Evans..he did really awesome in this movie.. after all it was HIS movie lol..i really hope there will be another captain America part..because i love watching Chris Evans a captain America..this role really suits him.. Russo brothers did not disappoint us.. the overall acting by the characters was amazing.. actions O MY GOD!! especially the actions done by scarlet Johanson story was pretty smooth with literally no flaws..actually the best story ever.. they showed the different part of super heroes..in normal superheroes movie it is all about how to fight with the villain..but in this movie there is no villain and you have to fight with your friends:D <3

Review title: It is brilliant incredible a masterpiece
Review_body: As a comic book reader my expectations were really really high but again Marvel didn't disappoint and gave its fans the best adaptation this comic can get.Not even for a moment I was bored,I didn't even blink so I won't miss a second of it.The movie was so action-packed and the fight choreography was mind-blowing.Also it was so intense and showed us each hero has a dark side but at the same time extremely funny.I was having heart attack watching but also laugh my self into tears.This is what you really expect from a movie,to give you a little bit of both.The Russo brothers did an excellent job.Not just bringing all these heroes together but also introducing new ones.It is not easy.They come up with a story that it is not just a political incident but also an emotional showdown.We finally got to see how the world really feels about heroes.We see the damage they have done.Yes they saved thousands but what about the ones we have lost.It was the best answer to the people who think that Marvel isn't realistic.I ask you can they get more realistic?!Another thing that got my attention was we finally got a movie that does not end with saving the world cliché. We also see that heroes does not always win.Another point that needs appreciation was the visual effects.As someone studying software engineering I'm very strict about basic points and they did a great job.Everything looked so real and they gave us a fight scene that will leave its mark in history.To the ones saying there is too much CGI.Try shooting without the CGI and just good luck.I really believe that the visual effects is the thing that gets our favorite heroes out of the comics into the real world.Finally all I ask is just forget about your prejudgments and stop comparing this to BVS.Just enjoy one of the best comic book movies of all time.

Captain America:civil war is,without question, the most overrated movie ever made.Featuring an extremely incompetent person as an extremely competent villain,the movie drags through the first half and rewards the audience with a cgi fight which looks more or less like a bar fight.And spider man,whose cameo was the most gratuitous and unnecessary,looks cgi and unfinished.The central plot of the movie is utter nonsensense. After boring us with scenes of saving people by loading them into shield helicarrier in Age of Ultron,they are still blaming the heroes?Wouldn't it have made sense blaming Tony Stark for creating Ultron?The plot holes in this movie is big enough to sink the titanic.

Review title: Maybe Marvels studio finest film yet
Review_body: Well lets see. The movie flows smooth. The action is mind-blowing , the cgi is on a level that i never have seen before. Acting is great, no one could fit the role as Iron Man as good as Robert Downey JR. Chris Evans nails the role as Cap, and the chemistry between Iron man and Cap is the best. The story dos like this: A political rift between Iron Man and Captain America causes them to split up, meanwhile a man named Zemo is out with revenge. This is a avenger movie, only just whiteout Hulk and Thor. There were so many superheroes pressed into one movie. Heroes like: Black Panther, Iron Man, Black Widow, Captain America, Ant Man, Spiderman, Hawkeye, Scarlet Witch, Crossbones( All though he is not a hero), Warmachine, Falcon, Vision and The Winter Soldier. Is that a good thing. Well in this movie it was. But maybe in future Marvel movies, there will be too many for one movie. We will see. Of course we got to think of the bad things in the movie. It was not easy to find any thing, but if you nitpick you will find somethings that doesn't fit. Like the love story between Cap and Sharon Carter. If you've seen The winter Soldier, you probably know who she is. If you haven't you'll have no clue. Also the Avengers get blamed for all the death they have caused, but what of those lines they have saved. Nobody mentions that when the General( Played by William Hurt) brings up the accords. But its a great movie. Go and watch it now.

To start off, I am a huge Marvel fan & absolutely LOVE watching all of their films. Captain America: Civil War was a highly awaited one & there was good reason for that, it had all the right ingredients to be the best superhero movie till date. An explosive cast? Check. A gripping storyline? Check. A realistic problem? Check. Drama & suspense? Check. Humour? Check. Excitement? Check x infinity. The movie starts off really well & really does keep you at the edge of the seat wondering what will come next but in the end it let's you down as it ends in a really simplistic manner. (Spoilers beyond this line) Tony finds out his parents had been murdered by Bucky & in a fit of rage & thirst for vengeance faces off against Bucky & CapAm, in the end he gets beat & accepts defeat. But here the plot begs the question: Would a character like Tony who does not give up when his loved ones are in question & who has a fairly large ego just stop because he got beaten once? I don't think so & I feel that's a major plot hole, Tony would come back with a new Iron Legion & make CapAm & Bucky pay. The only way to stop him would have been if Tony had EMPATHISED with Bucky, making him realise that just like he had killed innocents with Ultron unknowingly, Bucky had killed innocents under Hydra's control unknowingly. That's the only way Tony would have realised the flaws of his actions & that an eye for an eye makes the whole world blind. CapAm going on fighting as if it was personal rather than an effort to save a friend from a friend also messed with Steve Rodgers' character as a sensible guy. The movie ends on a sour & unrealistic note, Zemo gets his way, the Avengers crumble & Captain America is the only one who gets what he wants - a complete ignorance of the Sokovia Accords. As a regular viewer of Marvel movies I had come to expect their movies ending on positive notes but this one just didn't feel like that & I for one wasn't too fond of the change. I'm not saying the movie was bad, no it was definitely good, Spider man is the best Spider man yet, the interplay of Falcon & CapAm is fantastic, Black Panther is someone you definitely connect with & Ant Man continues to pull much more than his weight however this movie for one had the potential to be absolutely perfect but it wasn't & the only reason for that was the sour finish. An unrealistic finish that completely ignores the character traits of 2 of it's most important characters. If I were to sum up my feelings I'd say I'm satisfied but not pleased as Marvel, in my humble opinion, let slip an opportunity to bring to its fanbase the best superhero movie till date.

Just came back from a screening... I am trying so hard to think about ways to nitpick my way out of it. but this movie is one of those rare achievements that can juggle between being so gleefully exiting, serious, tense and foreboding yet remain so cohesive and committed to it's narrative. I had high expectations, the Russo's didn't even care about my comparatively lowly expectations, because they had their own. this movie is the overachiever of the MCU, it brings you the goods, and THAN SOME. everyone has their glory moments, but at the heart it's an epic dispute between friends, idealists and pragmatists. what's amazing is that it's not only a struggle between Cap and Iron Man (and also Bucky) it's their own internal struggles, and that echoes in all the characters. it's actually the newcomer who come on top of it all, and that is Black Panther who is easily one of the most well put together heroes I've ever seen come through such a short introduction. he along with Winter Soldier get to make choices you wouldn't assume a comic book character would, choices that get into resolutions through unconventional means. Spiderman is a glorified cameo, I gotta admit he is, but good god Marvel is in so much swagger they can get away with it! Tom Holland finally nails it and you know why? because he doesn't try so hard to be a silver age impossible nerd ala Maguire or the market approved "millennial" Garfield Spider-Man. you just look at him, and he totally naturally IS that nerd, you believe he is Peter Parker from Queens and you believe he is Spider-Man. the beginning of the movie sets the precedence for everyone incredibly well and it's all just a natural progression that gets into the airport. now the airport fight was so amazingly choreographed, everyone gets to do something absolutely amazing and it had so many moments straight out of... yeah, I know it's been chewed out that line "straight out of a comic book page". I've heard that said before, and I think it's arguably true- this might just be THE best or at least the most grandiose fight ever to put on film between superheroes. Civil War even beat Batman V Superman in what BVS set it's goal to be- CW is way darker at the heart of it's conflict, it touches dark violent history behind some characters and thematically it approaches dark material with incredible maturity, a maturity BVS's infantile teenage like angst attitude couldn't approach. the climax is tense, it holds no reservation about how violent the clash between our heroes can escalate into and it makes us understand everyone, even our villain do what they do. Civil War is a triumph, it shows us just how far Comic Book movies can reach when they put their A game into it. it also shows that absurdity and nuance are not oil and water. we should all celebrate this triumph, we earned it!

Review title: Avoid the 3D Version (IMAX/Real3D), otherwise pretty okay
Review_body: The movie itself is okay, entertaining, although a bit slow at times. I found the camera-work a bit annoying, as very often the director chose to film past a near object or person, creating a blurry out of focus item that covers up to a third of the screen. For the 3D IMAX Version that means a 3D blur in the foreground. The Shaky Camera Action and extremely fast cuts (1 second or less per perspective) during Action Scenes make it hard to focus on anything in the 3D Version, but i guess it works fine for 2D.I am happy to see Daniel Bruehl (Goodbye Lenin, Joyeux Noel, Inglorious Basterds, Burnt) in this movie, he has come very far!

The Marvel Cinematic Universe has grown and matured in all the right the ways throughout the years. Establishing a shared universe with rich characters is no easy task, let alone succeeding, without compromising the quality and ethics in such a grand undertaking. Before watching Captain America - Civil War I was very skeptical about how anyone would be able to properly handle this amount of characters and high quality actors in a balanced and meaningful way. My expectations were sky high, having genuine respect for the creative handling of century old comic book characters that has been done so far is truly formidable. From start to end the movie gives you a thrill ride of untold proportions. Never was there a moment through the movie that i found useless or not helping the plot. Best Marvel movie to date, without a doubt!

Review title: this can be considered as the classic of the comic action film!
Review_body: Well well well , Marvel have done it again ! What an amazing movie that was. excellently Written movie , from the start to the end this movie was so brilliant. Weeks before this movie was released I was wondering how they would fit every characters role on screen but I was excelled at how good it was. Each character had an perfect amount of screen time. The movie was very well paced so it kept me extremely interested throughout the whole movie. Also the story line was brilliantly produced that I could not have imagined. Chadwick Boseman and Tom Holland played Black Panther and Spiderman beautifully which was a relief. All in all Captain America Civil War Was a great movie and broke a lot of expectations ! Can't wait for the rest of the marvel movies :) !!!

Right from the beginning, we see Captain America and his team trying to stop Crossbones and his team of mercenaries who have stolen a vial of highly infectious virus to sell to the highest bidder and when finally getting caught, Crossbones (Frank Grillo) tries to blast himself, Scarlet Witch (Elizabeth Olsen) user her power to push the impact of the blast up in the air and the explosion destroys the seventh floor of a nearby building. While this was a mere attempt to minimize casualties, people still lost their lives. It was neither their fault, nor it could have been avoided anyways. The situation was the main culprit to blame.This is what Captain America : Civil War (2016) is all about.Team Avengers have saved the world from technological demons like Ultron, extraterrestrial threats like Loki's army, have dismantled Hydra outpost commanded by Baron Wolfgang Von Strucker but lost keeping count of bodies unnecessarily wasted in the mayhem. As previously said, they couldn't have been avoided. But as the Moses said in Numbers 32:23 of Hebrew Bible that "Be sure your sin will find you out!", nemesis in the form of Zemo (Daniel Brühl) comes for The Avengers to count on the sins they have committed without any choice and deliberation.The Story is based on the clash of intellect between Captain America (Chris Evans) & Iron Man (Rober Downey Jr.) when political interference in Avenger's activities bring a situation of unrest among the members due to unethical rules, boundaries and limitation imposed upon the Avengers. They are told to sign the Sokovia Accords proposed by UN that suggest certain boundaries in the work culture of Avengers and show uncertainty where Captain-America-Civil-War-Art-Iron-Man-Team-Bruno- AlvesAvengers might be posted for work. Before the contention regarding this was over, Captain's old friend Bucky Barnes aka Winter Soldier (Sebastian Stan) is held suspected for the blast at a conference in Vienna which takes the life of the Wakanda King T'Chaka (John Kani). His son, T'Challa (Chadwick Boseman), furiously seeks revenge and returns as Black Panther to eliminate the man behind his father's death.As the story escalates, when everything seemed to be under control after Bucky's arrest by the Shield, Zemo disguised as Dr.Mueller, a psychiatrist makes an appearance over there and brainwashes Bucky into creating a ruckus again to make things worse again. Captain America gets a hunch of the conspiracies behind all of this and with Bucky, tries to reach Zemo but is tried to stop by his own fellow Avengers as he is considered a fugitive now. The experiences get much more bitter and finally, the curtain rises over the real matter which is entirely something else. Everyone has done a great job especially Chris Evans as Steve Rogers and Robert Downey Jr. as Tony Stark. Steve Rogers is the most matured, brave and gentleman of the whole Avengers team. In civil war, we see his side where he is extremely sympathetic towards his old friend (which was also there in Captain America : The Winter Soldier) and a devil-may-care attitude just to stand aside justice. We also see a rather emotional side of Tony Stark, psychologically the most complex character of Marvel, and how Sokovia incident (Age of Ultron) changed Tony's perspective towards panache heroism and gave birth of judgment of setting limits in bravery. How his parents's death affect him mentally didn't really show that much potential but the try was commendable.The two big surprises are one on Team CAP that is Paul Rudd's hilarious cameo as Ant Man. Two awesome moments including Ant-Man's entering Iron man's suit through his FINGERS, and the other when he becomes gigantic, were extraordinarily entertaining. Now comes the more hilarious part of when a much younger, childish but fast as hell Spiderman (Tom Holland) marks his entry and constantly entertains us like anything. This might be the best cameo ever in the history of any Marvel Studios produced movie. Tom Holland is stupendously charming and wicked and in the race of best Spiderman ever, my money's on him, he was so damn impressive.Now, I would like to put some light on how Chadwick Boseman's Black Panther was about to steal away the show but lack of screen presence and script presence did not let that happen. This particular character is one of the most interesting ones in MCU and it seems appropriate justice will be done. The movie about him is soon to arrive and that is already teased by Marvel in the first post-credit scene. And by the way, yes, those scratch marks in Captain's Shield will remain that way now.My most favorite performance from the movie was by Daniel Brühl as Colonel Zemo. I know, this might be very weird choice of words I'm using and halfway through the movie, you will not understand why but as soon as the curtain raises from the actual matter, you will feel bad for this character deleting old recordings of his wife's voice and at the same time feel awestruck thinking about how a commoner like him jeopardized the harmony among Avengers single-handed. Brilliant, absolutely brilliant.It's monumental how Captain America : Civil War doesn't limit itself in being just another Superhero movie and pushes the limits by its unprecedented realistic plot where people are unable to completely deal with Superhumans, Monsters and other things beyond their beliefs. Full Marks.

Review title: Definitely worth a viewing or two
Review_body: Although did slow down a bit at times but for good reason and seemed like 2 movies within itself which is an appropriate way to define it. Civil War is partially an introduction to both minor and major recognizable marvel super heroes, although handled extremely well, one character in particular did seem a bit shoe horned but due to his immense contribution to the film in what little scenes he was in, it is completely forgiven. The threads Marvel has been sewing within the years have finally met their resolution in this film and by god it is amazing, a fight truly fueled within the years through build up has finally erupted and it is magnificent to see. This movie can be considered crowded but is a perfect example of how to handle all aspects in a way that looks seamless. Civil War was every thing I expected a sequel to Winter Soldier to be. With scenes that literally have you on the edge of your seat. I'm so happy I can now watch Captain America as a successful trilogy within itself, with each gradually bigger and better then the previous in my opinion.

Captain America: Civil War (2016), the opening to Marvel: Phase Three was incredibly stellar. 'Twas phenomenal and is the Marvel Studios' finest movie yet. I've literally waited for one and a half year and finally it didn't disappoint. This is 2016's third superhero movie in a row after Deadpool and Batman v Superman which I've completely enjoyed watching. The Russo brothers have nailed it and I can say the 'Infinity Wars' are in good hands. The conflict in ideologies makes it believable why the characters fight here. I know both the movies BvS and Civil War could be kept for comparison but we are actually emotionally invested in all the characters from both the films. All your favourite guys split into teams and fight is visually a treat. Who needs a villain when you have Steve Rogers and Tony Stark? Both protagonists. Both antagonists.The 17-minute airport fight scene is one of the best action sequences in the history of superhero movies. Every character feels respected. The not-an-usual kid from Queens had an amazing presence and a satisfying screen time. Welcome home Spidey! And, the Wakandan Black Panther was absolutely remarkable. Thor, Banner and Pepper were missed.Special mention: Those power-packed dialogues, flawless action scenes, Spidey's cool action-comedy, Baron Zemo (though not a great villain but he has motivation), Stan Lee's cameo and of course Martin Freeman (our John "Hamish" Watson 😀 ). I give my rating a clean 9 out of 10.

Review title: I am sorry to say this,
Review_body: But this movie was literally boring. action hero here, action hero there? You wanna know the truth about this movie?this movie is about positive discrimination, you see 2 or 3 black guys who got super powers and are working with white guys like friends. FAKE FAKE FAKE. Not special, boring.Did you see the new Star Wars Force Awekeness. this is the same ,about positive discrimination. A black guy Jedi? Black people don't even watch star wars.this whole IMDb seems pretty fake to me, when i read some of the reviews its like people get paid to leave false (positive) reviews about a movie.Jesus Christ this movie is not even near 8.5 score, nor is the Star Wars.i was looking at score of the movie Black Sea, pretty low score, while i watched this movie and its real, natural, spectacular. acting is super B and still it has lowers score then this pillow of bull crap? the whole IMDb seems to be untruthful source.

It was a great movie! But am Nigerian and I live in Lagos. The first setting of the of the movie was Lagos, Nigeria and that didn't look like Lagos, Nigeria. The buildings the people, the roads, in fact that's not how Nigerians would act if they saw Anthony Mackie as "The Falcon" or Captain America himself. Trust me we would run, no one would be outside! And the way it was pronounced in the news wasn't correct its more "lay-gus". There's no place called "T'Chaka" or "Wakanda" and we have kings but they are very traditional so they don't do politics that often. We run a democratic system of Government in Nigeria, we have a President and Governors and even Local Government Chairmen. If anybody is going to represent Nigeria it's gonna be the President not a King. At the United Nations conference in the movie he said something like "kosi" which should mean "thank you", although we have so many languages in Nigeria and Lagos is like a "united state" or a metropolis everyone comes to do business here, I may not know all the languages but Lagos is known for these five languages namely; English, Yoruba, Hausa , Igbo and Pidgin (our own version of English, its like a not so fluent version of English with modifications. Its common among illiterates but we have all come to understand and use it informally both literate and illiterate alike.) but the language used in the scene seemed like Yoruba if it is then its wrong the right word would have been "Ose" pronounced "Oshay". Okay it's cool that the black panther's character revolves around Nigeria. Despite all that it was still a great movie. Thumbs up!

To start my review, I must say I'm not a big fan of Marvel and I'm not very familiar with the pre-sequels. I got into the cinema, with the feeling of both excitement and both I would rather see Mowgli feeling.Firstly, as this movie built up, all I felt was boredom. Conversations were OK, but I couldn't pay much attention to it, as it felt like I know the movie's ending already. The only part of the movie, that was interesting for me, and I could really pay attention to was the Airport's fighting scene. But then again, the constant stupid jokes ruined it. I couldn't understand why everyone else laughed at these very awkward, corny jokes, at the cinema expect us. The story was bad and mediocre, also the acting was mediocre too. We decided to watch it, in 3d, but it turned out to be a bad idea, as the fighting scene's very clipping and felt low in FPS. Overall, It felt like it will never end, and we felt constant boredom through the whole movie. It is a mediocre action movie, and I don't really understand the means of the high ratings. I wish we could have seen Mowgli's story instead of this trite action movie (,but some of us really wanted to see this, because of the high ratings).

To start off all the ones this movie got on this website are the DC fans. Okay now this movie is what Age of Ultron should have been it's like Marvel's apology note to the fans, and yes you will forgive them after this movie. he movie is just great the Acting is perfect from everyone, the story is better than Ultron but not as good as Winter Soldier, special effects were great not perfect, and the the effect of this movie on the MCU is massive. The Russo brothers understand what they have to do, the comic book is much different but this version fits better to the Movie universe. It shows the conflict and gives the characters reasoning for what they are doing and give them depth and development. It is either a fraction lower or equivalent to the greatness of The dark Knight.

Review title: Best super Hero Movie This year?
Review_body: is to fast to said that is the best movie there are 4 movies that did not come out yet, but is very correct to said that this is the best marvel movie to the date, it mix all the drama, action, and fun in a perfect way, sadly marvel still can't figure out what to do with the villains of their movies, but i think it was necessary, to give more importance to the story between Cap and Iron man, unexpected twists, and the principal plot to drop tears, anyway for me this was close to perfection, with a few exaggerated things in the action but overshadowed by the awesome direction and storytelling of the Russo Brothers, there are some times that the shaky cam takes you out but it was very little, so for me awesome movie, awesome acting, great effects, spider-man is the best to the date, Black panther (T'chala) perfect match to all the bright avengers, is a must see movie, you can 't miss it in theaters. AWESOME!!!!

Review title: It is a good movie with quite some flaws at the first half.
Review_body: There's many flaws that added up during the first half of the movie, but the second half really made up for it. Adding more several new main characters in a sequel can be a hard thing, and there's quite a lot of plot-armor for the main characters and a few plot holes. However the second half wasn't flawless, but it was an incredible experience to watch that part. If i could rate the first half and second half individually i would rate the first 3/10 and second 8/10, but overall it was a nice experience that could arguably be 6/10. However I'm setting the score on 7. The final score might be what it is because i am slightly biased.

Best superhero movie after The Dark Knight in my opinion. The opening fight scene is awesome. There is a chase scene (as you already know) which is fantastically done. And off course the airport battle and the last battle are way too good. I loved RDJ in this movie. His acting was awesome in CW. Chris Evans was great too. Other casting members did good job. And same as the whole universe, I loved Spider-man,Black Panther and Ant Man.Many will call this a avengers movie. But nah, it is clearly a Captain America movie with avengers in it! You will know why after watching the movie. Story was good. Humor was great. The "Main Villain" was great too(many might disagree). Even the end credit scene was great! Man, everything was great in the movie! Just go watch it. (I am not a reviewer and i know this may not be called as a review. Whatever.....)

I saw The First Avenger and was expecting a lot more after seeing IM/IM2/Thor but those movies were just so much better than CA. Same thing happened with The Winter Soldier after seeing The Avengers/IM3/Thor: The Dark World/GOTG. After seeing Age of Ultron and Ant-Man I wasn't really looking forward to seeing Civil War because A2/AM were boring in my opinion, same with TFA/TWS but I saw Civil War tonight because it has been getting extremely great reviews and I have to say I was really, really impressed. Great story, amazing effects and most of all incredible action sequences. This is by far the best Marvel movie yet (besides Deadpool) and would highly recommend it to anyone to see once if not twice.

Review title: A fun experience, but not a great film.
