Review_body: It is by no means a great film. It's just solid, good fun. The fantastic action sequences were well shot, but other than that the cinematography was lacking. At times, I felt the framing and color palette made the film look like something that was made for television.The score for the film is lacking as well, especially for a film of this magnitude. It would have been nice to stray away from the generic, somewhat flat score, and instead have something more befitting of the films scale. The score at times undercut the epicness of what was transpiring on screen, which was quite jarring for me. The acting was fantastic. Robert Downey Jr. in particular gives his best performance as Stark to date. And the writing for his character is quite fantastic as well. I think it's fair to say I'm Team Iron Man.It's impossible to hate this film or call it terrible. I would gladly recommend this film to anyone, though I'd tell them to keep their expectations in check. Ultimately, I think this is a film that won't age too well, in the same way as The Avengers (2012). That film was hailed as one of the best films ever when it was released, rated above 9 on IMDb and with a very good Rotten Tomatoes rating. But as time went on, and people judged it for it's cinematic elements rather than the gimmick of seeing those characters on screen for the first time, the perception of the film changed. I think the same should happen with Civil War, because it's more reliant on the spectacle rather than it's cinematic quality.

Review title: I never thought Marvel Studios could set the bar this high.
Review_body: I never thought Marvel Studios could set the bar this high. Captain America Civil War is a total package. Entertaining, action- packed, humorous and an emotional ride. It's just a bonus if you've invested your time starting from the first Iron Man up to now to get attached to the characters, but it's not necessary.The airport battle royal between our favorite super heroes is the crowning moment of the film. The action sequences in that particular scene, plus the surprises, is one of the best I've seen in a comic book movie. Although every action sequence throughout the movie is nearly on par, if not on the same level. It's just that seeing a lot of characters going at each other is much more enjoyable.Black Panther, Spider-Man and Ant-Man were also highlights of the film, but everyone did an amazing job and had their deserved screen time. Some will definitely disagree with me on this one but as for Zemo, his role manipulating and working behind the scenes worked for me.For others saying this is Avengers 2.5, I didn't feel that way. I still felt this was a true sequel to Captain America The Winter Soldier (only partly, AoU). The conflicting ideologies of our two main heroes is still the focus of the whole movie and everything was balanced perfectly.To sum it up, this is arguably Marvel's best movie to date, and one of the best CBMs of all time. I can't wait for the solo outing of Black Panther and Spider-Man, and how the world of the MCU progresses from here.P.S. Honestly, I'm now having doubts that they can top this one with their line-up of upcoming solo movies, until maybe Infinity War. LOL!

Review title: Amazing film,was my favourite Captain America yet.
Review_body: SPOILERS DO NOT READ IF NOT WATCHED FILM This film in my opinion was my favourite Captain America, the action was amazing and did not leave me disappointed (and I did have high expectations of it). True there was a few mistakes in the storyline like how Iron Man had heard of Peter Parker never mind where he lived, and knew he was Spiderman. And also at the end where Zemo counted on Iron Man going after Captain America without being noticed. However even though Spiderman and Ant Man wasn't at all needed to the film I'm glad they was in it as I think they really added to the scene in both humour and action. And I think the ending was just a generally amazing fight. Overall I think it was a brilliant film true it had its mistakes but who really cares when there's some kick ass action and funny comments.

Review title: Greatest superhero movie of all time!!!!
Review_body: Ignore the insecure DC fan-boys down voting this film and giving it 1 star. It was a masterpiece and quite possible the greatest superhero film of all time. Marvel continues to display its superiority with another masterful addition to the MCU. Everything is prefect, the action, the direction, the pacing, the effects, the performances. Spiderman is amazing and ant man also steals the show here. The conflict is explored masterfully and doesn't feel ridiculous and fake like it does in BvS. We actually feel and care for these characters and understand their motivations. The Russo brothers make zack Snyder look like a complete amateur. Do you see Warner bros and DC? This is how you make a movie!!! Do yourself and favor and watch this masterpiece!!! Absolutely incredible stuff!

Review title: The best marvel movie of recent times.
Review_body: Having watched the trailer and all the build up towards this film, I had high hopes and my god were they met. Completely blown away by how amazingly well choreographed with the scenes of fighting! Tom Holland (Peter Parker/Spider-Man) was better than expected, funny charismatic and overall brilliant. He done the Spider-Man role justice and now I cannot wait for his reboot in 2017. As for Chadwick Boseman (T'Chala/Black Panther) just like Tom Holland done his role justice and was another great addiction to the set. Marvel definitely picked the perfect guy for the job as usual. The storyline was action packed, full of surprises and everything I wanted the film to be and more! My only critique was that Hulk (Mark Ruffalo) nor Thor (Chris Hemsworth) are in the movie, however both are expected to reprise their respective roles for the third and final movie in Thors trilogy for "Thor: Ragnarok". Again I repeat, the best marvel movie of recent times in my own opinion.

Review title: WAYYYYY better than Deadpool. Best of the MCU.
Review_body: I'm more of a DC fan, but this movie had me excited and pumped for most of the way. I hated Avengers, Iron Man, Thor, (and their unnecessary sequels) Marvel has shined in Guardians of the Galaxy, and these Captain America movies. Its gritty action, and good story was very well done. The acting for most of the characters was well done. But it still suffers from all of the characters being slated for more movies until 2033. So the stakes are lost. And they still unnecessarily shoehorn unfunny quips and jokes that take you out of the scene. Like the humor from Spider-man and Ant- Man alone worked amazingly. If they kept it to them, and whenever other characters had to react to them, it would've been a much more intense movie. To keep this review short I'm going to say that this is the best of the MCU, the only MCU movie in my top 100 favorites. A great time. It ends kind of abruptly for me, and I left wanting more. So, terrible performances from Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie, Scarlett Johansson, Scarlet Witch, and Agent 13. The rest I thought were great character performances. A good time at the movies. Overall rating: 8.4

Don't think I am going to talk about a compromise between the Iron Man and Captain America. But the compromise by each of the viewers of this movie to its director, camera man and script writer, for testing the patience with their not at all promising job.Script.. New style scripting makes sure that, 90% of the viewers will never understand what's going on the screen. Direction... I don't think the director has taken this movie seriously with some proper home work, except a few graphic works here and there and dragging scenes. Camera Man - Its pretty clear in the scenes that, the camera man was over excited about the action scenes, or he him self was cutting vegetables keeping camera in one hand. Camera movement was faster than the speed at which the cars in the scenes move around... viewers needs to strain the eyes to understand what is going on.. Poor camera handling at all.After all, those who want to loose money in big screen and those who wants to sleep in theater, its a nice choice.I am wondering, how come this movie has a big rating of 8.5 in IMDb? Bogus !!

There has been an alarming amount of Super hero films in recent times, as much as one would like to take a break from them, it does seem unlikely because the moment one franchise ends, another starts, and don't you just crave for something different. When the best film you have seen so far this year is 'Eddie The Eagle' (which is very engaging and entertaining), you know you've got problems.The last super hero film I saw was Batman v Superman. I went with some friends and when we left we were scratching our heads unable to decide whether we liked or disliked it. Sure there was a lot wrong with it. The colander script, the irrelevant characters, Superman still not having a personality..... the list goes on. But Ben Affleck's portrayal of Batman and the action scenes at least rescued it from being a complete turkey.But yesterday my friends and I saw the latest Captain America film. Having not being a fan of the first instalment, I didn't bother to see The Winter Soldier. But when I clocked the favourable reviews of Civil War, I thought maybe I should see The Winter Soldier before watching Civil War.I already had preconceived ideas of it being more like the Avengers than a film about Captain America. As long as it wasn't like Age Of Ultron, I didn't care. The reviews seem to be very favourable, and I was very impressed with The Winter Soldier, so what could go wrong?Well everything. Something I discussed with my friends after this movie is how easy it is to say what the best film you have ever seen is, as opposed to the worst. If I ever disliked a film, I don't think I have been able to watch it til the end or give it my full attention, so how could you truly say a certain film is the worst film you have ever seen if you have not been fully conscious to appreciate the ordeal?While Civil War is far from being the worst film I or anyone else has ever seen, this film does fall into the category of indifference or making you feel ambivalent. The three of us saw this film in the Everyman Cinema in Reigate, England. This is a very twee cinema. Very small and cosy, where the priority seats have sofas and small tables for you to rest your chocolate chip cookies and drinks on. Yes, so far I have already given a review of this beautiful cosy cinema, where as the film is about to start, an employee introduces the film and themselves and tells us that they hope we enjoy the film.Oh we enjoyed the cinema. It felt like the three of us had hired the room just to watch the film. Yes, just the three of us, no one else. Despite this we still whispered to each other until I realised that we could have shouted and we would only have annoyed ourselves. I did start a Mexican wave, but it didn't catch on.Then when we stopped whispering, we started talking amongst ourselves. We were bored and endlessly reminding each other how long this film was as yet another new super hero was being introduced. There were too many of them. When Hawkeye appeared I thought maybe Cup Holder Man was about to make an appearance. Why not? Everyone else has.With all the characters on screen, we found it somewhat confusing, and whatever criticisms that Batman vs Superman had, was magnified here. Sure the script is nowhere near as bad, but the sheer volume of characters doesn't make this film feel like it's about Captain America but actually about The Avengers. Even though Iron Man doesn't have much screen time in the first half of the film, if you walked in half way through, you would be forgiven in thinking the film was about him.Other reviewers will give this film far better scrutiny than I ever could, but when a film stops you caring about the characters the way this did, it's hard. Only time I cared was when Captain America gave Iron Man a kicking, but that is a small portion of an overly long film.Think I'll go and watch 12 Years A Slave again to chill out.

Review title: Not just a great Comic Book Movie, its a great MOVIE (Spoiler free Recview)
Review_body: Fantastic character driven film that makes the viewer's question themselves. Both sides are right and wrong at the same time. You will go back and forth between which side you are on.Pros:1) Great action scenes, especially the airport sequence2) Spider-Man, Black Panther and Ant-Man stole the show3) Each character gets their moment to shine (doesn't feel overcrowded at all) and acting is great4) Extremely well written plot5) Both sides provide valid points and reasons why they are fighting.50/50:1) Zemo is a great character and his reasons are solid. But his plan required a little too much "coincidence".Cons:1) Some of the characters' motives for choosing sides aren't that clear or explained.Overall great film. 9/10. One of the best Comicbook movie of all time. And undoubtedly a great movieTips: Though not 100% necessary, I would highly recommend seeing "Captain America : The Winter Soldier" and then "Avengers : Age of Ultron" to appreciate this movie. And to fully appreciate this movie see all MCU movies prior to to this.

Review title: Not a 10 but real close so technically a 9.5
Review_body: It was truly a great film, it made sense, was accurate and was what you expect from a Marvel Movie. The action was intense. The characters chosen for this film suited the way the film wanted to be done, in despite of all the seriousness of the movie, it had its funny moments to draw back on to kind of release the tension like all Marvel movies before. It provided a good ending to make future films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe have a purpose and direction for the future. I guess in ways it could've been slightly better, but to be honest I don't really how exactly it could be improved but you always think in some ways a movie isn't exactly perfect but this was pretty damn close. It fulfilled the promise of what I was expecting and I am looking forward to future films now to continue with this.

Review title: One of the best superhero movies ever
Review_body: Captain America: Civil War was a great start of Marvel's Phase Three and definitely one of the best superhero movies I've seen yet.Although it's positioned as Captain America's movie, it looks a lot like Avengers movie. There's plenty of previously seen characters and also some new, which are as amazing as the old ones. However, the plot, in my opinion, was much better than in the Avengers, because it wasn't just a fight between the good and the bad. It was a fight between friends for what each of them truly believe. That's the best part of the story- nobody's wrong and nobody's right.I indeed enjoyed the performance of this movie. It had great humor, some drama scenes and action all over it. This film is fulfilled with different emotions, it has a good balance between the funny and the sad. These emotions will be particularly strong, if you know the backstory.I also loved how the soundtrack included the themes from previous films. It was like a little musical reminder from the pastI'm glad that they've got the crew with original actors for this movie. It's really enjoyable to watch the relationships between characters that we know for years, while they meet each other only now. And I'd love to point out the brilliant acting of Robert Downey Jr. and Chris Evans. Their performance was incredible and sometimes you could even believe that in front of you actually stands real Tony Stark or Steve Rogers. In movie you truly can feel the contradictions, despair and fury of theirs.I liked the costume designs and how they were transferred from comics to movie. But I must also mention that many characters had CGI costumes. Some were excellently created, but some, well looked like taken out of a cartoon. So, I think, animation could've been a bit betterCaptain America: Civil War makes you think about what really is justice and how far would you be ready to go to protect your best friend. It is a movie which can enjoy anyone, but those who have seen all of previous films, this one will bring specific emotions.

First off, I will say that this movie was brilliantly made. The soundtrack was stunning, and went together perfectly with the movie. There were a few plot holes, and pieces that didn't make sense, and I didn't like or agree with, but I had a wonderful time watching this.I will not spoil any of the movie, but I will say that I think Ant- Man could have been either excluded from the movie, or brought down a little on the humor. He seems to add too much, and this movie is supposed to be somewhat dark and serious. I also think that Spider- Man should have been added into more of the movie, since he was one of the bigger parts of the comic story-line.So I will say this; if you were expecting something extremely close to the comics, and nothing else will make you happy, you will be disappointed. I have read the comics, and those aside, this movie was great. Bucky and Sam have a very good friendship, it seems.(I think there should have been a darker tone with Bucky's recovery, though that might have come from reading too many very angst-filled fan-fictions, ha ha.)This movie's choreography was amazing! I was happy to find out that the same person who did it for CA:TWS was going to do it for this movie, and I wasn't disappointed.Second, I am very glad that the Russo Brothers directed this movie. They did very well with what they had at their disposal. (For one, everyone actually had earpieces!)The Black Panther was one of my favorite characters. He was very respectable, I think, and extremely mature.All-in-all, this movie could have been more, but it was absolutely amazing, and I will definitely watch it again, and again. 9/10.

Review title: Good but how is that suppose to setup Infinity War? (even just a little bit)
Review_body: Civil War a good movie but instead of Civil War it was like a civil battle and that is suppose to setup infinity war story line. nope! i can't see that happening in a best way. The problem still remains with marvel cinematic universe is underdeveloped Villains except "Loki". In Civil War Team Iron man vs Team Cap. was happening in a way where they are having fun instead of a very very serious battle. Come on It's Phase III now. "Mad Titan " is suppose to be on his way to hunt infinity stones and our heroes are having fun? So this tells that Infinity War could suck. No disrespect for marvel but they need to gear up the level and seriousness of upcoming movies and i definitely don't mean make dark and gritty movies. Also i say Marvel should really focus on "Thor: Ragnarok" because this movie really need to setup Infinity War because that is where Civil War has hopelessly failed. Thor 3 has to be very serious perhaps like Lord of the Rings. instead i heard the upcoming film's director says he will fill the movies with humor? Battle Scale and Seriousness needed to be geared up in the M.C.U.

It's an absolute disgrace that this movie and other "blown out of proportion marvel movies" are in top 250 movies on IMDb's list. This movie is above ones like Inglourious Basterds, Unforgiven, Good Will Hunting... Every marvel movie is the same. There are no good villains, just a lots of jumping, crashing, speed up fighting and that s it. Comparing to this Batman trilogy is like... there is no word for that.OK, it' s entertaining but nothing more.Waste of timePeriod

Hi,I would like to start with the past. Specifically, winter soldier, the previous movie. Now that movie was focused. It had established an identity, which in my mind felt like espionage/action movie. Directorship was great and in my opinion extremely underrated. This comes in its own light due to the inevitable comparing between the two of these movies. In this movie to start with, combat scenes are poorly assembled. Directorship is terrible, very shaky camera, bad angles, constant switching between cameras, unnecessary dark lighting. Recent contrast to compare? Dead pool. They have the means to create a great combat scene where you don't need to replay everything 2-3 times to see what's happening and get a gratifying feeling and appreciation of the art in it. Let me give you another example... Jumps. I mean the heroic intro jump from a building or some other height. The "bad-ass" intro. They've cut all jumps and change camera at landing, they didn't even bother to CGI it. The manner that this happened didn't feel neither artistic, or purposeful, just hastily assembled.As a fellow reviewer commented, plot holes everywhere. I am not going into specifics but you couldn't get they why. It's like after they had filmed the movie, someone changed the script. Lastly, i just want to point out, that i am the kind of man with an obsession. Meaning i like the franchise immensely and i will try to cut corners and justify everything they dish out at me, and I've defended every movie of the universe from day 1, either good or bad (there wasn't any movie in the franchise till now that was not at least decent and with good standards anyway), with the same zeal.I have never written a review in the past, but i was so offended by this movie and so frustrated to see such high ratings, just because its captain America/avengers and the names of the cast, that i had to resort here, to warn people and hope that someone in the marvel franchise is looking out.Don't get me wrong, I've never even bothered with reading the original comics. I couldn't care less about how the lore might defer from comics. It was outright insulting to the viewers and just a money-hoarding movie. To justify this, simply compare the excellence of every past movie coming from this marvel universe with Captain America Civil War. The difference is immense, humongous, monstrous, enormous, it's a gap that cannot be leapt.I'm really really sorry and sad about this, it will be the first movie of those that i will re-watch only once at home simply to get all the facts and lore to be up-to-date for the next ones.Needless to say that 1 hour after watching it at the cinema, i'm still dizzy, literally dizzy and sick in my stomach from the bad lightning and the darn earthquake camera...Overall, I totally understand that after a certain point, when the script and subsequently, the universe, has expanded so much, there will be some gaps. But fans would rather wait for a movie to be completed first, properly than have movies just roll out fast. This movie by my simple amateur gut feeling and estimation, should at least have a development/shooting time of 2 to 3 years. The feeling we got in the cinema, was that it was rolled out in 6 months.With all the honesty, positive aura and hope, i wrote this review, praying, making an ode to the creators and executives to climb back this steep path, come back to "light".

Review title: One of the worst Marvel films ever
Review_body: Just saw it. Not gonna go in depth but incoherent plot with lack of motivations for a lot of the characters to even fight to begin with. Didn't like the actor who played Spider-Man, his jokes were bad and misplaced in the middle of action scenes. Spider-Man seemed like he was added in at the last possible moment of production as he seemed out of place. I mean Tony Stark shows up and just blindly follows Tony. Black Panther was alright but oh boy does his mind change fast but like Spider-Man, he was shoehorned in. Ant-Man dragged along to be beside Captain America, he just blindly follows Cap.Too many jokes in the middle of action scenes. Winter Soldier almost killed some of the Avengers but Captain Americas gay love for bucky blinds him from him. Captain America being so stubborn and showing his true colours as a terrible individual as he doesn't seem to care about anyone's safety. I thought Cap was suppose to be a leader but really, this movie only showed lack of leadership skills as he almost got everyone killed.The highly praised airport fight was not impressive. I'm not sure what people saw here. Zoomed-in action scenes, close up to the faces, lame jokes in between, Black Widow asking if were friends to Hawkeye, camera shaking. The heroes just scatter/disappear and end up on the raft?.Terrible pacing from one scene to the next. Captain America just having a casual talk with Spider-Man while they are fighting and you can see Evans laughing after he mentions that he's from Brooklyn ugh. So bad and so cheesy. Cap holding the helicopter ugh so cheesy.They say bucky is brainwashed but in some scenes, he seems to have it together but in other scenes, he don't. If he is brainwashed, why does Zemo need to activate him when he says the code?. After Zemo says the code, he almost killed some of the Avengers but later on, he fights alongside them?. And now he has it together or what?. Is he brainwashed or not, what's going on here?. Why is he back and forth on killing the Avengers and then working beside them?. Ugh so awful.Chris Evans wooden acting. Lack of facial expressions for the intense moments of the film. Captain Americas lame letter to Tony Stark.All these Marvel movies and they still can't make War Machine the true badass he is like in the comics. The character has been under utilized since Rhodes has put on the suit. They made him a laughing stock in Iron Man 2. The character has very little screen time in every other Marvel movie. Absolutely awful how they treated War Machine in this movie and previous movies. Terence Howard should be happy that he's not playing this character anymore. Disney/Marvel made him a joke.RDJ as Tony Stark/Iron Man is fantastic as always. No complaints here, his motivation for killing Bucky makes sense here. Captain America protecting bucky nope other then that they are friends from back in the day.A lot of the faults people give to BvS which are warranted is also in this movie Civil War. This is not even a Cap Movie, it's a Avenger movie. It's a overcrowded mess with too much going and too many shoe-horned characters and too many characters lacking any real motivation for even fighting each other.I could go on about why I think this is the worst Marvel film to date. I'm not sure what critics saw here. I rated it a 1 as a place holder and reserved judgement until I saw it. I finally saw it. I'm leaving it at a 1/10. An absolutely awful dreadful film that's only to please the fanboys and children.

Review title: I had to watch this movie in 50 sittings as I keep falling asleep.
Review_body: Like most poorly written, cgi infested turds... This movie makes a great sleep aid, I usually find the so called "action sequences" so dull you can pass out around 2 minutes into the flat unimaginative fights, and one liner joke that M.A.S.H. would be ashamed to speak out loud.Don't worry Hollywood, even added a ridiculously and pointless love scene so you can convince your "partner" you didn't go to see this so you could stare at man bulges. I guess this movie is good if your 5 year old is bored and you need a nap. Side note: nothing really happens for about 99% of the running time of the movie. So basically just skip to the last 15 minutes and you will be fine, the rest of the movie is just forgettable and unnecessary to watch. At least this Marvel movie has maybe 5 minutes worth of watchable content. GO MARVEL!!!

Review title: Perhaps the best hero movie this year!
Review_body: Take this instead of X-man prequel, CapAm III is much better! Same level as Ironman I and Deadpool(I hope this dude got his series too). Plot is great. Twist is obvious but good one. The conflict and the tension are there. Nice group shot and the team fight is freaking awesome!!! Funny but not that shallow. CapAm should get a room with his bro right away and don't be sad Ironman, it take turns. I have no idea what Dr.Watson is doing there. Nice jail by the way. OK know I just can't wait for other Marvel movies!! Avenger III and Guardians II are still year to come. What can I do?? It just means that Marvel is killing DC. : D

Review title: was worse than avengers 2 to the extend where it got kinda funny again
Review_body: When I saw the first Iron Man movie i kinda liked the humor and the action and the coolness. iron man 2 and 3 sucked balls, the cap am and thor movies were kinda alright after a beer or two. then came avengers 2 which was really horrible and in no way enjoyable. and now i watched this movie, which is so ridiculously dumb, that its kinda funny and entertaining again, just like "The Room" by Tommy Wiseau. The characters are horribly underdeveloped and their motivation is childish and questionable, if it even exists. the camera work and editing makes no real sense, other than to l'make the movie look a little less boring. And the villains is whack. he is gonna be another one of those marvel villains, where you gonna go in a year or two, "what was the villain of that marvel movie again?" I really don't get why people are getting al mad about the dumb plot of movies like batman v superman. those marvel movies are at least as dumb and no one blames them for nothing.

(another warning that this has spoilers)So, leading up to this movie, I completely lowered any expectations so that I don't bum hard on it because Captain America: Winter Soldier was pretty awesome.Based on the movie overall, it was a good movie. The plot in it's own of hero vs hero is incredible. The biggest downfall for me was the lack of stakes. There was no point in this movie that I thought off that ANY of the heroes would die (war machine falling was in the trailer so going in everyone knew he would live). Death of an important character would have added great emotion and added actual STAKESThe villain was awesome (Baron Zemo), his motivation was quite generic unfortunately (his family was collateral in Sikovia). Black panther was the most intriguing and just plain awesome, looking forward to his solo film. Spiderman was insanely fun, added to the general dull feeling of the movie, and deserves his solo film (homecoming). The moment with him punking Bucky when he grabbed his arm was great. He is like a pg-13 deadpool.Iron Man/Tony Stark was the best part of this film by a mile. His character development since Iron Man 1 is great.This thing about the government having a problem with the superheroes creating collateral after saving the world is just ridiculous. It's a major plot-hole and seems poor and lazy. (i would say they should have a problem with it just because they work in secret, collateral damage happens in government ops too).The infamous 'airport scene' for me is becoming overrated by people clamoring that it is the greatest action scene ever. It is fun and really action-packed but again lacked stakes which makes an actual fight. I know they losing team got locked up in the villain prison, but it was like a scene of pulling punches because one team wants to capture the other and the other just wants to get away. Also who thought that they would be there for long. To top it off, Team Iron Man was OP and could have stopped the others in a second if it was portrayed to match their powers. Still, great action no doubt.The last fight with Iron Man, Captain America and Bucky was awesome. Iron Man wanted to kill Bucky, Cap wanted to protect Bucky and Bucky wanted out. Had a real emotion to it. Again, not to sound like i love death, but one of the 3 should have been killed. (which I know doesn't work because of Avengers coming up)The movie as a whole had a darker tone which is cool but can still fit marvels general sense of humour added to it which this one missed (not just one liners, but rather the general tone). I wasn't let down at all, this is all nitpicking, and really enjoyed it. I still believe that compared to BvS: Dawn of Justice it ranks 1 score lower (only comparing since the release dates were close)

First of all, i'll like to say that the movie in it self is a good movie, although it may lack of a more objective point of views.I'll start with spiderman, his better than expected, and provided the movie with a little freshness, therefore plus to spiderman, but not not to the CGI-suit that is horribly done. Antman on the other hand isn't that good, he's boring just like the Antman- movie.Now to the actual problem; Ironman vs Captain America. Both sides have equally good counter argument for whether or not to sine this Sokovia peace document. But it does not really show what it means to side with the Cap, to put it more directly, The Cap's actions for doing the right things doesn't cost enough casualties and the Ironman side doesn't sacrifice as much freedom as they where afraid of. to sum it up, this movie doesn't make it clear, that the problem is about the document, and not the kindergarten-hunt for Bucky. This movie, focuses too much on Ironman, and is leaving a feeling that you have to take his side.

Without any question this is the best Marvel movie ever made. Its perfect paced with emotional parts, dark parts, funny parts and the thriller elements. The action looks just awesome and the new characters are SO good i can't tell you how good they are. I'm totally happy with the end of this perfect movie and i think infinity war is in good hands.The sad part about it... The DC fan boys show us their character with the 10% 1 star ratings. I saw a user who rated Civil War with 1 star and BvS with 10 Stars and the best thing about it is that he writes about the Marvel fan boys in his CW review...

If this movie were to be a song it would have about 6 notes played over and over. The characters are tremendously underdevloped. The only one to hold his own was RD. I sat there as long as I could stand it and finally got up and left.Going to the movies should be a fun experience......this flat out failed.This review has to be longer than I have made it.....however, it would be just like the movie, a series of the exact things to be said. Let me make it longer, don't waste money for seeing really nothing but about a series on 6 notes repeated.I rarely get up and walk out of a movie but my son and I both agreed......I want something from the money that I spend. Captain America was not inspiring in any way.

Captain America: Civil War was a really awesome movie. All the action scenes were so great that I just stared in awe with my mouth open. (Subtle spoilers ahead) Although it strayed from the comics by changing a lot of things, it made it a lot better by dealing with personal motives rather than mainly fighting because of the act. It's all about Cap's love for Bucky, who I really hated and had a grudge on at first but then I realized that everything wasn't his fault and that he was just controlled. About the characters, I really liked how they portrayed Black Panther (SPOILERS! YOU ARE WARNED) enfueled with rage after his father's death, he still chose not to be consumed by revenge like the others (referring to Tony Stark) and chose not to kill Zemo. You know it's a really good movie when even the antagonist (Tony Stark) makes you feel that he is also right. I changed sides the whole time I watched, from Team Stark to Team Cap to Team Stark to... nothing at all. They were both right. And I am left undecided. It did not end with a happy ending however, which I totally expected but still crushed my heart. (Even though I expected a more depressing ending just like the Civil War comics) Despite this I did not tear up, But I can assure you that it really made me cry... on the inside. Good Job Marvel, well played. *claps*

Fiirst off it seems Steve Rogers thinks Captain is the highest ranking and doesn't have to follow any rules. If you love the previous two Avenger movies then you will love this one. Since its basic the same story told 4 the 3rd time.CA The Winter Soldier is a better movie. Instead of an alien with a British accent trying to destroy the Avengers from the inside, it's a human with a Sokovian accent. Also love the hidden camera in the woods on some back-road in 1991 that shots multiple angles.would have been more believable to have had him to be able to download what he saw and shown his face in the mirror. Unless you were friends with CPT America in 1945 he will either just try to kill you or smash your face in. FYI he has more kills than Deadpool. Not sure if he knows what a situation going south means?! The black panther was great. Till he turns into a saint and just forgives everyone who tries to kill him or did kill his people. Spidey looks awesome. Can't wait for homecoming. So if you drank the Marvel Koolaid enjoy.

I honestly don't know if I can give a review, see, as much as I love movies of all kinds. I fell asleep half way in & I wasn't even tired.I'm more intrigued by the Marvel universe than a fan, but I make a point of watching these as a 'popcorn' movie and don't take them seriously...But this... This err, was just... I can't explain what this made me feel apart from sheer boredom, the opening 'fight' scene was the usual fare, choreographed cgi, noisy visuals, then someone or other said something about the Avengers are blowing up too much stuff and the world doesn't like them doing that any more, they get sulky and then some more stuff gets blown up while some cat in a catsuit chases someone from a late 90's nu-metal band video while Capt America pouts & tells him not to kill anyone. Then a grey iron man lands and the guy from 'The Guard' tells everyone off, then there's some more sulking & pouting...I fell asleep at this point, please, please don't bother telling me what happens next, I really don't care.The only bit I did like was the cookery lesson from a very tomato faced Paul Bethany, but I would have used way more paprika.I'd rather re-watch Prometheus than go through this again.

OK, saw Civil War two times already here in Peru, the second time just yesterday April 30th with my 73 years-old father that really loves movies since he was young. He knows and loves everything Superman-related, and even so, he couldn't help but snore through BvS (almost the same with MoS back then). But oh boy! yesterday at the theater i saw my father laughing and even clapping like he was a 13 years old kid watching the "serials" he sometimes tell me about! It was that good!. On my first watch on April 27th (first screening), the theater was packed and the crowd reaction was the best i have seen since the first Avengers movie, but that was nothing compared with seeing my old man's reactions. I just wanted to share this because if any movie deserves to be ranked top just by the sheer joy it causes, is this one. An excellent movie, full of surprises (I have seen just the first trailer prior to watching the movie, and avoided spoilers like the plague). Acting-wise, the characters were spot-on, some of the best moments were the ones without any special effect, and the ones that used them were wisely edited. About the villain: a superb and realistic plan (within the boundaries of their universe). Only minor gripe was Martin Freeman overacting. Otherwise, the introduction of characters (new to the universe or to the Captain/Avengers films) was perfect, and rest assured, this is the best on-film version of the web-crawler yet! Recommended 100%, just go and see it spoiler free if you can.

Review title: Watch this.. It will become your favorite!!
Review_body: One of the cool super-hero movie. I have seen it 3 times so far and still watch its scenes everyday. The guy who has not watched this movie yet , he is missing something. Its cool and awesome. watch this.. rate this.. enjoy this.. and again watch this but don't compare this to The Dark knight.. Enjoy Its AWESOME !!!!!!! Chris Evans has a great role.. Along with other guys in the crew. I was with Team Cap. During the movie in theater you will go with your team. and will become happy when your side is wining. Overall it will try to make you choose a side. So don't miss to watch this movie. And please pickup Your side before going to theater !!!

Review title: The Best Assembled Super Hero Movie Yet
Review_body: After the disappointment of Age of Ultron and Batman v Superman, Civil War stood up and taught us why a great script is the stepping stone that every big superhero movie should be based on. It showed how every character must be treated and why their development is important. The characters were all well done. Spidey inclusion made the movie fun and more lighthearted, Black Panther was interesting and important to the story, and both had some cool action scenes. Captain America and almost everyone else were well presented, they had their time to shine and a coherent and understandable reason to choose a side in the story (except maybe for a rushed Vision). However, Iron man was the most complex one and Robert Downey Jr's portrayal of him was perfect, it was very pleasant to see in a character with so many changes of mind that all those changes were rationally and emotionally well motivated.The villain was one of the best of the MCU, he had the most rational plan of all MCU villains (with also a cool twist plot), Bruhl was great and made the most "normal" villain the most harmful one. It was a normal movie technically-wise (same aesthetics in every MCU movie) but had remarkable action scenes. The mayor issue I encountered was the pacing in the beginning, it was quite rushed, and the movie seemed destabilized and messy until it found its way. It's easily one of the best MCU movies and I'm glad to see the Russo brothers will be directing Avengers 3.

Review title: so finally we get to see the civil war
Review_body: So I watched the movie today with a lot of expectations and really had a great time watching it.It was again the Russo brothers who brought a uniqueness to this story like the other parts as well and did a great job. Acting wise the performance of each and everyone is top class.It was great to watch team cap and team iron man battle up against each other but the only thing I felt from the first half that what would be the conclusion.So the movie went on with a smooth pace until we got to see the epic fight.Finally at the end I thought the Russo brothers might have missed a bit of essence in it which would have really made it an innovative movie. I just felt from the beginning the movie was very logical and realistic but the conclusion part somehow lost its logical focus.On the whole this was a nice end to the trilogy and will be eagerly waiting for infinity war.So for all the comic book fans this will be a refreshing comic book adaptation.

Review title: Phenomenal action, but sloppy and inconsistent. Ruined Captain America's character.
Review_body: First, This should have been called "The Avengers: Civil War". That would have been a more appropriate title given what happens in the movie. PROS: Stellar CGI and action. Pleasant surprises with many other Marvel characters they threw in. They made Black Widow stronger and with better fighting scenes. CONS: Iron Man and Captain America were inconsistent to who we know their characters to be. In some ways, their roles were reversed. Without revealing exactly what happens, my conclusion is that they ruined the role model Captain America. It may very well be a reflection of society, who loves the brash and contentious Donald Trump but indicted Mitt Romney as being too perfect. Is a traditional, rule abiding, good old American values Captain America no longer appealing to the masses? It appears so, according to Hollywood.They introduced plot lines that didn't go anywhere (and some were missed opportunities to build out further) and new characters that left you wondering why they were put in in the first place. While you always have to go into these movies with a very hearty suspension of disbelief, there is a lot you have to let go of. You wonder why certain characters were whipping up on others, or why immortal ones weren't wiping out mere humans. While I went into the movie for pure mentally unplugged enjoyment, it was hard to ignore some things. So go into the movie deciding you won't pay attention to what you know about the characters, and try to let the movie take you on the journey the story is trying to tell you. Ignore inconsistencies, don't think too much about it, and watch a movie full of really cool Marvel characters all interacting with each other.

Action-packed, humorous, well balanced and well acted; Captain America Civil War is another insanely good addition to the MCU courtesy of Winter Soldier directors, the Russo Brothers. With a hero cast that greatly outnumbered any of its predecessor, one of the highlights of this battle of the titans was the inclusion of two new MCU characters, namely Tom Holland's Spider-Man and Chadwick Boseman's Black Panther; who in many ways stole the show. Credit must be given to the full team-up confrontation choreographed in the airport scene briefly depicted in the trailers, which without a doubt introduced us to a gladiator match like never seen before. With plot twists that will divide fans and general viewers alike, Civil War inspires us to seriously consider how the events leading up to this mammoth conflict have drastically transformed some of our biggest and favourite MCU character, building primarily upon the events that occurred in both the Winter Soldier and Age of Ultron. Identifying weaknesses were minimal as the movie manages to reconcile what was maybe a very fast paced and almost confusing first half with a momentous and emotionally driven finale which justified the need for thorough detail in the beginning. While the film tingled my nerd senses throughout, delivering just about all that I had dreamed of witnessing on the big screen pre-release, I give this title a 9 and only a 9 (I wouldn't of given it quite a 9.5 if it has been an option) was the noticeable structural weaknesses in the first hour in terms of pacing, but also the ever so slightly under-whelming opening act which saw the new Avengers team taking on one of their first big threats. My own personal highlights in terms of specific characters in the movie would go to both Cap and Ironman, but also the short but amazingly sweet appearances of both Tom Holland's Spider-Man and Paul Rudd's Ant-Man.

Review title: It's just Amazing/ Es simplemente Increible
Review_body: What can I say about this movie, try to find something that I din't like it, but there's nothing, it's just great, it has action, humor, drama... it has all, I always complain about the Marvel's villain because all of them are just puppets in the movies, all except for Loki and Zemo from CW, he's just a "normal and decided person" that want to destroy the avenger from inside, I love him, I love his reasons, he's amazing and he's alive, for me it's an amazing movie.there are two post credit scenes but just one it's coolI give it 9.5 this is what BvS should be

Review title: The MCU has grown up and is tackling mature themes
Review_body: This is by far the MCU's darkest and mature film. The action has become more gritty, realistic and violent. The acting has gotten more serious with some humour thrown in for comic relief. Themes are no longer childish and involves terrorism, death, betrayal, politics and vengeance. The writing no longer panders to children, but to all demographics. Overall, the quality has improved drastically from previous MCU entries in writing, acting, direction and technical aspects. However, the film isn't dark and serious like Nolan's Batman because it sticks to its comic book roots and is able to distinguish itself, and not become generic. This is up there with The Dark Knight and Spider-Man 2 for best cbm ever made.

THe best marvel movie. THis movie is a combo of politics, action and emotions.I simply love it. Marvelous job by directors Anthony and Joe Russo . The story is nice . CGI is great . A solid performance by all the actors. Tom Holland as spider man is ultimate. Screenplay is also good. Chadwick as T'Challa nails it. This movie is not gonna disappoint you. One of the best movie I saw in my life. Good job Marvel. Civil war is better than the winter soldier an the avengers . Everyone should watch this movie. With this movie the expectations for avengers infinity war rises. Cinematography in civil war is good. This movie is the starting of the phase 3 which I bet is gonna be better than phase 1 and 2.

Wow. Marvel is not messing around anymore. Captain America - Civil War is the best comic book movie Marvel studios has put out since Guardians of the Galaxy, and may be better than the original Avengers film. Everything in this film was top notch from the character arcs, to the action, to the humor, and especially the story. After viewing Batman Vs. Superman - Dawn of Justice in March, I must admit until a few days ago I was not looking forward to watching this movie. I felt as though the genre was wearing off on me. After viewing Civil War, I now can see how wrong I was to judge a film by its genre.Civil War's story is the most sophisticated to date, drawing parallels to the real life issues about free will and public safety. Most will call this film a statement against "big government" but I think that that the issue is more complex than that. No matter what side of the debate each of the characters are on, we as the audience understand their reasoning and motivation on their opinion. Captain America is a great lead in this film. At no point do you question if this is anyone else's movie, it is clearly Cap's. His dedication to Bucky and the ideals of freedom make him the perfect character to revolve the film around. Iron Man was also awesome in the film. He foils with Cap to further explore this interesting relationship that was started in the previous Avenger films. Robert Downey Jr. brings his A game to the role as always. The rest of the supporting Avengers were also great, with Black Panther, Spider-Man and Ant-Man among some of the stand outs. Black Panther could have just been plopped into the movie to make toys but instead, the writers gave him a clear arc revolving around vengeance that parallels with Cap and Iron Man. Spider-Man' appearance also felt justified, and really made me excited for Tom Holland's future appearances as the Web Slinger. Lastly Ant-Man was better than expected. I actually wished that we got more of him. He brought a lot of humor to this film, and to see him turn into Giant Man was truly amazing. I must mention that while Zemo was decent villain considering that this is an MCU film, his motivation were much weaker than the other characters which did bring the film down slightly.The Russo Brothers have managed to improve upon their previous effort in Winter Soldier which only has me more excited for Infinity Wars. Civil War will easily be in Top 10 lists of best comic book films for years to come.

Review title: All You Need To Make Your Day!
Review_body: Hi, This is my first Movie Review. I had a lot of hopes of this movie cause after all its a Marvel movie and moreover starring Robert Downey Jr. in it. And I am glad to say all my expectations are met. I am truly satisfied. The movie's highlight was supposed to be Chris Evans but Robert Downey Jr. steals the show.The suspense is heartbreaking yet its worth it. The story takes a surprising turn towards the end. Sebastian Stan was a total game changer.This is the movie where all your prediction goes wrong. Tom Holland Makes a type of Guest appearance. Chadwick Boseman is a surprising package. Martin Freeman has a short yet dominating role.Paul Rudd has a big surprise of everyone. The end is so thrilling and suspenseful that waiting for the next movie is like waiting for the next season of Game Of Thrones. The teaser at the end blows away everything you thought. At Last the movie is worth your money and is better than any previous Captain America movie. Thanks Folks, I hope this review was helpful, ADIOS!

Well well well , Marvel have done it again ! What an amazing movie that was. excellently Written movie , from the start to the end this movie was so brilliant. Weeks before this movie was released I was wondering how they would fit every characters role on screen but I was excelled at how good it was. Each character had an perfect amount of screen time. The movie was very well paced so it kept me extremely interested throughout the whole movie. Also the story line was brilliantly produced that I could not have imagined. Chadwick Boseman and Tom Holland played Black Panther and Spiderman beautifully which was a relief. All in all Captain America Civil War Was a great movie and broke a lot of expectations ! Can't wait for the rest of the marvel movies :) !!!

During my viewing of the film, I couldn't help but nearly fall asleep in the theater during any scene that didn't feature action. The film is overrated, in my opinion. The only reason people praise it so much is for the characters that appeared in the film finally coming together....oh wait....on one screen. The actors are amazing as usual. When I left the theater, I was reminded of Batman v Superman. I compared both films in quality, and Batman v Superman won. I even rated BvS 9 out of 10 over this film's 7/10. Once again, this film is overrated. Let's hope Infinity War is a Winter Soldier and not a Civil War.

Review title: Alltime best Marvel movie- Personally my favorite movie of all time.
Review_body: Civil War is a brilliantly crafted, action packed, full of story, fun- fest with deeper meaning. The movie didn't include as much humor as put into most Marvel movies, which I personally feel is right. The jokes weren't rushed and they were really funny. All the heroes got fair screen-time, not as so as Ant-Man, but later in the movie they made up for Ant-Man's missing screen-time for almost half the movie. Spider-Man was amazing, quippy, clever, and spectacular. There were some scenes where he doesn't look entirely real, and more on the CGI side, but I didn't mind it at all. There are many twists, and things you don't see coming, but it's very enjoyable. The last quarter-ish, it get's a little dark, and I loved it. I will definitely be watching it again, and buying it when it comes out on DVD/Digital/Blu-Ray.

Where to start of with this film, first of all it was amazing and sorry DC fan boys but marvel have won this time not all will agree but I would say this is marvel's best film yet.Throughout the film you are treated to a wide range of exiting action scenes, a plot that is as good as any Oscar winning film and acting that could not get any better if it tried. The Russo brothers (Joe and Anthony) have created a "marvel" (pun intended) of a superhero film that any marvel fan or any film buff would be proud of.The all star cast really says it all. It certainly proves that they are all still at the top of their careers and they don't look like they will be coming down for a while yet. Every actor put in as much work into this film as each other. The acting in this film is something that any movie watcher would enjoy and they would find themselves wondering if they are actually there themselves. Not one part of this glorious work of a film will leave you bored or wanting more.The plot unlike most superhero films actually gets better as it goes on. One of the films directors Joe Russo described this film as a "psychological thriller" and that I can agree with a film that will make you look behind you after going to see it. Civil War is a roller coasts of emotions and intensities, and with surprises that lets be honest no one expected especially that while agent 13 debacle anyway back to the review.This film will make you laugh with the perfect amount of humour from each character the balance out the politics of this film you will not go home disappointed. With well choreographed fighting scenes and intense level of action even Michael bay would be impressed. But not to much to ruin the whole aspect of the film, it's not just about a fight between two friends it's about what's wrong and what's right. Although in my eyes captain America is right! Each character gets plenty of screen time contrary to popular belief and you will be happy that you get the see each character in a way you haven't seen them before. Every character has their own little plot In a much bigger story and they all come to an end by the end of the film. The only problem I have is that it wasn't longer, but...What marvel and their amazing directors have to work on now is the villain although this film is amazing without one, a villain always adds to the tension of a film. Don't get me wrong he was acted brilliantly but marvel just can't seem to get villains right but I can forgive them and so can everyone because the film was so spectacular.This film has changed marvel forever in a good way from a kid friendly film to a kind of gritty suspenseful movie that has elements of terror and realism in it, well for a superhero film that is.To finish this off I would like to say that they did not let us down with the end credits "BOTH" (so stay until the very end) gave us teasers for two new films that got girls and middle aged men alike screaming with excitement after they had finished. To summarise this film is the perfect start the phase 3 marvel films and a great influence on many films to come.Well done Captain I salute you. 10/10 30th April 2016

Review title: Captain America: Civil War was AMAZING!
Review_body: NO SPOILERS HERE... I watched the film on the 29th of April, Sadly only in 2D ;( so I cannot comment on 3D and what it looked like and if it's worth seeing in 3D.But...What I can comment on is how AWESOME this film actually was; by writing this review and breaking it down into small, tasty, bite-size chunks for you.The StoryMarvel films have hit a wall recently when it comes to story lines they just haven't been as 'well-done' as other Marvel films like Iron-Man and Avengers Assemble. Green Lantern was a letdown even though the amazing Ryan Reynolds was Green Lantern, also Deadpool could have been so much better all the elements of an amazing film were there: amazing actors, great fight scenes, there just could have been more to the film, the story was so simplistic. But Captain America: Civil War's storyline was so perfect it brought in all the elements of a great film in and they bounced of this amazing storyline that tore people between Cap and Iron- Man. It's so difficult to pick a side, and that's what makes it so great you are constantly changing from one team to the other and when they fight each other you're so torn between the two teams you can't decide and then you just don't want anyone to die are be seriously harmed and if any of them do it's a huge shock. The story easily gets a 9/10.The Acting The acting was amazing, the emotions run high in the film and the actors killed it, the emotional scenes hit you right in the feels. Shut out to Robert Downey JR who was amazing in the film. But we all know who we really wanted to see... SPIDER-MAN and BLACK PANTHER. Tom Holland for me is the best Spider-Man so far, he is a real Spider-Man I love how Marvel have decided to actually use a teenager to play a high school kid and not a 20 year old actor to play a high school kid, Spider-Man stole the lime light in the film with his humour, fighting abilities and that fine new suit! Black Panther didn't have many lines, but when does Black Panther need to talk as soon as you see him you know it's about to go down, and that vibranium suit was just Purrfect. The acting was a solid 9/10.The Action ScenesWOW... just... WOW they were visually stunning and so well done in all aspects, the main fighting scene in the airport lasted nearly 20 minutes of pure actions, every character was shown and used to full effect, Spider-Man kicked ass left, right and on the ceiling. Ant-Man was actually useful and was so well used. Scarlet Witch was ridicules in the fight scene she was a titan she protected everyone and was like a brick wall full of cars she controlled with her mind. You would think nothing could top off that fight scene in the airport, you would be wrong... very wrong... but no spoilers :D. The action scenes smashed a 10/10 perfect score.The ConclusionThe film destroys a 9/10 more a 9.9/10 the film was stunning in every way. I would recommend going to see this film as soon as you can and then go and see it again. The film took three different film series The Avengers, Iron-Man and Captain America and combined them and just... well played Marvel... well play, you have made the best superhero film so far by a solid 400 miles. I really hope upcoming Marvel titles like Doctor Strange, Spider-Man: Homecoming, Thor: Ragnarok and the upcoming Avengers: Infinity War films with most of the characters from Captain America: Civil War going to be in the film, will hopefully be as amazing as Captain America: Civil War is.GO...AND...SEE...THIS...FILM!

Best Marvel movie by far. The Russo Brothers did an amazing job with everything from casting Tom Holland as Peter Parker to choosing who is on Team Cap or Team Stark. The acting was phenomenal and so was the special affects. The movie was nothing like I have seen and is funny and has many wonderful hidden easter-eggs. A wonderful masterpiece. The way they have all three fight scenes so emotional and every twist and turn hits you. You feel everything that happens. The best thing about this movie though is the relationships between every person, Steve and Bucky, to Wanda and Vision. You can tell each actor and actress loves their part in this movie. The hard work that was put into this movie makes a worth while two hours and twenty-eight minutes. So if your Team Cap or Team Stark you see every point of view.

Review title: Expecting something different? Prepare for a treat!
Review_body: Captain America: Civil War is probably Marvel Studios' finest movie to date. The superhero registration act resembles that of the comics great, but halfway through the movie you can realize that the plot device is moved out of the focus, which you can either love or hate, depending on what you want to see. There's a lot of characters, and I really mean characters because of their distinct personalities and traits (Unless you haven't seen the other Marvel movies, in that case they are kinda good at best.) The characters developed a LOT in this movie (which is something to say since the other Marvel movies basically followed a formula.) So you will definitely see them changed to a certain degree in the next movies. One thought that crossed my mind in the cinema was: Was there too much going on? I'll admit, there was slightly too much going on in the movie, but what was in the film, they got the best out of. Another thing I personally thought was great about the movie is the change of tone. You get to see The Avengers in a different situation than before, and I think it's refreshing to see a very serious film. I'm also impressed that they pulled it off, since all of the other movies have always been light-hearted. Over-all this movie is incredible for any fan, and I can't recommend it enough. If you haven't seen the other MCU films then you won't like as much.

I don't write reviews of all the movies i have rated. But this movie was epic. Plus i can't get over Chris Evans' hotness & Robert Downey Jr.'s sense of humor. Tom Holland as Spider-Man is all happy go lucky & a little bit of funny. Everyone must see this because you'll laugh, fall in love, & most especially get hurt. Why? Because who would've want to fight our favorite heroes? Scarlett Johansson is all amazing. wow. To be honest i am really impressed by her moves! And my favorite powers are Elizabeth's (aka Scarlet Witch) & Paul's (aka Vision) if i got to choose. Anyways, there's a plot twist that came, sometimes i like it in movies & marvel did it very well & clean. It's a little bit confusing sometimes, of what each new villains need or want or what are their plans or what are they gonna do. But at the end of it. The storyline was all perfect! The way Marvel did it was marvelous. All the good things that y'all have been looking for are all in Captain America: Civil War movie. It was phenomenal. I am very serious. thanks Marvel studios for creating this film. 20/10 But just because i'm Team Cap doesn't mean i'm against Tony. p.s. Stan Lee never gets old. ‪#‎TeamCap‬

Review title: An Uneven Avengers Escapade Masquerading as a Cap Film
Review_body: I really bought into the hype surrounding this film and was hoping we'd all be in store for a masterpiece in the vein of 'The Winter Soldier'. What we get instead is a very convoluted, nonsensical, and unnecessary sequel with a bad guy (Zemo) who's about as scary as an elderly church-going granny. About the only enjoyable things about this film are watching Scarlet Witch in action and realizing that Tom Holland is the one Sipder-Man to rule them all. Holland seriously had some of the best dialogue and action scenes. Black Panther on the other hand gets blackballed in his introduction to the MCU. His place in the story basically just screams placeholder. In fact, Black Panther completely gets shafted in the closing credits...Spider-Man gets a thunderous crowd applause when the words "Spider- Man will Return" flash up on the screen. Black Panther gets no such closing credits. Another point of complaint would be just the pacing of the story and some of its elements. The action pieces of the film come in spurts, between long droning stretches of Cap and Iron Man waxing philosophical about who knows what. I actually found myself nodding off to sleep during these stretches of non action. Also a huge problem is the Winter Soldier's central placement in the film and his storyline. Marvel needs to make a firm decision about this character's direction in the MCU, because they throw out a lot of mixed signals to the viewer. At this point, the Winter Soldier is planned for many more films, but he's almost completely unlikable and pretty much somehow lost all his rad intimidation factor of when he was the heel of the last movie. If the audience is supposed to be full of sympathy for the Winter Soldier, Marvel is not stoking that fire in the right way at all. So in conclusion the main positive of this movie is Spider-Man. The negatives are many including character misuse and numerous story misfires. Stow your expectations away and just enjoy the very few simple pleasures this disappointing film delivers.

I think the best way to start this review is by warning potential viewers not to be fooled by all the sexually charged promo pictures from this movie. Despite the obvious "will they, won't they" Tony and Steve have been engaging in over a few movies, this one doesn't finally take the further step. In fact, I would say the real love story is between Bucky and Steve, who share some really compelling shots during the movie, as the two friends/would-be lovers are reunited again. Sadly, this is all without resolution.I regret to say, that there isn't much in the way of plot either. CA3 tries to start up the so-called "civil war" using several different, completely disconnected threads, all of which feel quite pointless, and are hardly given enough discussion and thought process of the different people involved to really make you care about it. If you are expecting a thought provoking with philosophical ramifications Civil War storyline, I suggest you head to the comics.These two writers/directors received a lot of praise on their previous installment "The Winter Soldier" for their complex portrayal of women (most notably, Black Widow), including their importance on the plot. I'm afraid they will not receive such praise on this movie. Natasha was little more than a beautiful prop, given how she was completely pointless to the plot, and she's only allowed a few quips here and there, in addition to her fight scenes. Sharon Carter is there only to give a Plot Related Speech to push Steve to decide on which side he was going to be (Peggy Carter needed to be fridged for this purpose), and then share a very random kiss with him. Wanda was presented as a teenager kicking her shoes because she was "grounded". For some reason, with all the talk of Sekovia and its victims, she didn't think of mention that she lost her brother there too. Actually, the fact that she lost her twin brother only months before is not brought up at any point of the movie, and she's not even shown as being sad about it. It seems like a sort of "running joke" on media right now that women do not mourn their loved ones (I guess that's what the men who write them think "strong women" are?). Tony, on the other side, is given plenty of room for being devastated over the loss of a guy he never even met. This leads him to eff up for the how many movies has he been in so far? Six? Well, for the sixth time.This movie was also highly expected for the introduction of two new characters. One of them turned out to be really compelling and promising. The actor somehow managed to make his character likable even at the point of the movie when he was being sort of annoying, and the brilliant turnaround he had at the end served to elevate him over most of his co-stars. As for the other one, I can't believe they will actually make a full length movie with him next year, which I will skip anyway. His introduction was also weird and felt forced. There was supposed to be humor, but it was only uncomfortable. It is worth pointing out that the supposed jokes in this movie failed 90% of the time, which at some point had you begging for them to just please stop.Arguably the best part of the movie was the fight scene at the airport (which plot wise was really pointless if you think about it), which did manage to display the abilities of all the characters involved in it and was delightful to watch. It does make you wonder, however, if the only part the writers were able to deliver was the fighting (which is practically a given if you think the amazing material they had to work with), maybe they should have given the job to someone with a more original vision and new ideas.We could say that among the mess that this movie turned out to be, some resolution to the obvious UST between Tony and Steve could have been a redeeming quality. Marvel however, still refuses to acknowledge that same-sex love exists, and will rather have Captain America share a very disturbing kiss with the niece of the 100 year old dead woman he was actually in love with. Which makes me consider, maybe this movie is not only not gay enough, it may be too heterosexual as well.

Captain America: Civil War is in short, a movie about the Avengers being pressured to be monitored by the U.N. Some agree to this, others don't and it boils down to a fight. In midst of all this tension, Captain America discovers that Hydra (I think?) is still alive and has to end its plans again.Don't get fooled by it's name - Captain America: Civil War is not about the Civil War arc that happened in the comics. It does have the tension and fights but it's not the Civil War you thought it'd be. But honesty, who cares?Yes, it's not what it was in the comics but it still is an amazing movie. If you saw the trailers and thought you've seen too much, don't worry - You haven't seen anything yet. This movie has lots of action and lots of funny moments, just like any Marvel movie but the introduction of characters and the addition of others makes the fight between the Avengers all the more exciting.If I have to say at least something bad about it, the villain is kinda bad? Like his plan is close to what Loki tried in The Avengers (Without the taking over the world) just because the Avengers "killed" his family. Not the greatest villain but not the worst either, just okay.Other than that, the movie is pretty much flawless. Captain America: Civil War is a great action movie, it's right there with Terminator 2 and Die Hard. It's the best Marvel movie to date and I'm glad to see the Infinity War movies are in good hands.

The meta-score and ratings for this movie is overrated. This movie didn't feel like the Civil War from the Marvel Comics at all. This shouldn't even be call Civil War. It's just as the tag line says: Team Cap vs Team Iron Man. Their were a lot of random scenes and jokes that shouldn't be there. People who thinks this movie is incredible are completely bias. I was disappointed. Anyone who cares about a nice and flawless development for a story-line should be disappointed. Hawkeye was just there. Same with Spidey and Ant-Man. The beginning of the movie shows a scene from 1991 yet we see a bunch of flat screens monitors. Its possible for the those scientist to create Winter Soldier back then yet Iron Man, Mr. Tony Stark can't even a better leg than Winter Soldier's arm for his buddy War Machine. Captain America takes a bunch of Iron Man's repulsor attack yet he's only slightly injured. Cap is Super "Human" not Super Alien. Black Widow disappears with only the explanation of Ross is coming to get her. I mean she's hot but come on she's super spy they could've done a lot more than that. Hawkeye is on Team Cap/the fugitive side which doesn't make sense because if he was truly thinking about his Family, he would've been on Iron Man's side. Falcon dodging The Vision's attack as if he got spider-sense yet War Machine couldn't detect that. Iron Man could've catch up to the Quinjet if he truly tried. Spider-Man? Spider-Boy. That's all their is to say about him. One thing though, Aunt May is too young. She looks like mid 30-mid 40's. Vision could've single-handily take out Cap and Winter Soldier without a sweat. But for some reason as with Thor, Marvel decided to make them weaker than they should be. There was no need for Crossbone's appearance. They only placed him their for 1. "Bucky" 2. Scarlet Witch's disaster. For number 1, they could've done something else, something much better that wasting a villain like that. Number 2, after New York and Sokovia, the Government of the world took action for that? And where in the world is Nick Fury? He was the one who started the whole Avengers thing yet he's no where to be found and wasn't even mentioned. A lot of inconsistency and bad story building. Worst thing that bothers be is this is supposed to be a war. A "War". Didn't feel like it to me and every little chance they get, they pop out a joke. Now for the things I DO enjoy in the movie. Ant-Man was hilarious. Robert Downey Jr. played Tony Star as good as ever. Black Panther was awesome, fighting or not. Speaking of Black Panther, the hand-to-hand combat action from Black Panther and Captain America was excellent. Story: 3/10 Action: 6/10 Comedy: 6/10 Acting/Cast: 7/10 Music: 5/10 Rewatch Value: 5/10

Review title: Another amazing addition to the MCU!
Review_body: I was optimistic but cautious going into this movie. Marvel has been on such an amazing run recently that I thought that they have to slip up at some point... right? And with so many superheroes in 1 movie without Whedon at the helm, I was concerned.Needless to say I was worried for nothing! The story was set-up brilliantly and continued going strong for the remainder of the film. The Avengers have had their problems here and there in the past, but things finally reached boiling point after a mission turned south and more innocent people died. Our 2 new characters were great, Black Panther and Spiderman both had great introductions and both felt like they actually had something to do rather than just be there for the sake of the plot. Speaking of Spiderman, Tom Holland did a great job! When cast people thought he didn't look the part and that he looked too young, whether you still think that or not you can't deny he played the part really well and I for one am really looking forward to 'Homecoming' and seeing what more Tom has too offer.Overall brilliantly crafted movie, the Marvel juggernaut continues to keep moving forward without a hitch. Bring on Doctor Strange.

Well its finally here! Many people have waited for this film. Me included. This film seems to have everything. The humour in this film hit spot on! I laughed every time. I have had enough of DC fans saying that if it's funny it can't be dramatic. Thats all bullshit. This film goes from hilarious, to (Mostly in the final act) extremely dramatic and heartfelt. Even though I am a Marvel fan boy, and I would have seen this film anyway, the main reason I had to see it so early was Spiderman. I am a massive spidey fan and to see him in the MCU was fantastic. So obviously spidey was my favorite part of the film. I think Tom Holland got the perfect balance between dorky as Peter and confident as spidey. The one thing that took me off slightly was the slight overuse of cgi for spidey. I can overlook this though and I had a great time with him. Cap again is great, but Downey showed us a whole new side of Tony which was fantastic too see. He was so dramatic and at times angry. It was new and exciting. It seems that the one problem everyone had with the film was the villain and how he was wasted. Because people had said this I was expecting some random villain to show up in the final act like Doomsday for BvS, but that wasn't the case at all. His plan was interesting and well worked and we really got a good insight of the character. For me this was one of Marvels best villains put to screen yet. And the airport scene... well what can I say. Again spidey stole the show for that too. If you thing you have seen the airport scene through the trailers, you are so mistaken. You've seen nothing yet. Black panther for some reason I thought I wouldn't like, but I really did. They some how got me to love him. The characters all got a good amount of screen time and they all got a good story arc. The action is just so much more enticing because we have motivation behind it and a good story. Overall this is my second favorite comic book film (1 being dark knight. There is just no beating that) and defiantly my favorite Marvel film yet. This is a film I could watch 1000 times and never be bored. This isn't just a fantastic comic book film. It's a fantastic film. Period.

NON-SPOILERS REVIEWThis is absolutely the best movie in the MCU and maybe one of the greatest superhero movies I've seen, it was absolutely brilliant. Russo brothers did it again. The tone was serious but at the same time it had the jokes and the fun, the script was organized, they show you the character motivations and let you choose side and I have to say that this is was I was expecting in BvS, the tension built and the subplots were correctly approached and the fight scenes were SPECTACULAR, the airport scene was the best action scene I've seen in my life. The acting was brilliant, special mention to Elizabeth Olsen (Wanda Maximoff). The introductions to the new characters were good executed and they didn't feel forced at all, and talking about that I have to say: Spiderman was awesome in the 2 or 3 scenes he shows up, Black Panther was incredible and I can't wait to see his solo movie. I don't have anything to complain about this movie, perhaps the villain felt unnecessary but the rest of the movie was brilliant.
