Review title: Mind-blowing action, Very entertaining, highly recommended
Review_body: Captain America: Civil war, the most hyped marvel movie of 2016, is better than any other movie we've got from marvel studios, till now. It has a great storyline, almost every character gets to play their part in the movie. Unlike Batman vs Superman, this movie is a movie with a plot, and also a very good one. The Russo Brothers have thought and made the movie in such a good way that every one will be leaving the theater thinking about Iron Man and Captain America. There are no Flaws in the movie, no plot holes, pure awesomeness, i didn't.The Things i didn't Like: 1) The movie is nothing like in the comics, except for some references 2) Spiderman's cameo was too short( more like 15 minutes) 3) T'Chaka's death was too early, but its inevitable, the Russo Brothers probably wanted to find a way to involve black panther in it, and this is the only way.But these errors wont make you hate the movie, more over there's no silly scene like the "Martha" scene from BvS.The movie has 2 post credit scenes, which u shouldn't miss. Looking forward to review X-Men apocalypse and Suicide squad.

Review title: Avengers: Infinity War is in safest hands.
Review_body: Civil War was nearly flawless. The Russsos did a great job with the combination of sub-plots that were leading to the main plot of the film. A glimpse of overall character backstory and brief introduction for Black Panther and Spider-man was well-done. Every single character deserved a decent amount of screen time, with Bucky's arc and character development being one of the significant elements that led to the string of events that help triggered the tension between Steve and Tony. Steve and Bucky's reunion was the heart of the film and the Russos managed to use that to fuel the fire between all the other characters from both opposing teams, which led to the war. The fighting sequences were extremely flawless and one of the main strong components of the film because they were something that I've never seen before. The highly-anticipated airport scene was so much fun to watch and it really showed how strong characters like Scarlet Witch and Spider- man were because their abilities manage to surpass others at certain points. The only thing I slightly disliked was how Steve and Sharon got together, I just felt like the timing was somewhat inappropriate. However, Steve and Natasha's relationship was what intrigued me instead because you can really see how much they've grown together as a duo from the previous films and it didn't feel foreign at all. Also, I felt like the overall portrayal of Baron Zemo was spectacular, he is probably one of the most sympathetic yet malicious villains Marvel has put out so far and I honestly can't wait to see more from Daniel Bruhl.You might pledge your allegiance to a specific team but after seeing the film, you will probably re-think about which side you've chosen and see the characters, especially Steve and Tony from a different perspective. The post-credit scenes will also give you a glimpse of how much impact Bucky and newbies Black Panther and Spider-man will bring to future Phase 3 films. Overall it was a great film, 11/10 for me. Highly recommend to watch it twice to fully absorb what goes on in the film. After watching this, you'll automatically know that Infinity War is going to be phenomenal.

Captain America: Civil War is an abundantly-entertaining piece of blockbuster entertainment which gives lie to the notion that an adventure film with lots going on must devolve into chaos. Following the events of Avengers: Age of Ultron, the world has become understandably concerned about gangs of super people destroying bits of the planet every so often. When Bucky Barnes (Stan) is finally brought out of hiding, he becomes the catalyst to allow Tony Stark (Downey Jr.) to bring the world's super people under control, starting with Steve Roger's (Evans) Avengers.Ostensibly an excuse just to get loads of super people to wail on each other for our amusement, Civil War takes the opportunity it has to delve into the people who make up its world while also at least considering the real-world problems actual superheroes (and by intimation, real-world superpowers) would pose if they did whatever they wanted. And it really makes with the super people wailing on each other.A big part of Civil War's strength is its insistence on avoiding the trap of cameos even when many of its characters only show up for two or three scenes. Instead it gives everyone something to do – from Vision (Bettany) and Scarlet Witch's (Olsen) slow bonding to Spider- Man's (Holland) introduction and brush with the big leagues to Black Panther's (Boseman) dogged mission of vengeance – and something to feel (so that we feel it, too), creating a joyful smorgasbord of superhero action that is the most Marvel thing Marvel has ever made.The list of such character-based touches is almost endless and fantastic – Falcon and Bucky's forced partnership, Tony Stark flirting with Aunt May to Peter Parker's extreme horror, Vision trying to figure out how cooking works – with new elements melding seamlessly into the new. Spider-Man and Black Panther are organically accepted into the whole, particularly Panther who is well connected to the main plot, as the various characters work not only within themselves but as part of the whole.

I wondered what new and fascinating storyline can Captain America come up that will overshadow the flaws of MCU's Phase-2 especially Age of Ultron.Just saw the movie & I feel nobody talking about the emotional aspect of the movie which I feel appealed the most. When Captain America confessed to Tony Stark(not as Ironman but as a friend) that he knew about the murder of his parents was committed by his beloved friend Bucky, I was shell shocked & equally felt betrayed and sorry for Tony Stark. I could easily relate to suffering and decisions of each character in the movie. I was punched right in the heart with some pretty emotional scenes towards the end, that was purely new for a MARVEL movie.It had every element from humour(if u think Antman was funny, u gotta watch this one) to emotions to purely flawless and jaw dropping action sequences(the infamous airport scene is absolutely great to watch nd equally full of humour).This is the best MARVEL movie till date with some great direction, cinematography, new characters and kick- ass action.

Review title: Must watch more than 2 times if you love comics
Review_body: Warning, Contains a little bit of spoilers here & there.. Before I start this, lemme tell you one thing. I'm a great self- confessed fan of Batman and my favorite movie so far is Dark Knight. If you were to ask me to rate the comic book movies of all time I'd put Dark knight in number 1 position and rest of the comic book movies at number 2 position. But after watching Civil war, I'm changing my list a little. Captain America civil war to be included in number 1 position along with Dark knight and rest of the comic book movies at number 2. Reason, why? Well you gotta watch the movie to understand. Antman and Spiderman steals the show with ease. Every frame where they appear is simply awesome. Black Panther character is highly justified with almost near identical costume as how he appears in comics and Boseman's Panther steals the show. Giant man does appear in movie but why he becomes a giANT man, sorry guys, can't spoil that. Wait till the end of the movie to catch the glimpse of homecoming. My fav is TeamCap but I don't think it matters. At the end of movie, when you finally walk out of theatre, you'll fall in love with every single character, especially Winter Soldier.

Review title: Charming of Captain America Civil War
Review_body: Captain America is most charming for its calmer moments, and for its more personal embellishments, similar to Scarlet Witch's capacity to make modest tongues of fire jump from fingertip to fingertip, or even only the way Evans' Captain America, solidified in the '40s just to be defrosted in a peculiar, present day world, dependably watches a little groggily strange, as though he'd truly want to listen to Sinatra. What's more, there's a sublime new expansion, Chadwick Boseman's Black Panther, an African sovereign turned confounding crime fighter. As both man and feline, he's patrician and cleaned, a touch of class cushioning discreetly onto the scene. Like him, Civil War, taking care of business, is blessedly light on its superhero-booted feet.Watch the movie and enjoy your time. Please visit http://moviecaptainamericacivilwar.com/

No spoilers here either. The film was action packed from beginning to end. With a movie this good, it's hard to pick a side in this Civil War. Whether you're a fan of Cap or Stark, you will find plenty to enjoy in this movie. I was pleasantly surprised with the latest Spiderman and Marisa Tomei was perfectly cast in the small role of Aunt May. As always, there are moments of comic relief from The Avengers, especially Spidey and Ant-man. Leave the younger kids at home though; lots of heavy action scenes and language inappropriate for the little ones who will beg to see it.Bravo to Marvel for making this one of it's best offerings yet!

Review title: No matter how much good you've heard about this movie, you cannot "oversell it"
Review_body: Captain America; Civil War demonstrated,.. The best superhero action any generation has ever viewed. If you are are true Captain fan, and your concerned about him sharing screen time, I assure you, there is more Captain tear-downs than in any of his other movies. That being said, the movie also showcases the very best sequences from many other formerly introduced Marvel characters. The new characters as well, got better treatment than some may have felt about "Age of Ultron", (for me personally), where I felt I got just a taste of Vision and Scarlet Witch, and a very dead Quicksilver. The most emotion we have seen from any Marvel movie, and very delicately handled. If you have any feelings for the characters that have been build up over the years, you will probably shed a tear or two. Vision and Scarlet become more solidified which was very satisfying. I went into Civil War with Black Panther very low on my excited about list, but I must say, he was impeccably cast, and added a great deal of heart, (as well as major action) to the movie. An absolute "win" for his introduction, and I actually look forward to his 2018 solo film. The most diverse and well played superhero interaction we've seen to date. A gripping plot that will have you riveted from the very start. This movie has more depth than what I was led to believe from the clips, interviews, and reviews. Get your snacks and empty your bladders because you will be cemented to your seat.

Review title: Tired of the need for "Damaged" Heroes.
Review_body: I'm not even going to get into the plot or events as they are played out. I'm sickened by this movie just like Superman v Batman. Seriously? We can't find enough bad guys, no, we have to take our heroes and tear them apart. Pitting two of our more famous "good guys" against each other brings out the worst in them. Alas it doesn't just bring out the worst in them, simply by forcing other heroes to take sides we ruin their reputations as well. "Heroes" fighting against "Heroes" shows us we really don't have any heroes left to root for. Thanks for ruining our heroes for us. Bottom line in the Marvel Universe? There are NO good guys. Just shades of bad.

Review title: Dumpster fire for a plot, then spiderman comes in and saves it
Review_body: Massively disappointed in civil war. Considering how amazing winter soldier was, this was at times a dumpster fire. Plot is a mess. Zemo as the villain is pathetic and the convoluted time table he creates to get what he wants is just ridiculous. Tom Holland though as Spider man was perfection. Truly saved the movie. And Paul Rudd as Ant Man. Nothing else I can say. It's a throw away summer movie and meh. Very very disappointed. I do not want to give anything away, but when the big reveal at the end happens, well you are just left saying "really ? Are you kidding??". My lord what can I say about the ridiculousness of Vision in a cardigan sweater and slacks. And even crowbarred in the potential love blossoming between Scarlet Witch and Vision. Maybe a smidge better than age of Ultron, but a world worse than Winter Soldier.

Review title: A comment for Turkish readers and all others... sry guys
Review_body: I don't know what i can say or what i should say but in my opinion it was very boring and (like the other comments say)it was not the best marvel film,its a overrated teenage film, i didn't like the action things either... You know i look it in 3D and in every punch, the camera rotates 2-3 times my eyes get tired, and i became eye cancer.. No soundtrack or anything else what can you cheer up at fighting only to much superheros who they try to make their power in balance... standing 6 vs 6 in a row and with the "ding ding ding" they run at each other ... you know they compares it with BvS i saw that too 2 months ago and i can remember every fight scene and there was epic moments (like "Do you bleed" and all the other battle quotes) but here .. i cannot, the only flop's in the film is Spiderman and Black panther, and I'm a Black panther fan, Spiderman was very good, but all the others shouldn't be in the film, there was too much and it was not a "Be" for all them, you can explain the storyline in 20 seconds and i couldn't stand it in the theater... i even forget a time that there was a villain, and they say "great moves" and other things... nah, widow again with his leg around neck turning back flip moves what we see in every films she appears a 20 time, vision at the fight with only two lame laser shots, you know when you saw deadpool you cant laugh at the little jokes in here, the travel and the place switches they couldn't do it,captain fights at Africa a time 2 seconds later he is in a funeral ... you know, are my expectations to high?i don't know, the only thing i can remember panther, winter and capt. Can run faster than vehicles and twice then usain bolt sry marvel fans I'm a big comic book-film fan but this was not what we need ..

A perfect recipe. you will be happy to watch the movie.Then there are new members in avengers group, just loved it. Strong screenplay. Adrenaline action. Perfect humour. Every one knows with whosoever with the Avengers are fighting, no one in the world can, if the Avengers won't save them there would be much more causalities, is it not good if they get save a fraction?I accept that they let Ultron destroy sokovia, but if they have not took an action everything might have end..so there's a bit sense lacking that such a big organisation like UN would actually not do, blaming Avengers, instead of seeing what they have done for all.I'm with Cap.All hail Cap!Got really amazed at the end when it came to know that bucky killed Howard and Maria Stark, and it was the only sense part of the movie for Tony getting angry and beating Buck.But overall the movie lacked sense, they prisoned the mighty heroes who saved the world.

Hi Guys,I just saw the movie, and is by far the most beautiful movie of the series. It has action, very good screenplay and very strong characters and viewpoints. It shows that anyone can lose in war, and that bad sh....it happens whenever you like it or hope it shouldn't happen. all characters are pictured OK except the cat dude that was too simple and very idiotic in his thoughts. For the director to put such a low minded person within a strong position see miss placed. He doesn't seem to have merited the position he had there in first place, as a person at that stage in life knows better than blind revenge. This is magnified in the view that the his father seemed to be far better in logic than the son, and it is showed that he had good relations to his father. Being shown that he has not got a part from his fathers knowledge confirms that the character, is in a much lower level in logic and miss placed in the movie. Hope we can see better ones in the future, who knows :) ;)Timi,

I found myself observing this film with a feeling of mild amusement, pondering over how the hell this franchise has gained so much traction and popularity. Smash, punch, abominable one-liner, rinse, repeat.The traditional elements of a superhero movie have been totally removed, replaced by unrelatable shiny suits and often totally unexplained superpowers. Personal growth, strength in the face of adversity, finding you've got something special when you feel ordinary: that's a superhero movie.Give me Deadpool, GOTT or the original Spiderman. Give me some depth, story, even a touch of reality.They might as well have filmed this whole movie in a wrestling ring and saved a few million dollars. I'm sure the kids that bump it up to a shocking 8.5 on IMDb would still be quaking with excitement behind their 3-D specs.

Review title: Fun, movie but not as great as people are making it seem
Review_body: I'm not bias. I like DC and Marvel. I honestly like BVS better than this movie, and thought Winter Soldier was way better too. This movie felt so lazy honestly. I think people are just obsessed with Marvel, and their cheesy/corny one liners in every scene. The villain in this movie sucks, and it's all about making them split up or whatever his goal is, due to his loss. I watch every superhero movie, regardless if it's DC or Marvel, and like I said BvS is way better than this movie, and had me more interested in the story and plot. Winter Soldier had the same effect on me. I think the majority of obsessed Marvel fans are just liking this movie because it's Marvel and the characters, but if you take the time to look deep in the movie, you will notice at the very end, what the heck was the point of all this. Black Panther was the only character I was interested in seeing, and he barely got any screen action. The movie should have been called Team Iron Man or Team Cap. A. Some of the fight scenes also look so cartoonish, I don't know what that was about. The conflict between all of them seems very stupid to me, since there has been all sort of cities destruction, and killing in every movie, and now they want to address the same bs again in this one, by showing what someone can do when they take someone they love from them due to war.Other than that, if you're just looking for the same ol' Marvel cheesy/corny one liners, and action go see it. It's a fun movie, but not one I would go see twice, as I did with BvS, and Winter Soldier.

This is the worst possible movie marvel can take after batman vs superman.. Even though it is named as captain America, it is a sequel to ultron, and director has possibly thought by the inclusion of all super heroes, the film would be a success, then guess he should be thinking again.. This movie is all about vengeance, don't wanna put any spoilers of course, and lastly they spoke about friendship, which means the climax should have been unnecessary if they really took friendship into consideration. Vengeance, glamorous fights, super heroes, without any story is what i will say.. Best part is spider-man's comedy, and apart from that, this movie is totally a waste of time.

I normally don't write reviews, but this movie was AWESOME. First, I want to address the villain. I am not sure why people have a problem with him, but I think he's brilliant. His vendetta had nothing to do with a power grab or world destruction, it was all personal. For the most part, he did exactly what he intended and used the perfect scapegoat. This movie has much of the action and comedy we've come to expect of Marvel, but this goes a bit deeper. We've seen all the glory of being a super hero and now we get to examine the consequences of being a hero. I love love love this movie from start to finish. I think I may go see it again! 😍😍😍

Contains Spoilers: As a huge fan of the comics i was waiting for marvel to introduce the civil war in the avengers movies. I haven't been a fan of their last one or maybe the one before that. But lemme say that Marvel has snowballed farther down than I expected. 1. They didn't even get half of the story right due to the fact that S o n y owns part of some marvel characters but still there are a lot of things that could have been better 2. I was so livid that they took creative liberties on spider man. He was not recruited by Stark nor did anyone underestimate him in the team Even though they changed so much to get around S o n y it ended up ruining the whole marvel story line.They would have been better off waiting to release the whole story line for the marvel civil war way later. The acting was decent however most actors seemed tired of playing their roles. One last thing was the genre change to fit a more dramatic style of movie was horrible.

Review title: not as good as my expectation
Review_body: I was a big fan of DC, especially the dark knight trilogy.But I will try as objectively as possible.yeah this film is pretty good, better than the BVS, but will only be able to score seven for me. The story is anticlimax, especially after the team war. If I knew the final scene is just about iron=man being beaten by captain America the winter soldier, I will leave the cinema after the fight between team captain America and iron-man team. yeah I'm disappointed, why the smart enemy, which can masquerade as winter soldier, and psychologists do not evoke the other super soldiers? when said many soldiers as strong as captain America and winter soldier are there. Why just make avenger fight each other? if he was not able to beat the avenger, why not use a super soldier? I was hoping when captain America beaten by iron-man, suddenly he was attacked by some super soldiers, when captain America almost lose the support of other avenger come. the film is still pretty good, but only until the team war scene

I was so excited for the movie. Its maybe i expected a lot but whatever it was a good marvel movie but not the best.I did like the spider man stuff and zemo was one messed up guy really. After an awesome movie like Avengers Age of Ultron we expected even a lot more. I also like the RAFT and how they try to keep the Avengers locked inside of it. The movie did had many funny moments like cap sharing a kiss with agent 13 (Sharon Carter - yeah the niece to the Agent Carter cap's now officially deceased ex).

Review title: Another killer movie in the Marvel Cinematic Universe
Review_body: This is a spoiler free review so please read for information regarding if its okay for kids to watch and if its a good movie(WHICH IT IS). Alright hi, Where do i start? This is a another amazing super hero movie which is totally different from an average super hero movie. This movie is like Avengers 2.5 and I would rather have this be the Avengers movie from last year which was Age of Ultron which was disappointing. Age of Ultron was setting up way too many future movies coming out like the third Thor movie. Age of Ultron was going in a million directions and you would be clueless and ask questions like Why is he in the movie if he isn't related in any way to the story line? However this movie was on topic and had a great story and by the end of the movie you would be like that all made sense. Now lets dive in and see what made this movie amazing. After the events of Captain America The Winter Soldier and Avengers: Age of Ultron, we see our hero Captain America doing his job which is saving people. Captain America alongside with the other Avengers: Black Widow, Falcon, and Scarlett Witch and the last two have become Avengers now, are on a mission when suddenly something bad happens and a building blows up with people in it. 170 countries unite and create the Sokovia Accords which states that any super hero must sign this and register their information just in case something bad happens and you don't get the blame for it. Captain America thinks its a bad idea (which I will not spoil why). While Iron Man thinks its a great idea( Which I will also not spoil). Then it becomes small argument which then becomes a "war' when a bombing happens and Bucky Barnes aka the Winter Soldier gets the blame for it. Captain America knows it wasn't him and goes against the law to protect his best friend. This movie introduce two major characters who I already started loving right when they got on screen. Spider Man who I thought was like the best character of the movie right next to Captain America and Black Panther who was a bad-ass. Both just fit in the movie and made everything perfect. Spider Man was hilarious and when he came in the movie and enchanted his stuff, I was like he is what made this movie one of the best. Black Panther was a bad-ass. When they introduced him in the movie, he was being fired at by a helicopter and bullets bounced right off his suit and I was just blown away. Im not going to spoil anything else so please go watch this movie. Sadly there was one flaw of the movie, the villain. Yeah there was a small villain who didn't have a costume but in the comics he's amazing! In the movie he isn't :(. Im talking about Baron Zemo who wasn't appealing at all and has a terrible backstory but is a really good mastermind! You will see why in the end of the movie. The action in this movie blew my mind away, the airport scene was one of the best action scene I have scene in my whole life, it was beautiful, well choreographed action and each character got their own solo part which told us why we grew up loving them. So please I cannot stretch it enough to go watch this movie. IS IT OKAY FOR THE KIDS? Yes its perfectly fine just like a couple of uses of S--T which you barely hear so its fine and there was this one quick kiss that wasn't teasing any kind of sexual interaction, just a sweet kiss and was funny, you will know when you see it. This movie also has great positive messages from Captain America like you don't leave anyone behind. Chris Evans has done it again as Captain America and told me why Cap is my favorite superhero. So please go watch this movie and have a great day!

Review title: A decisive Superhero vs. Superhero extravaganza!
Review_body: Captain America: Civil War is essentially like a battle royale between superheroes like one has never seen before. And that too, in a way that doesn't bludgeon your senses into numb submission, like some other superhero films we've seen of late! It's full of sensational action packed scenes which prove to be an eye treat for action and the comic lovers! Iron Man and Captain America's showdown is just one of the many that will keep you absorbed in the movie. This fast-paced, intimate film is full of happy surprises; Tom Holland's Spider-Man is one. The scenes with Tom Holland's Spider-Man and Chadwick Boseman's Black Panther are some of the best in the film. They lead up to their individual movies and prove Marvel's true superpower is its casting. The movie perfectly vindicates the awesomeness of Captain America's trilogy.

Review title: Some great fight Scenes but a stupid plot!
Review_body: I first came to see the reviews before watching the movie. And when I saw that most of them were above 8/10 I said this is a must see movie. But while I sat down watching it I told myself WDF is happening.!The story line is too girly. Lots of people crying. Always too much care for the humans. Yeah they will die, yeah there will be collateral damage, but what if the heroes didn't help at all. One scene you will see Vision reading on a paper, to prepare some food, a receipt. While he has the brain of a Super Computer and can be connected throughout the world, babysits a girl who will send such a powerful being 100m under the earth! WHAT, seriously this guy has an infinity stone for nothing! Some fight scenes are so stupid. Captain America holding a helicopter down with his bare hands while standing on a heliport. I didn't know he weigh 20tons! Ant man being a giant but when he throws a kick it is in slow motion! Spiderman got younger and more stupid!All this to end up with a guy who wanted to destroy the avengers just for revenge and got Iron man,Winter Soldier and Cap America in a bunker to show him a Video of who killed his parents. Couldn't he have just sent a simple mail. Very very bad movie!! Watch this at home,doesn't deserve your time to go to the Cinema!

WARNING: This review may contain spoilers. This is the first time I write s review in the IMDb site. Captain America: Civil War is amazing, action packed and have incredible visual effects. The story is great, the acting is great, everything is great. Marvel did it again! I'm a big fan of superhero movies and I was really looking for this movie, when I finally got the chance to see it I was completely amazed. My expectations for this movie were huge and it still blew me away, far better that I expected it to be. All the characters are great, specially Ant-Man, Black Panther and of course Spider Man. Tom Holland is great as Peter Parker, you will end up loving his portrayal as spider man. In resume: great movie with enough action and humor and it surely will please Marvel fans, and even people who don't are big fans of superhero movies. Looking forward to Spider-Man: Homecoming. Anthony and Joe Russo did a great job and I'm sure that Infinity War is in good hands.10/10Thanks for reading!

Marvel does it again! What an excellent superhero movie, a must-see! This movie was everything I hoped Civil War to be. In addition to what you'd expect to this kind of "action" movie, the characters have a depth that is very palpable adding a psychological side to the story. The screenplay is nicely tied up, the action scenes very well choreographed and there is an amazing chemistry between the ensemble cast. Great acting too, the characters were spot-on! This movie is not your average good versus evil movie. It's much more a fight between ideologies which was really interesting to see. You see the Avengers split into two different sides and it is interesting to see the complexity behind their respective approach toward saving the world. I love the Marvel movies and this one is by far my favorite.

I had a great experience, great movie with good effects I watched this movie in IMAX 3d and the CGI is out of the world, some scenes may lack this is only reason I rated it 9 of of 10 otherwise it's hard to find a negative point.This movie have everything, emotion, drama, great action scene and also good story line. I would suggest people who all aren't marvel fan, please read background story of the characters who all are in this movie which will help you to enjoy this masterpiece from Russo Brother. I personally enjoyed a lot because I am a marvel fan, lot of people will say it's boring and they will try to compare it with Dc's batman vs superman, but it's completely different. Don't listen to anyone guys go for it.

Review title: One of the best movies so far...
Review_body: May contain spoilers from movies and/or civil war event from the comic books. Definitely contains spoilers.Not only in movies among MCU or even movies based on comic books, Captain America Civil War is a great movie in general. I didn't expect it to be a comic book civil war. How could it be? They have no X-men or Fantastic Four or the New Warriors (Stamford incident which gave a huge boost to superhero registration act) even Spiderman came in late.. I was more leaning towards a political thriller. But it wasn't as much a political thriller even. It was a very close and personal movie with such emotional core. The emotional drive of characters like Tony Stark(due to death of his "mother", Bucky killed his parents yeah,though it is the third act when things were just starting to looking to settle down. Surprise!! Bucky killed Howard and Martha was it? No it was uh... Tony's mother,yeah. and captain America already knew.) and Steve Rogers(who never gives up on his friend Bucky) as well as the antagonist Dr. Helmut Zemo is what gets the story going, later with a different story than that of comics. He is emotionally driven to tear avengers apart and rather than using brute forces ,he plays a manipulator. He is a sympathetic character, you can say that...he is not that much in the screen maybe Marvel is setting him for a bigger arc in another Project. Even though it has a larger ensemble it is still a Captain America movie at it's core. There were some plot holes, yes! but I can look past that. It was a very hard job to accomplish but the new characters felt like they just fit in the MCU; Bravo Russos!! Spiderman , Black Panther and Ant-man were the newer characters introduced to the bigger universe , granted Ant-man already had his solo film. This has got me so excited for upcoming Marvel projects. Wish movies would address just a bit of what's going on with TV universe. Even vague remarks would do. One line is just what i am asking for.

Review title: As exciting as a senate hearing
Review_body: Captain America: Milking the Franchise.There are rumors that the Hollywood movie industry manipulates the IMDb ratings (this is going to get me banned so I might as well stop typing) and the score for this movie does not in any way make these rumors less plausible, en contre, I am now convinced it is so (this is my own personal opinion based upon no facts whatsoever, even tho the facts are there to be checked, I claim no knowledge of such undeniable facts). Plausible deniability - Check.Ever since my long days of boredom in all my years of school, I have wanted to experience the ultimate experience in boredom. I'm talking about the kind of boredom that stops time. I looked long and hard, I signed up for boring jobs, got boring friends and went to boring parties. You know the usual stuff. Nothing could scratch my itch for boredom. I had to go deeper, and deeper I went. I was looking at the UN website trying to find a nice boring hearing of ca 2 hours and 27 minutes, which happens to be the length of this movie, but I couldn't find any. Earlier I was looking into US senate hearings on some boring subject such as Foreign Relations, yummy I always wanted to be bored to death on US relations to some backwater Kingdom somewhere in the middle of wherever. BUT, I found this movie instead and boy oh boy was I BORED. This hit the spot! I'm amazed at how bored I was. I wanted to walk out, but the boredom had propelled me into an out of body experience where I could not control my body, I could only watch my self bored literally out of my skull sitting there bored. This is like bored-ception.Anyway, now I no longer owe Satan 2 hours and 27 minute of my life time due to that bet we had a while a ago.What about the movie and the things that were happening in the movie? Surely the action was good at least? Well, if you've been in a coma for the last 100 years, then the person watching your comatose body for 100 years would be less bored than watching this movie. To illustrate the action: I have seen cars before, so when someone comes at me with another car, I'm not impressed. The action in this movie is an excellent mid-range car that will ultimately not turn any heads. You have seen the action done better somewhere else. But, if you are a boredom affectionado like me then you have to watch this movie in 3D. Now you can be bored in three dimensions!There was some kind of moral message, that we should always do something that is not the wrong thing even tho it might appear to be not the right thing to others at the one before second sight and friendship as well... Also civilian deaths were like maybe not bad but not really good either? In the end I wanted everyone to die to spare us the rest of the movie.

The War of Heroes! Captain America - civil war Made in 2016 Directors - Russo brothers 5 star rating Before I watched the film I wasn't expecting much but after I watched it for the first time the first thing I thought was this film is phenomenal! This film is a science fiction, fantasy, adventure, thriller, and an action film. Captain America – civil war is about a team of extraordinary super enhanced heroes who help the world from evil. The team is split into two (Captain America's team and Ironman's team) after the government try to control them by making them sign the Sokovia accords, this would mean that the government could decide when they can help and when they can't. Captain America and his team think that they shouldn't sign the accords as they need to take responsibility for their actions and what if someone is in trouble and the government say he can't go help? He would never forgive himself for going nothing if something bad happened. Ironman and his team think that they need to be put in check so that less innocent people are hurt, he thinks the way to do that is by signing the accords. I liked the film so much because there wasn't too much of one genre, there was just enough to keep me at the edge of my seat. There wasn't too much action, there wasn't too much adventure and it was very well spread across the film. My opinion might be a little biased as I have been a big fan of comics and superhero's since a very young age, but even if you're not a fan of superheroes I think you would like this film just as much as me. In my opinion the film is flawless. The main aim of the film was to entertain the audience and I think they definitely achieved this, so much so that I have watched the film 3 times. My overall opinion on this film is that it was unbelievably amazingly spectacular.

Review title: Sometimes, We Can't All Just Get Along
Review_body: So far, the first star-studded blockbuster of the summer is on the receiving end of more backslapping than the Avengers are fists to the face – which is saying something. And, as someone who whole-heartedly agrees with much of the effusive praise coming in, I'll do my best to preserve the experience by limiting plot reveals and potential spoilers when sharing my thoughts.The backdrop of the film is actually pretty straightforward (and all in the trailers, so this isn't much of a spoiler): over the course of their existence (and several films), the Avengers have left a wake of collateral damage as they try to save the world from increasingly formidable threats. Following the events of Avengers: Age of Ultron, world governments are pushing for the ratification of the Sokovia Accords – an international law that would limit the unilateral actions of the Avengers.There some on the Avengers, led by Tony Stark aka Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr.), who are ready to accept the limitations, both to possibly lessen guilt for past actions and to stave off a worse alternative. As I'm sure you've guessed there are others, led by Steve Rogers aka Captain America (Chris Evans), who see the accords as political interference that is potentially damaging to the effectiveness and morality of the Avengers.This division is just the beginning of the rift.Captain America has always been the straight-as-an-arrow superhero, sticking to his metaphorical guns and remaining fiercely loyal to his friends. Unfortunately, that includes Bucky Barnes aka the Winter Soldier (Sebastian Stan). The victim of Hydra brainwashing and a perceived enemy assassin, Bucky becomes a sticking point that only drives a wedge further between Cap and Tony.As the conflict, driven by a mysterious new player, comes to a head, the rest of the Avengers are forced to side with either the man in the suit or the man with the shield.At this point I'll ask: can't we all just get along?In short, no – but for good reason. What sets Captain America: Civil War apart in the superhero genre is its willingness to get its hands dirty on a more human level. The film really digs into painful character memories and creates all new friction, testing the bonds of friendship, romantic relationships, and so much more.The reason this is technically a Captain America film and not another Avengers? I'd say mostly because Cap is central to the biggest tests. Cap and Tony. Cap and Bucky. Cap and Carter. You get the idea.With so many characters and an endless supply of action packed into two and half hours, the film (and attempting to review it) can seem daunting. But to their credit, the Russo brothers were up to task.Having previously directed the widely regarded second Captain America film Captain America: The Winter Soldier, Anthony and Joe Russo only reinforced their reputation as some of the best in the genre, artfully blending fisticuffs with feelings. Writers Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely also returned (having worked on both of the first two Captain America films), lending the continuity, storytelling style, and occasional levity that fans have come to identify with the Captain America franchise.Somehow I've grown long-winded with nary a mention of the slew of new characters. The biggest introduction of the bunch is the cinematic launch of T'Challa aka Black Panther (Chadwick Boseman). A skilled warrior from the technologically advanced African nation of Wakanda, T'Challa is forced to take sides following an encounter with the Winter Soldier (even though he's not an Avenger). We're also reintroduced to Peter Parker aka Spider-Man (Tom Holland), with Marvel opting to use a younger version of the character to great success. Much more a kid, complete with a kid's sense of wonder and view of the world, Holland's Peter Parker offers some well-timed levity. Not to be forgotten is Daniel Brühl's Helmut Zemo, but I'll let you meet him yourself.As for the rest of the cast, extensive though it is, everyone has their own special story arc to avoid being lost in the fray. Natasha Romanoff aka Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson) continues to be the most pragmatic and cool character on screen, which is no doubt part of the reason Marvel has finally committed to giving her a standalone film. Sam Wilson aka Falcon (Anthony Mackie) remains the steadfast Cap supporter, ready to blindly trust his friend. Similarly, on the other side, Rhodey aka War Machine (Don Cheadle) is ready to make the sacrifices necessary to stand by Iron Man and the government. Clint Barton aka Hawkeye (Jeremy Renner) is ever the wildcard, and Scott Lang aka Ant-Man (Paul Rudd) is ever the understated comic relief.*Potentially very mild spoiler – feel free to skip this paragraph until viewing* I mentioned earlier the Cap and Carter relationship test, which pitches Sharon Carter (Emily VanCamp) into an interesting position, but one of the most intriguing relationships is that of Vision (Paul Bettany) and Wanda Maximoff aka Scarlet Witch (Elizabeth Olsen). When we last left Vision in Avengers: Age of Ultron, there were still more questions than answers. Mainly, he's not human, but what does this really mean? He's some type of being, and he's undoubtedly powerful and hyper-logical, but does he experience things the same way as a human? Does he have emotions? This issue is explored in regard to Wanda, whom he feels a connection with – even protective over – as someone unsure of their own powers. Because although Wanda proves herself quite powerful, she too is still figuring out what her power means. ***A quality film overall and among the best in the genre, Captain America: Civil War is a must-see for fans. Just keep in mind: whose side are you on?

I never go to the movies and, very fortunately, this saves me tortuous hours under a stupidly big screen and sub-indirect relations with rude people. The last time I attended a movie theater to see contemporary films was at the launch of that second Hobbit and then now, to accompany colleagues and family at 2 hours and 26 minutes of juvenile bullshit. Not that it was a surprise. The title says Captain America before a colon and Civil War but it is an Avengers spin-off. As such, carries a luggage of poor dialogues, incoherence and overload superficiality, trivializing violence. Oh, don't forget the jokes that helped giving face and arms to a pseudo-cynicism catastrophically used to destroy the integrity of the characters.

Good movie with lots of well-shot action, well executed humour and an interesting dilemma. You do, however, not feel this movie had any consequences - and we kind of find ourselves in roughly the same spot as before. The Avengers, for instance, do take sides throughout the film, and yet it ends saying that "oh we're not REALLY parted after all". The film, instead, should have worked more as a point of no return- thing, so that we felt it mattered and that it had part to play. CA:CW is great movie that - regretfully - didn't really matter.This movie sort of feels like the good version of BvS. This is how you make two (or two group of) protagonists clash together.

It's a good movie so far unless they create a sequel of this story line. The excitement of this film is not consistent. Let say the first and middle part of it is very ecstatic but the last part I think is kind of emotional and left me hanging but that's the great part of commercial movies they left the viewers crave for more. Also the credit part after you watch it, you will definitely say "I'll be waiting for more". Another positive remarks on this movie is, it has a great pick for casting especially for the newcomers; the new spidey, Tom Holland, will be a great Spider-man as what he showed in this movie. I'm a bit anxious on his stand-alone movie. And good line-up of heroes. Overall a good movie but not that great.

Let me begin by saying I was waiting for this movie to come out ever since I saw the Winter Soldier movie. It turns out though the movie was enjoyable, but it didn't do much for the comic book fan in me. * SPOILERS - Don't say you weren't warned *My main grouse was with Tony Stark.. It looked as if he was going through a mid-age crisis.. Perhaps the director wanted to play Tony at one of his low points in life. It also made sense because of the Ultron debacle and Pepper leaving and everything. But Iron man looked distinctly out of character and is manipulated quite easily IMHO and shows no sign of the great Tony Stark. Steve Rogers is steadfastly stubborn and dead set against common reason and firmly believes his old friend must be redeemed. I have heard some people say Bucky represents Steve's dark side, and this movie nails that odd feeling. But the conflict in the beginning between Tony and Steve is not as fluid and clear as one would have hoped to. Collateral damage is a part of the job and one cannot believe that Tony only just realized the other repercussions of their avenging. Natasha's motivations are not clearly explained - is this her way to wipe out red in her ledger? This coming from the person who had to destroy a government agency because it had grown corrupt? It was not convincing at all. Also she disappears leaving her friends to be in jail? Not the Natasha we all know and love.Ant man was there for comic relief and though Paul Rudd does a good job of the "common man superhero" - sometimes you think Ant man had no place in this movie. Spider man is the charming and the talkative teenager you know him to be and does a good job and hopefully is the right Spidey! But the most wasted character was Vision who conveniently disappeared after the airport fight. Tony didn't even call him to accompany him to Siberia (or wherever that was)! The Scarlet Witch looked incredibly powerful to me.. I mean she looked strong enough to take on entire Iron Man's arsenal. In her case she has no choice but to join Cap's team, since the government want her to be responsible for her (accidental) actions. Clint returns because he has to repay a debt (i.e. to Pietro ) and winds up in jail. He is one of the more convincing characters.My most favorite character was the Falcon, who was both trying to be Cap's voice of reason and right hand man Both Bucky and Sam, and their unwavering loyalty to Steve are endearing, and they look like a close knit boys club. I loved their car scene!Bucky looks like a man on edge who would be rightly so.. but I felt the remorse was underplayed and it was mostly the self-preservation instincts of the Winter Soldier that we got to see.. At the end when Steve is helping Bucky, he could have at least looked guilty.. I was however happy seeing Sebastian Stan get so much screen time as compared to the Winter Soldier.. It seemed in all the Captain America movies, he is the one who looks totally different in each one.The Black Panther has got its rightful actor and I cant wait to see how his solo movie plays out.As of the villain, well, nobody thought about him too much. A waste of Daniel Bruhl.The hand to hand combats were great - which IMHO is much better action to watch than things exploding in air.In conclusion, Tony and Cap's fight became real (and personal) at the end I felt, the registration was not a very strong topic that could have driven such walls among friends.

Review title: Great movie, fantastic actors and script.
Review_body: this movie the can make mood so serius but in next shot so full of humor its great. before the battle at airport it wasn't full of humor and not really serius. battle on airport was mostly funny and great its almost criminal but once rhodey got hit mood changed in a second. after that there were some funny moments but still is really sad even most funny stuff are sad. movie is so great its criminal and everybody should go watch it. only thing is by the end is so sad my mood after i left i was sad. movie made clear difference of sides and who was wrong and who was right and personally i think stark was right and after he found out who killed his dad and mom cap should comply with him and not be his enemy.

People were hyping the crap out of tho movie, so I figured I'd go see it today. Long story short, this was the first time I actually got bored at the theater. The 3D was good, the action sequences were pretty cool, and the camera-work includes some neat shots. Where Civil War falls short is an extremely boring first half. The payoff is good towards the second half with spiderman and more action, but the story gets derailed and all over the place. Not only is the story confusing and all over the place, the many slow parts of the movie just made things boring. I mean REALLY slow parts. The villain is a Russian guy apparently and not at all important to the movie, only appearing for about 10 minutes and not showing any real significance. Speaking of which, no characters showed any significance besides iron man, despite being called captain America. Had this just been Avengers 3, it might have made more sense. Captain America was there, but most of the focus was on iron man and every other character felt like cameos besides bucky and captain America. I had to give this a 6 though, because even though there are some seriously slow parts and plot holes abundant, plus an odd choice of casting (why is aunt may like 35 years old?), the film has good action and I really liked spiderman and black panthers appearances, as they really added some weight to the movie.

Review title: perfect movie dealing with themes of friendship; family
Review_body: CA: Civil War is a gift from God. It perfectly mixes in humour and action, all while maintaining a dark tone. Robert Downey Jr. is phenomenal as he once again plays billionaire Tony Stark and weapons-clad Iron Man, only this time packing great emotion into his character and letting us actually see brokenness in his eyes, while Chris Evans delivers as he deals with the moral issues of standing up or going against his closest friends. There is a brilliant plot twist at the end (no spoilers) and true fans of the Marvel Universe: I warn you, bring tissues. Exceeds in every aspect; great story, great acting, great visuals, etc. Makes BvS look like a joke.

Review title: Lots of Action, Too many sub plots, Great but over-hyped
Review_body: There are a lot of intense action scenes but they are not as detailed, unique, and intriguing as they are being praised for. To elaborate, the fight scenes seemed to be fairly average hand to hand combat that gave me the impression that I had seen all those sequence of moves done before on the big screen. In other words seen one seen them all. After a few days of processing my thoughts about the movie I came to the conclusion that many characters were not even necessary and could have been omitted all together along with their side story/sub plots. For example, the Vision, Ant-Man, Spider Man, and (dont kill me, hear me out) Black Panther all could have been left out of this movie and we would probably love it the same. Don't get me wrong they were all awesome in their own way yet they were also somewhat insignificant to the main plot that they could of all been introduced right before the main fight scene, like Spidey, to do their dirt really. The business side of this movie was evident that they just wanted more characters to push box office sales. Introducing black panther felt very "thrown in there" like. There was no mystery to it, just a "hey, oh yeah Im now the King of Wakanda and Black Panther everyone." I think his inaugural debut should have been an origin story seeing as though he is a lesser known hero in the MCU. Vision being in the movie made was a dud. He is far more powerful than he is made out and extremely under utilized when it comes to major threats against his allies, smh, and he misses his target like he isn't an advanced technological superhero. Did Iron Man really need to recruit a 16 year old to help out. Like where was MARK 50-100 right!? I could go on and on about unnecessary characters so back to the story. It was all over the place and you can tell that they picked and pulled from different decades of the original comics to make the story work for the movie, in which there isn't really a super villain....Zemo. It was like the Mandarin all over again in my opinion. That has to be the biggest upset in the story of all. Idk...I give it 2 star for almost staying true in effort and 4 for good action.

If I am the one who opposes to Captain America: Civil War out of thousands of other cinematography fanatics, and even I was an easy- goer in the beginning, then I am not going to let my guns down. I was utterly disappointed with the whole plot errors. The previous two films were roaring success for other to follow its pattern. However, this one just pales into comparison with the others. Captain's actions from all the start was sheer apology in an ironical way (which did not work, sadly). What he did was to defend against what he did, and even if he was above the law, then combating with Iron Man in such fatal manner was the sign of barbarism. Regardless of the ingenious plan of Zemo, his reaction was, in a way, inhuman. I could not understand how could one succeed in his plan to separate the Avengers would like to kill himself after an old recordings of his families? Is he feeling guilty, then why he stated in the near end of the film "did it". I feel so sorry for people who goes for Captain America, but this time what he did was inhumanely repulsive and reverent. Iron Man was deeply bruised all over his mental well-being after seeing his team separated, seeing the horrible tape. And guess who did all these stuffs that may have been avoided by a discussion? The one who got his name in this movie.

THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERSCaptain America Civil War didn't blow me away. It was a pity since I'd been so hyped up for it for nearly a year and... I don't know it just fell flat to me.See the thing with these kinds of superhero vs superhero films is that the point of conflict has to be a gray area where no party is in the write or wrong. It draws in the viewer and keeps them invested. Though I really love captain America I just really found myself not really getting where he was coming from. I just felt like what iron man was doing reasonable and couldn't fathom why people even took cap's side.And Wanda literally just set fire to an entire building and injured hundreds; why is everyone not regarding her as dangerous? And Bucky is dangerous!Trying to get them on their side was the worst idea ever.The only saving grace for this movie was Black Panther and Spiderman. This film could be summed up in one sentence: Tony gets angry because Steve considers Bucky a better friend.

Review title: Came very, very close to topping The Winter Soldier, but the Russo Brothers deliver another great hit in style while having to maintain a great deal of characters
Review_body: !!! Plot Spoilers are in this review!!! !!! Plot Spoilers are in this review!!! Still here? Alright, but it's at your own risk if you still haven't seen this movie! First off I won't compare this to Deadpool, as these are entirely different films in my eyes and should both be praised and appreciated for what they have accomplished. Having seen Civil War twice, I can come to a solid conclusion that Captain America's third solo outing manages to keep up the grade of new superhero films that was set by comic book films like The Dark Knight, The Avengers, Captain America: The Winter Soldier, and Guardians of the Galaxy. The Russo Brothers seem to bring out very, very good, if not great performances out of the MCU actors. Robert Downey Jr. adds yet another layer of depth to Tony Stark, bringing, in my opinion, the best Iron Man performance since the original Iron Man. Chris Evans plays Cap very well, and effortlessly makes the movie seem like a Captain America movie and not Avengers: 2.5. I was skeptical that the teams would be unbalanced due to Iron Man having the Vision and War Machine on his team, but Scarlet Witch more than makes up for her team's relative lack of firepower. She is easily the most powerful character in the movie taking down the Vision, who is powerful in his own right, almost instantly..The airport scene doesn't make the mistake of a Transformers film and has a limited amount of quick cuts, keeping the action in focus.The newcomers Black Panther and Spider-Man, brilliantly played by Chadwick Boseman and Tom Holland respectively, are phenomenal. Holland is easily the best interpretation of Spiderman and Peter Parker (no offense to Tobey Maguire or Andrew Garfield, who were both solid) and steals nearly every scene he is in, bringing a needed youthfulness and the quipping that Spiderman is known for in the comics. And even with so much to maintain, conclude, and set up, the Russo Brothers make sure that it doesn't feel crammed. The only minor setback is Zemo. Daniel Bruhl is amazing in the role, by a lot of coincidences had to happen in order for his plan to work, like Iron Man following Cap and Bucky to his lair. Overall, Civil War is a near perfect comic book movie that is almost as great as TDK or CATWS, but The MCU has a great launching pad for Phase 3 in this film, and the expectations will only grow for Disney-Marvel from here on out.

I Saw Civil War Last night and i loved it. I Think civil war mixes technology with action and that is just so cool. I Loved the way ant man shrank that was just so awesome. It is the best movie ever. It is so good it puts a shame to star wars.I Don't want to tell spoilers because there would be no point in watching it. but i'll tell you who was with iron man and captain America: on iron man's team there was: iron man, vision, black panther,black widow, spider man,war machine. and on cap's team:Captain America,Winter soldier,ant man,falcon,scarlet witch and hawkeye. Also You know in the winter soldier movie brock rumlow? Well he appeared as crossbones Also played by Frank Grillo. I Also liked helmut zemo just because of his accent.

I remember when the news that they were making a Captain America movie years ago, I just didn't see how it could be brought to live without being corny , but here we are 2016 and these movies just keep getting better , also the way they bring the characters and the stories that seem possible in today's world , even when things seem far fetched, anyone can enjoy this franchise , no matter if a kid or adult, or a 75 year old grandmother.
